Para el futuro anhela ampliar sus plantaciones de cacao de manera tecnificada. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, es conciente que el préstamo le será de mucha utilidad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario. Con el crédito solicitado comprará abono y fertilizantes para mejorar sus campos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Misael, 32, is from Quimbiri district.  He’s a good natured, hard working man living in his own house.  He puts in the maximum effort to stand out and provide the best for his family.

From a very early age his parents taught Misael to work the fields so he's cognizant of hard work in the fields.  Misael is a farmer and has 8 hectares of land planted with cocoa beans and coffee.  He’s been working his own lands for 10 years.  During harvest time he hires day workers that help him harvest and transport the picked fruit to the city’s gathering center.  What he enjoys the most about his work is harvesting the fruit because he feels the long months of hard work are rewarded.  However, in winter he has to guard his plants against insect infestations and the constant rain.  In the future he’d like to technologically expand his cocoa bean crops.

This is his 12th loan with MFP; he’s conscious that the loan will be of great use.  He is a very supportive member of his communal bank.  He will use the requested loan to buy manure and fertilizer to improve his farmland.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Miriam Yaqueline

texts.es:
Miriam de 23 años, es una joven emprendedora que hizo el préstamo para poder adecuar su casa.

Ella labora en una Industria Pesquera llamada Santa Priscila donde ella verifica los productos si estan en mal estado o no.Con  la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales do construcción para poder terminar su casa y tener una vida sana con su familia.
texts.en: Miriam, 23, is a young entrepreneur who took out the loan to do some home improvements. She works for a Fishing Firm called Santa Priscila in quality control; she verifies whether or not the products are in good condition.  With help from the loan she will buy building materials and supplies to finish building her house to have a healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Choestancia 2 Group

texts.en:
Doña Elida, Doña Maria and Doña Modesta have joined together to form a solidarity group named Choestancia 2. The group leader, Doña Elida, would like to use her portion of the loan to purchase food ingredients and packaged snacks for her food stall. She has been cooking and selling snack foods for over twelve years and would love the opportunity to grow her business and expand the variety of goods that she offers her customers. One snack which Elida prepares is atol, which is a delicious hot corn based beverage which is very common in the highlands.  Doña Elida started making and selling atol when she was 26 years old. 

Elida is 38 years old, is married, and has nine children. Her husband works as a merchant and helps support the family. She would love to run a large eatery one day with many clients and a diverse menu.

The other two members of the Choestancia 2 Group are involved in traditional clothing sales and animal raising. Both will use their portion of the loan to help grow their respective businesses. This is the group´s first loan through ASDIR.

loans.use: to purchase snacks and ingredients for her food stall.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino de 46 años, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Daria de 38 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo ha conseguido Faustino, son el principal sustento que tiene toda su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que su notoriedad de cosechar las plantas de cacao, plátano y frutas cítricas son de buena calidad, y eso le da ventaja en la venta de estos productos y a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plaga de insectos que pueden perjudicar el desarrollo de sus plantas. Lleva 22 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de frutos a los centros de acopio o venta. En adelante, espera incrementar más plantas de cacao, ya que cuenta con espacio suficiente para sembrar. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre coloca orden en las reuniones. Con el crédito solicitado comprará carretillas y triciclos para trasladar sus productos cosechados hasta su comunidad.
texts.en:
Faustino is 46 years old.  He is a very cheerful and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 38 year-old Daria, and his four beloved children who he would like to provide with a better quality of life.

The sown fields that Faustino has managed to acquire through a lot of effort are the main source of support for his entire family.  His produce is very mucth in demand in the city of San Francisco since it is well known that his cacao, bananas and citrus fruits are very good quality.  This gives him an advantage when he comes to sell his products and they fetch very good prices.  

What Faustino most enjoys about his work is protecting his crops from the pest infestations that can damage his plants' development.  Faustino has been in this business for 22 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting the sacks of fruit to the warehouses and sales centers.  In the future, he hopes to increase his number of cacao plants since he has enough space to sow them.

This is Faustino's 12th loan from MFP and he knows that it will be very beneficial to him in making progress in his work.  Faustino is a very cheerful member of his community bank and he always brings the meetings to order.  He will use the loan he has requested to buy a three-wheeled vehicle and  cart to transport his harvested produce to his community.

loans.use: to buy a cart to transport his harvested produce to his community

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de ropa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo porque al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía como es zapatos, ropa para niño, juguetes y aparatos eléctricos pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que su negocio esta necesitando para tener mas ingresos a su familia ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las gana que obtiene del negocio ya que en el trabajan ella y su esposo.
texts.en: Magdalena has been selling clothes for over four years now.  She is asking for a loan because the business needs more variety of merchandise like shoes, children’s clothes, toys and electronics, but she lacks the necessary money for this investment that her business needs in order to have more family income since this is her only source of income.  She plans to repay the loan with part of her profits from the business since both she and her husband work at it.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and to service her sewing machines.

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es: La Sra. Edita  es casada, tiene 7 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Las Violetas” grupo  conformado por 8  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Edita   trabaja desde hace  15 años en la venta de golosinas en frente de un  colegio este trabajo surge porque ella quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y la manutención de sus hijos ya que lo que su esposo ganaba no era suficiente para mantener a sus 7 hijos  y a su vez trabaja en un comedor popular de cocinera , pero gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejores ingresos económicos , sus hijos pueden ir al colegio ,  se ha comprado algunos artefactos eléctricos y sobre todo su familia tiene una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo que se le otorgo fue para comprar mercadería.  Sabemos que Edita  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Edita is married and has seven children.  She is currently a member of 'Las Violetas' community bank.  This bank has eight members who all work in different business activities.  Edita has been selling candies opposite a high school for 15 years.  This work came about because she wanted to help her husband with their household expenses and in supporting their children since her husband's earnings weren't enough to support their seven children.  Edita also works as a cook in a popular eatery.  Thanks to her effort and commitment, she has managed to make more income, her children are able to go to school, she has bought some electrical appliances and, above all, her family now enjoys a better quality of life.

The loan that Edita was given was to be used for buying merchandise.  We know that Edita will fulfil her goals with a lot of work and effort, and that Edaprospo's loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 30 años, natural de la ciudad de Quimbiri,  convive con Gladis de 23 años y fruto de esa relación tiene 03 hijos y juntos viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina. Juan es campesino, sus padres le enseñaron este oficio desde muy niño, viene trabajando en sus propias tierras hace 10 años donde cultiva plantas de cacao y café de manera tecnificada. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los peones. Sabe muy bien que el dinero que obtiene es por producir buena calidad de frutos. Sus productos de cacao y café los comercializa  en la ciudad de San Francisco y Quimbiri, lugares donde mejores precios le ofrecen por la venta de estos productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los secaderos que están ubicados a 1 horas de caminata. Más adelante desea sembrar más plantas de cacao. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Le gusta trabajar en equipo por lo cual se siente satisfecho por  pertenecer a su banco comunal. El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de madera y calamina ya que tiene planeado refaccionar su vivienda a base de material rustico.
texts.en:
Juan, age 30, is from the city of Quimbiri.  He lives with 23 year old Gladis, and they have three children.  They live together in their own house in the Villa Quintiarina community.  Juan is a farmer.  His parents taught him this occupation when he was a very young boy.  He has been working his own land for ten years.  He makes use of technology to grow cacao and coffee.

He has help from field workers during harvest time.  He well knows that the money he gets is for producing a good quality of crops.  He sells his cacao and coffee products in the cities of San Francisco and Quimbiri.  Those are the places where he can get better prices selling these products.

What he likes best about his work is harvesting the fruits.  He feels that the months of hard work compensate him with the quality of his fruits.  He considers the most difficult part to be transporting the products from the farm to the dryers, located two hours away on foot.  Later he would like to plant more cacao.

This is his 12th loan with MFP.  This support will really help him in the progress of his work.  He is prepared to make his payments on time.  He likes working as a team because it is happy to belong to his communal bank.  The requested loan is to buy wood and corrugated roofing material because he plans to repair his house with rudimentary material.

loans.use: to buy wood and corrugated roofing material

loans.name: Silvia Filomena

texts.es:
Silvia de profesión estilista con varios años de experiencia, pues logro poner su propio negocio un salón de belleza, donde día a día da su servicio, para lograr ganar y cubrir sus gastos.
A si como la mejora a su vivienda, que gracias  a los préstamos que Afodenic está dando ha mejorado la infraestructura, con el crédito anterior era para cambiar el techo pero debido a que no ajusto con el presupuesto, desvió el crédito y hizo el baño con azulejos a si como la compra del inodoro. Lo que con este crédito repara el techo, ya que logro ahorrar parte del dinero, a si como una parte que dieron sus hijos, ya que quiere hacer cambio total, por estar en mal estado. Comprara láminas de zinc, perlines, golosos para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Silvia is a Stylist by profession; she has several years experience since she was able to open her own beauty salon where she provides services daily earning income to cover expenses and improve her home.

Thanks to Afodenic loans she’s been improving its infrastructure.  Her previous loan was to be used to replace the roof but because her budget wasn’t enough she diverted the loan to tile the bathroom and buy a toilet.  She will use this loan to repair the roof since she’s managed to save up part of the money and got some from her children because the roof is in such bad state that she wants to replace it entirely.  She will buy zinc metal sheeting, purlines and screws to start the project.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to replace her entire roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an air compressor and other equipment for painting cars

loans.name: Tzanjuyup Group

texts.en:
Doñas Juana G. M., Jacinta P. H., Francisca O. L., and Cruz H. O. have joined together to form a solidarity group named Tzanjuyup. The group leader, Doña Juana, would like to use her portion of the loan to purchase higher quality thread and ornaments to decorate the aprons which she weaves and sells in her community. She has been selling traditional aprons (called delantales) for 10 years and would like the opportunity to weave a higher quality apron for her clients. When she was 22 years old, Juana started putting together aprons for her personal use and has since developed her business selling her creations to her customers.  

Juana is 32 years old, single, and has one daughter. In the future, she would like to sell a wider variety of high quality aprons in a big store.

The other two members of the Tzanjuyup Group are involved in animal raising and clothing sales. Both will use their portion of the loan to help expand their respective businesses. This is the group´s first loan through ASDIR.

loans.use: to purchase thread and ornaments for apron-making business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an industrial shop vacuum for his cabinetmaking workshop

loans.name: Sop Serigne Bara Group

texts.fr:
Sop Serigne Bara est un groupe de solidarité du Banc Villageois de Artillerie Baax Yaay qui est créé le 27 août 2009; il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier, elles ont comme lien commun le petit commerce et s'entendent bien.

La responsable Madame Nogaye S. est âgée de 49 ans elle a neuf enfants en charge dont quatre orphelins de père et mère. Elle es à l'extrême droite sur la photo habillée de rose blanc avec un châle blanc. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de fruits selon les saisons et la période: des mangues, oranges, mandarines, pastèques et melons. Elle a une expérience de 12 ans dans ce domaine.

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son petit commerce pour avoir beaucoup de revenus.

Elle participe aux dépenses quotidiennes, assure l'habillement des enfants; le reste est à la charge de son mari.
texts.en: The Sop Serigne Bara "Banc Villageois" is a solidarity group in Artillerie Baax Yaay, born on August 27, 2009. The 15 members are women who all come from the same district. Also, they all have small business and get along with each other. Madam Nogaye S., 49 year-old, is the leader of the group. She is in charge of 9 children and 4 of them are orphans. She is on the far right in the picture wearing white and pink cloth. She sells different fruits depending on the season: mangoes, oranges, tangerines, watermelons and melons. She has a 12 years experience in the field and the loan will allow her to strengthen her small business of fruits and to have more income. She participates to the daily expenditures and takes care of the children's clothing. Her husband is in charge of the rest.

loans.use: To buy and resell fruits depending on the season

loans.name: Sop Nabi Group

texts.fr:
Sop Nabi groupe de solidarité du Banc Villageois Artillerie Baax Yaay est composé de 12 femmes qui habitent le même quartier; elles sont parentes, voisines et amies et ont comme principale activité le petit commerce. Il est créé le 27 août 2009.

Madame Boury N. la responsable du groupe est âgée de 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère 5 enfants en charge; (elle est debout à droite sur la photo est habillée en camisole vert et pagne orange) 

Elle fait de la restauration. Elle a une expérience de trois ans dans ce domaine. Elle vend au marché central de Louga.

Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter du riz, de l'huile, oignons et tous les condiments nécessaires pour la préparation du déjeuner et petit déjeuner.

Elle participe aux dépenses familiales pour soutenir son mari et subvenir aux besoins de scolarité de leurs enfants.
texts.en: The Sop Nabi "Banc Villageois" solidarity group in Artillerie Baax Yaay was born on August 27, 2009. The 12 members are women who are related, neighbors or friends and they all have small business. Madam Boury N., 41 year-old, is the leader of the group. She is a married mother in charge of 5 children. She stands on the far right in the picture, wearing green and an orange loincloth. She is in the catering business and has a 3 years experience in this field. She sells the products in Louga's main market. With the loan, she hopes buying rice, oil, onions and all the needed spices to prepare lunch and breakfast. She participates to the family's expenditures to help her husband and take care of her children's schooling.

loans.use: To buy and resell food products for catering purpose

loans.name: Mabis

texts.es:
Mabis C. P. vive en Cimarron de Cartago, es conocidad por ser una mujer muy trabajadora de 44 años .
Ella se dedica  a la agricultura, específicamente a la cria de pollos para la venta. Ella necesita en este momento un préstamo de ₡400 000 (Cuatrocientos mil colones) para la compra de  mas pollos de granja. Con este préstamo ella espera aumentar su producción y con eso su calidad de vida.
Ella es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en: Mabis C. P. is 44, lives in Cimarron de Cartago, and is known to be a very hardworking woman.  She makes her living from agriculture, specializing in raising chickens for resale. She seeks a loan of ₡400 000 (four hundred thousand colones) to buy more chickens for her business. With this credit, she hopes to increase her production, profits and her quality of life.  Mabis is a member of the communal lender Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón, and is one of 110 businesses affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Chotzague Group

texts.es:
Doña Elma Catarina C. S., es casada, tiene 48 años de edad, curso el tercer año de educación secudaria, tiene 4 hijos 2 de los cuales estan estudiando, se dedica a la venta de comida,  lleva 1 año de experiencia en este negocio, inició su negocio vendiendo refacciones, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. 

Quiere ampliar su capital de trabajo, por lo que decide organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo a ASDIR que le servirá para comprar insumos para el negocio de comida que atiende, verduras, carnes, condimentos, maíz, y otros ingredientes necesarios para que su negocio pueda  producir mas ganancias. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo se dedica a la venta de refacciones, atención a una tienda en general y a la crianza de animales. Quiere ver que se negocio sea un comedor mas grande.
texts.en:
Elma Catarina C. S. is married and is 48 years old. She finished the third year of high school. She has four children, two of whom are in school. Elma sells food. She has a year of experience with this business. She began her business selling snacks, and she relies on her husband's help.

She wants to increase her working capital, so she decided to organize a group to apply for a loan from ASDIR. This loan will help her to buy supplies for her food business: vegetables, meats, condiments, corn and other ingredients she needs for her business to produce more earnings.

The other group members work in snack sales, running a general store and raising animals. Elma want to see her business have a larger dining area.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food sales

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Composé de 11 femmes qui sont voisines et ont comme lien commun le petit commerce, le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Diarra est créé le 27 août 2009. Le groupe fait partie du Banc villageois de Artillerie Baax Yaay. 

La responsable Nogaye M. est mariée, âgée de 50 ans et a six enfants en charge. Sur la photo elle est à droite habillée en robe bleue claire et couverte d'un châle jaune.

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, wax, thioub et de bijoux. Elle a neuf ans d'expérience 
dans ce domaine d'expérience. Elle s'approvisionne et vend au marché central de la ville de Louga

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin d'augmenter ses revenus.

Nogaye Mabye aide son mari dans la prise des dépenses familiales et soutient ses enfants dans leur scolarité. Avec ses bénéfices elle augmente ses épargnes.
texts.en: The Sop Mame Diarra solidarity group was born on August 27, 2009 and its 11 members are all women who own small businesses. The group loan is part of the "Banc Villageois" in Artillerie Baax Yaay. Nogaye M., 50 year-old, is a married mother in charge of 6 children and leader of the group. She stands on the far right in the picture wearing a light blue dress with a yellow scarf. She sells cloth, wax (pagnes), thioub (a dyed fabric) and jewelry. She has a 9 years experience in this field. She gets her supplies and resell the products in Louga's main market. The loan will allow her to strengthen her business and increase her revenues. Nogaye Mabye helps her husband with the family's expenditures and their children's schooling. She wants to save the profits she will make.

loans.use: To buy and resell cloth and jewelry

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose  Martínez Mate vive en la comunidad de Cimarrón en Cartago,  y se  ha dedicado toda si vida a la producción de leche.
El en este momento desea aumenta la producción de leche y para que necesita un préstamo de ₡ 500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de una vaquita mas.
Con esto don Jose espera aumentar su producción y así  mejorar la calidad y cantidad  de su producción para mejorar la vida de su familia.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Jose Martínez Mate lives in the community of Cimarrón in Cartago, and he has been working in the area of milk production all of his life.

Now he wants to increase his milk production, and to do this he needs a loan of 500,000 Costa Rican colones to buy another dairy cow.

With this investment Jose hopes to increase both the quantity and quality of his production, and in this way improve the quality of life for his family.

Jose is a member of the "Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón" Communal Finance Institution, one the 110 organizations that are members of EDESA in Costa Rica

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés C.  C. vive en Ostional de Guanacaste, es una mujer emprendedora  y es conocida por sus  deliciosos   “tamales” ( comida tradicional a base de maíz)  que vende desde su casa.
Ella tiene problemas en su casa ya que desde hace días las fuertes lluvias han deteriorado el techo de su casa. Es por eso que ella necesita un préstamo de ₡150 000 ( ciento cincuenta  mil colones) para la compra de Zinc para reconstruir el techo de su casita.
Ella desea poder continuar con su trabajo, lo cual conseguirá gracias a este préstamo.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito  Apoyo Comunal Ostional,  una de las 110 Empresa socias de EDESA en  Costa Rica.
texts.en: Inés C. C. lives in Ostional in Guanacaste.  She is an enterprising woman, well-known for her delicious tamales (traditional corn-based food) that she sells from her house.  She has problems with her house and some days ago, strong rains damaged the roof.  For this reason she needs a loan of ₡150 000 (150,000 colones) to buy zinc panels to rebuild the roof of her little home.  She desires to keep working and a loan will let her do that.  She is a member of the Ostional Credit Support Community Bank, one of 110 such groups of EDESA en Costa Rica.

loans.use: buy zinc panels

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary Luz C. de 44 Años  vive en el municipio de San  Jacinto, en el departamento de Bolívar, donde las manualidades  y las confecciones son actividades generadoras de ingresos,  muy usual entre las mujeres habitantes de esta población  y lógicamente Mary Luz no es ajena a ello,  porque   trabaja en su propio taller de confecciones y tiene un un punto comercial de artesanías propias de la región bien acreditado. Su familia está conformada por su esposo y por sus 3 hijos en las edades de 12 a 24 años de edad, uno de ellos estudia y los otros dos son trabajadores independientes pues han elegido desarrollar su autonomía en todo lo les plantea la vida.
Ella se inicia en el negocio de las confecciones  y en la  venta de artesanías hace 23 años, lo cual aprendió de una tía, lo perfeccionó mediante capacitaciones con el Sena y  lo fortaleció con los financiamientos del Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual ha recibido dos créditos; con su credikiva comprará  artesanías y materiales para el taller de confecciones, inversión segura porque la trabaja sobre los pedidos de sus clientes, especialmente en las épocas de mayor turismo en este municipio.  Mary Luz cuenta que sus financiamientos han logrado aumentarle el capital de trabajo y con ellos sus utilidades que le han permitido hacer mejoramiento de su vivienda y comprar los enseres que ha necesitado su familia. Su sueño se concentra en continuar aumentando sus utilidades mediante su trabajo disciplinado para lograr hacerle mejoramiento a su vivienda hasta dejarla totalmente hermosa.
texts.en:
Mary Luz C. is 44 years old and lives in the municipality of San Jacinto, in Bolivar province, where handicrafts and dressmaking are income-generating activities that are very common among the town's women. It's not surprising, then, to find that Mary has her own dressmaking workshop.  She also has a store where she sells handicrafts that is well-known in the region.  Her family includes her husband and 3 children aged 12 to 24 years.  One of her children is in school, and the other 2 are working independently; they have chosen to develop their autonomy in the face of all that life presents them.

Mary started her dressmaking and handicraft businesses 23 years ago.  She learned to sew from her uncle, and perfected her techniques through training at SENA.  She strengthened her business through loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, from which she has received 2 loans.  With this loan from Kiva she will buy handicrafts and supplies for her sewing workshop.  This is a safe investment because she works based on orders from her customers, particularly in the seasons when there is the most tourism in her area.  Mary Luz tells us that the loans have increased her working capital and her profits, which has allowed her to improve her home and buy household goods needed by her family.  Her dream is to keep increasing her profits through disciplined work, so that she can make improvements to her home until it is absolutely beautiful.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her dressmaking workshop and handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Takku Liggey est composé de 24 femmes. C'est un nouveau groupe du Banc Villageois de Ndame Keur Guiry qui est inauguré le 8 avril 2011. Les femmes habitent ensemble, elles sont amies et voisines et l'activité principale menée est l'embouche mais parallèlement elles font du petit commerce.

La responsable Amy N. est mariée et a un enfant, elle a en charge sa belle sœur qui habite chez elle. Elle est debout à l'extrême droite sur la photo habillée en tenue striée marron blanc.

Elle fait de l'aviculture et de l'embouche mais parallèlement fait du petit commerce de riz; elle a trois ans d'expérience dans ces domaines.

Le prêt lui permettra d'acheter un mouton, des poussins et des aliments pour continuer son activité d'aviculture.

Avec les bénéfices par ses différentes activités elle participe à la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille tout en constituant une bon épargne au niveau du Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Takku Liggey is composed of 24 women. This new group was inaugurated on April 8, 2011 and is part of the Banc Villageois of Ndame Keur Guiry. The members live together; they are friends and neighbors, and while their main activity is the fattening of animals, they also engage in small trade.

Amy N. is the group leader. She is married with one child, and she supports her sister in law, who lives with her. Amy is seen at the far right in the photo dressed in a maroon and white striped outfit.

Amy practices sheep fattening and poultry farming, and also sells rice as a sideline. She has three years of experience in these activities. 

This loan will allow her to buy a sheep, as well as some chicks and animal feed for her poultry farming business. 

With the profits earned from her various activities, she helps to pay for the family’s expenses while adding to her savings with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy sheep and chicks to raise and sell

loans.name: José  Isaac

texts.es:
José tiene 51 años de edad, es casado y  reside junto familia en el sector Cercado Villa de Sol del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zonas urbanas marginales que carecen de servicios básicos.

José se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería, esta actividad la realiza hace 6 años, por ello conoce a la perfección este rubro y debido a su buen trabajo lo recomiendan sus clientes han hecho que su negocio se haga conocido y que cuente con una clientela fija.

José desea realizar mejoras en su vivienda y solventar gastos personales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old, is married, and lives with his family in the Cercado Villa de Sol sector of José Leonardo Ortiz District. This is one of the most populated districts of the Lambayeque region and is characterized by high poverty levels since the people generally live in underdeveloped urban areas that lack basic services.

José works as a bricklayer. He has been doing this for six years, so he knows the field perfectly. Because of his good work, his customers recommend him, which has made his business well-known, and he has steady customers.

José wants to make improvements to his home and cover personal expenses. Because of this, he decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 new soles, which will help him to reach his goal.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house

loans.name: Juana Irma

texts.es:
Juana tiene  59 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en una zona urbana marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada al norte del Perú.

Se dedica a la venta de cerveza a sus vecinos y personas que visitan la zona, los fines de semana la venta de cerveza aumenta. El negocio es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de este se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Juana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más cerveza, y realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda con la finalidad de construir un ambiente donde pueda ofrecer sus productos.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Juana is 59 years old, is married and lives with her family in an underdeveloped urban area of the city of Chiclayo. This is a very commercial area located in northern Peru.

She sells beer to her neighbors and to people who visit the area; beer sales increase on the weekends. The business is very helpful to her family since through it Juana takes on the responsibility of helping to support the family daily.

Juana wants to expand her business by purchasing more beer and making some improvements to her home. Her goal is to build an area where she can sell her products. For this reason she thought it was a good idea to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 new soles which she will use to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy more beer.

loans.name: Cerritos Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Cerritos" y esta ubicado en Morelos, México. La señora Angelina Sanchez B. es integrante del grupo tiene 45 años de edad, vive en union libre, tiene 2 hijos los cuales son su orgullo pues son muy estudiosos, ella es originaria de Morelos, se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace 8 años, y con el prestamo quiere invertir en los pedidos que le hacen sus vecinas amigas y familiares ya que aveces no le alcanza el dinero para cubrir sus pedidos. Actualmente ella es presidenta del grupo el cual esta conformado por 9 integrantes, se siente muy feliz ya que con su venta ayuda al ingreso familiar y asi mejorar su nivel de vida. Actualmente esta tomando un curso de decoracion de globos con lo cual planea tener asi otro ingreso pues podra ofrecer adornar en fiestas.
texts.en:
This group is called "Cerritos" and is located in Morelos, Mexico.  Angelina Sanchez B. is a member of the group.  She is 45 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children who are her pride and joy as they are very studious.  Angelina is from Morelos and she has been selling cosmetics for eight years.  She would like to invest her loan money in the orders that her neighbors, friends and family members make with her since sometimes she doesn't have enough money to cover their orders.

Angelina is currently the president of her group which has nine members.  She feels very happy because, through her sales, she is helping to make income for her family and thereby improving her family's quality of life.  Angelina is currently taking a course in decorating balloons which she hopes will become another source of income as she will be able to offer a service providing decorations for parties.

loans.use: to invest in cosmetics

loans.name: Dennys

texts.es:
Denis B. F. de 52 años vive  en la ciudadela 20 de Julio,  al sur de la ciudad, barrio alegre,  donde se desarrolla una  gran dinámica productiva entre negocios formales e informales, combinados con escenarios deportivos y zonas residenciales,  habitadas por familias que desarrollan actividades generadoras de ingresos como la que realiza Denis,  quien practica  la comercialización de mercancías variadas como ropa, calzados, equipos celulares, productos de belleza y accesorios, mediante el sistema de crédito y también de contado con descuentos especiales. 
La familia de Denis está conformada por su esposo y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 22 a 28 años,  tres de los cuales terminaron sus estudios de bachiller y una de ellas ya es profesional de la psicología. Su negocio inició hace 12 años cuando sintió la necesidad de generar otros ingresos para su hogar,  con tal de ayudar  a su familia a salir adelante, fue así como empezó vendiendo pocos productos y gradualmente ha ido creciendo su clientela lo cual ha ensanchado su negocio.
Este es el primer credikiva pero el sexto que obtiene con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo y con ello superarse personalmente, porque ha fortalecido su autonomía, adquiriendo compromisos y cumpliéndolos en beneficio de su grupo familiar. Con su credikiva comprará mercancía, las cuales tiene encargada con motivo de la celebración del día de las madres,  que es un dia muy importante para las familias  y se reúnen para agasajar con detalles a todas las mujeres de su hogar y amigas que tienen la felicidad de ser madre.
texts.en:
Denis B. F. is 52 years old and lives in 20 de Julio development, in the south of the city.  This is a cheerful neighborhood where there is a great productive dynamic between formal and informal businesses, combined with sports venues and residential areas inhabited by families who carry out income-generating activities such as that which Denis carries out.  Denis sells a variety of merchandise such as clothes, footwear, cell phones, beauty products and accessories.  She sells her products on credit and also for cash with special discounts.

Denis' family consists of her husband and four children aged between 22 and 28.  Three of her children finished high school and one of them is already a psychology professional.  Denis started her business 12 years ago when she felt the need to make more income for her household in order to help her family get ahead in life.  She started selling a few products and gradually increased her number of customers and expanded her business.

This is Denis' first Kiva loan but the sixth that she has obtained from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which she has managed to increase her working capital and improve herself because she has strengthened her autonomy, acquiring work which she has undertaken to the benefit of her family.  Denis will use her Kiva loan to buy merchandise which she has on order for Mother's Day.  This is a very important day for families who come together to honor all the women in their families and their friends who are lucky enough to be mothers with gifts.

loans.use: to buy merchandise which she has on order for Mother's Day

loans.name: Nicida

texts.es:
Nicida tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el sector Laran del distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. La zona se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí  ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de 10 años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido sacar adelante a su familia durante todo este tiempo ayudando a su esposo para solventar los gastos familiares.

Nicida desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Nicida, 45, is married living with her family in Monsefú District’s Laran sector, a zone noted for its touristic and religious festivals.  The zone is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has a general store located in her home.  She sells her neighbors various daily use items like basic need items and groceries.  The store has been in operation for 10 years and has a well established regular clientele.  Thanks to this activity she’s been able to move her family ahead helping her husband to meet family expenses.

Nicida wants to expand the business buying more merchandise to meet customer demand.  Because of this she’s deemed it advisable to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío Hualtaco del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente vende la leche que produce su ganado a la Municipalidad de Tambogrande y se dedica a la agricultura sembrando mango y limón desde hace más de 8 años, aprendió esta actividad por su padre por ello conoce este rubro a la perfección.

El desea comprar  alimento balanceado para su ganado y también comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Augusto is a 34-year-old father living with his wife and three children in the hamlet of Hualtaco in the farming district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone located in Piura Region over four hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.

He raises cattle in his back yard to sell and when they reach a good level of development he offers them for sale to merchants that tend to visit the area where he lives.  In addition, he sells the milk his cows produce in the town of Tambogrande and he’s also farmed mangoes and lemons for the last 8 years.  He learned these skills from his father so he knows them to perfection.

He wants to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his livestock and also buy fertilizers for his lemon crops.  Because of this he’s deemed it advisable to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced livestock feed and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío Santa Clara del distrito de Batangrande. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra que pertenece a la Provincia de Ferreñafe, ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una  hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Edilberto se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era muy joven. El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado vacuno desde hace varios años. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

El desea adquirir más ganado  y alimento balanceado para ampliar su establo y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Edilberto, age 30, lives with his family in the Santa Clara rural area in the district of Batangrande.  It is an agricultural district which belongs to the province of Ferreñafe, in Lambayeque, over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Edilberto has worked in agriculture-related activities since he was very young.  He raises and sells cattle for a living and has been in business for several years.  He feeds them natural grain and fodder and once they reach full development, he sells them to merchants who visit the area frequently.

He wants to purchase more livestock and balanced animal feed to expand his stable and earn more income.  He decided to request a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa, which will help him reach his goal.

loans.use: To buy livestock and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Maria Digna

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

María se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado caprino y ovino en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza hace 9 años, por ello conoce a la perfección este rubro.

María desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria is a 31-year-old mother of a family. She is married and lives with her children in the district of Mochumí -- an agricultural area with substantial commercial traffic located more than half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Maria makes her living by raising and commercializing sheep and goat livestock that she grows in a yard near her home. She feeds the animals natural grass and grains, and when they reach a good level of development, she offers them for sale to merchants who frequently visit the area where she lives. She has been in this business for nine years, which is why she knows this line of work to perfection.

Maria would like to purchase additional livestock and balanced animal feed to expand her business and to obtain a higher level of income. For this reason, she has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 soles which will help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Phlorng

texts.en: Phlorng Y., 61, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Y. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about $1.50 each per day. Three of her children are employed, earning an income of around $3.50 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $25 on food and $60 on the other necessary expenses. Y. is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the children to commute to work.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng C., 23, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Leng is employed at the factory, earning an income of about $3 per day. Her husband is a guard, earning an income of around $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $30 on food and $60 on the other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a business as a motor-taxi driver. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a business as a motor-taxi driver.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert V. is from the village of Barangay Barat, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 47 years old. Robert is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Robert owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Robert has been engaged in his business for over twenty years and earns approximately $225 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Robert joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robert is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Chuluunbaatar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He owns a plot of land and a house on it. His eldest daughter works as a salesperson and the youngest one is studying Law at the University. His wife Uranchimeg works as a cleaner in a sock-making textile factory. Chuluunbaatar works in a construction company as a plasterer. 

His family used to run a recycling business, collecting different recyclable materials like glasses, soft drink cans, metal and plastics, and then selling them to waste recycling companies for money. Now his children are grown up and everyone in the family is employed, so he decided to change the business profile. 

His eldest daughter had been working for a retail shop as a salesperson for a few years, and gathered quite a good knowledge about retail business. So she decided to run a clothes selling retail business on her own, and she needs some starting capital. He is supporting his daughter's idea, and he is asking for a loan to invest in his daughter's business. She has completed her business plan and at the moment she is looking for a suitable place to rent.

loans.use: to invest in his daughter's new clothes retail business by buying clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Kucup Mekar Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut P. got a loan of Rp. 1,300,000. It will be used to buy five piglets. At the time of lending, there were two people who could not attend. They are Ni Made M., because her son is in hospital, and another one, Ni Putu E., had gone to Denpasar. 

Ni Ketut P. and her husband are very grateful to get another loan from MUK. Every month Ni Ketut P. spends the money she makes using the loans to pay family expenses: electricity and water Rp. 100,000 and for the kitchen Rp. 300,000. Ni Ketut P. and all members of the Kucup Mekar group really hope that their efforts can be successful and they can support themselves independently.

loans.use: To buy five piglets.

loans.name: Auysh

texts.en:
Auysh is 48 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her two older children are students while her younger one is a pupil. Her husband is a driving instructor at a private driver training school. 

Auysh manages a computer and Canon service business besides her accounting job at Hovd Uho Co.,Ltd. However, she is planning to quit her job in order to conduct her own business in the future. The reason is that her employer never pays her salary on time and her own business is much more profitable compared with her accounting job. She is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment for servicing computers.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for servicing computers.

loans.name: Damba

texts.en:
Damba is 22 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a house in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife is a cook at a private bakery company. He manages a taxi service business in his town. He started his business in 2009. 

His mother owns a small grocery trading business at a rented stall in a local market. Her business was quite successful and encouraged him to become part of that business. So Damba is planning to conduct his mother's business together with her. He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase fruits and vegetables for his new business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren is 39 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. His three children all attend the local secondary school. He manages a meat trading business at a local market with the help of his wife. He started his business in 1998 and gained much experience. Sometimes he goes to near provinces to sell meat by using his car. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase meat and meat products for his business.

loans.use: to purchase meat and meat products to resell.

loans.name: Zenith Del Carmen

texts.es: Zenith P. vive en la ciudad D. Cartagena D. Indias, ciudad costera al Norte D. Colombia, con su esposo y tiene tres hijos en las edades D. 25 a 31 años D. edad, uno D. los cuales ya es profesional; En el barrio donD. habita Zenith tiene una papelerìa donD. aprovecha su espacio para prestar el  internet, actividad con la que sueña ampliarla porque  la percibe como fuente D. ingresos  para ella y en el futuro para sus hijos. El negocio naciò por que ella es muy conciente D. las oportunidads D. ingreso pues en su barrio no existe aun punto D. ventas D. productos D. papelerìa y aun menos servicios D. comunicaciòn especialidad via internet; fue asì como decidida  y con esfuerzo propio, la emprendiò  con pocos productos y cuando sintìo la gran acogida D. sus clientes empezò a reinvertirle D. acuerdo con lo que este gradualmente le generaba, fue asì como lo hizo crecer, y hasta el momento ha sido una fuente D. ingresos importante para ella y su familia, por eso se ha entusiasmado y està solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo, para tener un capital D. trabajo adicional con el cual responder rapidamente a sus clientes, con su credikiva  comprarà  cuadernos, làpices, sacapuntas, borradores y utiles escolares en general, inversion que proyecta ser exitosa porque no tiene competencia a su alrededor y todos conocen que ir a comprar donD. Zenith es mas facil que trasladarse a puntos comerciales con estas mismas caracteristicas, pues quedan lejos D. su vivienda.
texts.en:
Zenith P. lives in the city of Cartagena D. Indias, a coastal city in northern Colombia, with her husband and three children, who are ages 25 to 31 years old.  One of her children is already a young professional.  

In her neighborhood, Zenith has a stationary store, which she also uses as a space to proviD. internet services.  She dreams of expanding this activity to proviD. a larger source of income for herself and in the future for her children.  The business started because she is very aware of the income opportunities in her neighborhood.  There were no places that sold stationary and even less places that provided special communication services via internet.  That is how she decided, with great determination and effort, to undertake a business with a few products.  When she felt the great success of having customers, she began to reinvest her generated earnings.  This is how the business has grown and so far has been a source of income for her and her family.

She is excited and seeking her first loan through the Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo to have additional working capital with which to respond quickly to her customers.  With the requested loan she will buy notebooks, pencils, pencil sharpeners, erasers, and general school supplies.  This is an investment that she projects will be successful because there is no competition around and everyone knows to buy from her store.  It is easier to broaden her sales zone with similar products.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pencils, pencil sharpeners, erasers, and other school supplies.

loans.name: Tsolmon

texts.en: Tsolmon is 25 years old and lives with her mother in Hovd province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in someone else's backyard. Tsolmon and her mother both work at a Tsambagarav hotel as cooks. Besides her work there, she manages a door-to-door meal-selling business in her town. She is planning to continue her business in the future. She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase food items for her business.

loans.use: to purchase food items to resell.

loans.name: Tulga

texts.en: Tulga is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in an apartment in Hovd province, Mongolia. His younger son goes to a local secondary school. Tulga works at a Customs House as a driver. Besides his work he manages a clothing trading business with the help of his wife. He is planning to expand and continue this business. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 47 years old and married with four school-aged children. 

Marilyn is engaged in a retailing business of selling rice in their village. With the business, she usually earns 3,200 PHP a month, which is  essential in supporting her family needs.

Marilyn joined the trust group program of ASKI to gain access to financial assistance for her to improve her family's living standard through her business. 

At present, Mariyn is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be spent to purchase more rice to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan E. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Her older son is a teacher at a local secondary school; the younger one is self-employed. 

She manages a used-shoe trading business with the help of her husband at Har Horin market, one of the biggest markets in Ulaanbaatar. She started her business in 2000. Now her daily earning is 90,000 MNT with monthly net profit of 500,000 MNT. 

She sometimes travels to China in order to import her products. She is an honest woman who says, "I like receiving services from Xacbank." 

She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase used shoes from China.

loans.use: to purchase used shoes from China for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries, canned goods, cosmetics and clothing, which are on order

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is very supportive by nature. She's always ready to help her family in their time of need. She operates a clothes-selling business for her community clients to help her family financially. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her clothes-selling business. She operates her business from her home. Through the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk quantity which will not only allow her to offer more variety to her clients but also minimize her cost of travelling as a result of bulk purchasing. 

She has given birth to two sons. Both of them left their education after matriculation and started doing jobs to support the family financially. 

Bashiraan is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she established a good credit record and never missed any meeting. She belongs to Arifwala which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its dairy industry.  She has been living there for the past 21 years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bashiraan.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes selling business.

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida belongs to Arifwala which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its dairy industry.  She has been living there in the small colony named Fazal colony in a 3-room brick house with her family for the past 12 years. She is a housewife and takes care of her household responsibilities by staying at home. 

Her husband's name is Z. H. and he operates a Punjabi food restaurant business in the market. He offers good quality food items to his clients. In the restaurant, he sells "Daal roti" (made with lentils and served with bread), "Nan chanay" (made with chick peas and served with bread), etc. He has a good name in the area for his good quality food. 

Rashida is the mother of two sons and both of them work. Her elder son sells vegetables in a vegetable market while younger one does a private job. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. Through the loan, he will buy required items like lentils, cooking oil, chick peas, flour and spices, etc. which will allow him to provide better quality of food to his clients and earn better profits. 

He started this business 12 years ago and Rashida is hopeful that after an investment, it will start bringing him better profits. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rashida.

loans.use: To buy required items for Punjabi food restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is married and has six adult children. At the age of 60, she opted to engage in a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. Through the business she is able to generate 4,000 PHP for every pig that she sells.

Teresita became a member of ASKI in 2005. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which she will use to buy livestock feed and other supplies. Teresita wants to have more pigs to raise in the future.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
Diana tiene 42 años D. edad, y es casada con 2 hijos. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito Pacasmayo, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más D. dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque. 

DesD. hace más D. dos años, cuenta con una bodega instalada en su propio domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos D. consumo diario entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. Gracias a esta actividad pueD. mantener a su familia y ayudar a su esposo, quien es mototaxista, con el sostenimiento económico D. su familia.

Diana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más mercadería D. abarrotes D. modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos. Su objetivo es ser uno D. las bodegas más surtidas en la zona. Por lograr su meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Diana, age 42, is married and has two children. She lives together with her family in the Pacasmayo district -- an area with substantial commercial traffic located in the region of La Libertad, more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region.

For over two years, Diana has been running a convenience store from her own home. In it, she offers groceries and various basic necessity products. Thanks to this business, Diana has been able to proviD. for her family and to help her husband, who is a driver of a mototaxi (a tricycle cabin attached to a motorcycle), with the financial needs of their household.

Diana would like to expand her business by purchasing a larger inventory of groceries which will help her increase her sales and earnings. Her goal is to have one of the best-supplied grocery stores in the areas. To achieve this goal, Diana has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 soles.

loans.use: to purchase grocery store inventory

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda M. is from the city of Pallua Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 38 years old. Ma. Linda is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Ma. Linda owns and operates a general store, selling food and daily use products in the local community. Ma. Linda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ma. Linda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Ma. Linda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Ma. Linda is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as rice to expand her product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Ma. Linda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as rice to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Ida Flor

texts.es:
Ida tiene 26  años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. Vive en casa  de padres en la zona rural del distrito de Mochumi, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 150  familias.

Ida se gana la vida desde hace 9  años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización. Adicionalmente, cuenta con ingresos adicionales brindando clases particulares a niños de primaria en una parte de su domicilio. Desea invertir en la compra de carneros para su engorde y también realizar el acondicionamiento del local donde da las clases. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Ida, age 26, is single and has no children.  She lives with her parents in the rural district of Mochumi, a commercially active agricultural area that is located over half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.  It has basic utility services.  Her community is small and made up of approximately 150 families.

Ida has earned a living for nine years raising and selling small farm animals.  The stables are located behind her houe.  She raises pigs, sheep and ducks and sells them to merchants who visit the area.  She learned her trade from her parents and knows her job very well.  There is a lot of competition in the business but also a lot of demand in the market.  She also earns an income giving private lessos to grade school children.  She wants to buy sheep to raise and also renovate the location, inside her home, where she gives classes.  Therefore she decided to request a loan in the amount of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and to renovate the location where she gives private classes

loans.name: Kumarhan

texts.en:
Kumarhan B. is 52 years old and lives with her three children in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in her older brother's backyard. All of her children are in school. 

She manages a meat-trading business at a rented stall at a local market. She has been managing her business for six years and has built a strong customer base. Her monthly rent fee is 6,000 MNT. She usually sells her products to cafes and restaurants. Her daily earning is 20,000 MNT with a monthly net profit of 150,000 MNT. 

She is a polite woman who says, "My happiness is my children. I am ready to give them everything they want to have. But I am proud that I was able to teach them about starting a business with low working capital." 

She is requesting a 400,000 MNT loan to purchase meat and meat products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase meat and meat products.

loans.name: Luis Leonardo

texts.es: Luis tiene 71 años de edad y es casado. Vive con su esposa y un hijo en casa familiar que se ubica en el distrito de José Leonardo O., el distrito más grande de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Se dedica a la venta de carne de res en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande y con bastante movimiento comercial. Tiene varios años de experiencia y buen manejo en esta actividad. Luis solicita un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa para comprar más carne para vender y también para ayudar solventar algunos gastos personales. Esta inversión lo ayudará a tener mayores ingresos y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Luis es muy trabajador y responsable.  Ha manejado otros préstamos de Edpyme Alternativa y los canceló con toda puntualidad.
texts.en:
Luis, age 71, is married and lives with his wife and son in the family home located in the district of José Leonardo O..  It is the largest district in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  He sells beef at the Moshoqueque Market, a large market with a lot of commercial activity.  He has many years of experience in managing this type of business.

Luis is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternative which he plans to use to buy more meat and to help cover personal expenses.  This investment will help him generate more income and give his family a better lifestyle.  Luis is a hard worker and very responsible.  He has had other loans through Edpyme Alternativa and has always paid them back on time.

loans.use: To buy more beef to sell at the local market

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida belongs to Arifwala which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture and dairy industry. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 15 years.

Her husband's name is N. M. and he operates a grocery store in the community market. Through his store, he sells daily use items like spices, sugar, rice, etc. to his customers at cheap rates. His customer dealing is very good that’s why he is able to attract more customers who purchase groceries from him regularly.

Khalida doesn’t have any children. She spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household responsibilities. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her husband’s grocery store business. Through the loan, he will purchase groceries in bulk that will enable him to fulfill the needs of his customers on time and earn maximum profits. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Khalida is hopeful that an investment will bring positive financial changes to his business.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene J., 50, is a single man from the village of Brgy. Barat, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. 

He has been a farmer for 30 years. He plants and harvests variety of vegetables for sale. With these activities he earns 4,000 PHP a month.

He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to be used in his farming activities. He will use the amount to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raised. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raised.

loans.name: Shijirbaatar

texts.en:
Shijirbaatar B., 25, is married and lives with his wife and two daughters in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His daughters haven't reached school age, so they stay home, and his wife, age 25, is a student. 

He manages an Internet and PC game business near his home. He started his business in 2006 after his graduation. At first he opened his PC game place with 10 computers installed with the help of his wife. Since then he has managed to stabilize his business and has built a strong customer base. 

He has been managing his business for four years and has gained much experience. His business has been quite successful, which has allowed him to buy a mini-truck which he uses in a coal-trading business during winter time. 

He is planning to expand his business and improve his working place in the future. He is an open-minded man who says, "I am planning to renew the processors of my business in order to attract more customers." 

He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase new processors for his PC game business and to buy a mini-bus in order to start a transportation business between Ulaanbaatar city and the countryside area of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase new processors for his Internet cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy reeds and other materials to make hats, billfolds, earrings and other products

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is married to S. M. who has a business selling wheat and rice. He deals in bulk sales and earns a good profit from his business. He is the only earning person in his family. She is the mother of three children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Yasmeen takes care of them very well and tries to give them comfort by fulfilling their needs. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who has a larger order to fill. Through the loan, he will buy wheat and rice in bulk quantity which enable him to fill the order on time and receive good profit. S. has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Yasmeen is confident that an investment will help him growing his business further. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. She belongs to a small city called Arifwala which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its dairy industry.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Yasmeen.

loans.use: To buy wheat & rice to fill a large order.

loans.name: Nyamsuren

texts.en:
Nyamsuren B. is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two sons, age 3 and 5, both attend kindergarten. 

She manages a refrigerator repair business with the help of her husband. She started her business in 2008. She advertises their business in newspapers and customers call her to give orders. She usually receives two or three phone calls about broken refrigerators each day. She fixes one refrigerator at a cost of 25,000 to 65,000 MNT. 

She is planning to have her own working place in the future. She is an honest woman who loves her job. She says, "I want to have my own working place where I can employ more workers in the future." 

She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to rent a workshop.

loans.use: To rent a workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to be sold.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es madre D. familia D. 47  años D. edad. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores. Residen en  el caserío Las Juntas del distrito D. Illimo, el cual se ubica a 25 minutos D. la ciudad D. Lambayeque en el norte D. Perú. 

Martha se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior D. su domicilio. Alimenta sus animales con pastos naturales, polvillo, maíz, purina, etc. y los comercializa quincenalmente en el Mercado Moshoqueque o Mercado Modelo D. Lambayeque. Solicita un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra D. más alimento para sus animales. Con esta inversión, sus animales podrán lograr un mejor tamaño y peso y Martha podrá venderlos para un mejor precio en los mercados locales. Con sus ingresos, Martha ayuda a su esposo solventar sus gastos familiares. Martha ha tenido otro crédito con Edpyme Alternativa y demostró responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Martha is a mother and is 47 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and two children. They in the small town of Las Juntas in the district of Illimo, which is located 25 minutes from the city of Lambayeque, in the north of Peru.

Martha raises and sells livestock, which she keeps in corrals located in her yard. She feeds her animals natural grasses, corn, commercial feed, etc. and sells them every two weeks in the Moshoqueque Market or the Modelo Market in Lambayeque.
