She is requesting a loan of PEN 1,000.00 to buy more feed for her animals. With this investment, her animals will be able to achieve a better size and weight, and Martha will be able to sell them for a better price in the local markets. 

With her income, Martha helps her husband with the family expenses. Martha has had other loans with Edpyme Alternativa and she has demonstrated responsibility with her payments.

loans.use: to buy more feed for the animals she raises

loans.name: Serikbai

texts.en:
Serikbai S. is a 40-year-old widow who lives with her five children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her older two children, age 17 and 19, are students, while younger three, age 6, 10 and 16, are pupils. 

In 1994 she started a meat-trading business that she managed with the help of her husband, and since then, she has gained much experience. Unfortunately, she has had to manage her business alone since her husband's death in 2008. 

Now her working capital exceeds 500,000 MNT and she earns 20,000 - 25,000 MNT of profit daily. 

She is a hardworking lady who pays all her children's education cost. She says, "All I want is to provide necessary education cost for my children in order for them to be well educated citizens." 

She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy more meat at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To buy more meat at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Mardina

texts.en:
Mardina is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a 'ger', a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His three children, ages 1, 3 and 5, all stay home with their mother. He manages an auto repair business with the help of his friend.

He started his business in 2010 after working as a repairman for three years. He provides a variety of services at his auto repair shop including diagnosing, troubleshooting, and repairing  car problems. Now his daily earnings exceed 50,000-100,000 MNT. He is very good at time management and attributes his business success to his good accounting skills. He says, “I love my work. I'm where I want to be." He is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to purchase auto parts and paint for his business.

loans.use: To purchase auto parts and paint.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es: Catalino tiene 40  años de edad, es soltero y tiene dos hijos menores. Aunque no vive junto a sus hijos y su madre, Catalino usa los ingresos de su trabajo para ayudar con el sostenimiento económico de sus hijos. Vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Labora como empleado para la municipalidad provincial de Chiclayo. Además se desempeña como mototaxista  después de sus labores con el gobierno. Cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte).  El contínuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Por ello, Catalino ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito de 600 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa. Este préstamo le permitirá cubrir sus gastos sin tener que recurrir a prestamistas informales que cobran tasas por encima del promedio financiero. Catalino es muy trabajador y responsable. Cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Catalino is 40 years old. He is single and has two children. Though he doesn’t live with his children and their mother, Catalino uses the income from his work to help out with the economic support of his children. He lives in his own house in the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque, in the north of Peru. 

He works as an employee for the provincial municipality of Chiclayo. He also works as a motorcycle taxi driver after his work with the government. He has a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle that has a cab mounted on the back, used for transportation). The constant use of his motorcycle taxi has caused it some wear and tear that requires urgent repairs, so that it can continue to function. Catalino has decided to request a loan of PEN 600.00 from Edpyme Alternative. This loan will allow him to cover the costs without having to use informal lenders who charge higher than average interest rates. Catalino is very hardworking and responsible. He has good personal and work references from his community.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Eloisa's Group

texts.en:
Eloisa E. is from the village of Macalaoat, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Eloisa is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. Each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Eloisa is married and has four children. She operates a general store. Eloisa has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Eloisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her family living situation. She is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase commodities like coffee, sugar, soap, canned goods and many daily used products that she retails. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand her store. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase many daily use products that she retails.

loans.name: Malvar

texts.en:
Malvar T. is married and is 45 years old. He has two grown-up children who help him together with his wife in managing their retail shop where he sells various commodities such canned and bottled goods, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, spices and many more. Malvar also manages a drugstore in their place where he gets their major source of income. He has been in the business for more than six years. 

Malvar is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to use in purchasing a stock of medicines for sale and also goods to retail in his store like soft drinks. Each month, he earns a monthly net income of PHP 20,000 doing this type of work. 

In the future, Malvar hopes to further  improve his business and meet his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur by simply working hard and staying humble. 

About ASKI: 

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of medicines and various other goods for sale.

loans.name: Sarafina Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis Z. is in her late thirties and is single with three children.  She has had a food vending business for six years.  Her business is open from 8:00am to 11:00pm daily and she is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Mwanahamis's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes for a loan to increase the food stock by buying a sack of rice, wheat flour, a bucket of cooking oil, corn flour and half a sack of beans. Her dream is to one day buy land to build her house.

Mwanahamis will share  this loan with her loan group Sarafina which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mwanahamis is 1st on the left in a dark blue blouse.

loans.use: To increase food stocks by buying a sack of rice, wheat flour, beans, corn flour and a bucket of cooking oil.

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla is a 45-year-old single woman living in Chtoura. Since 2001, she has owned a grocery store. Abla is a hard worker whose clients are mostly her friends and neighbors. She is requesting her first loan from A. Majmoua to add new products such as ice-cream and cold drinks to sell during the spring and summer season. This will increase her business capitA. as her business increases during the warm weather when many people come to her area to spend their vacations until their children go back to school. Abla is looking forward to expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to add products such as ice-cream and cold drinks to sell during the spring and summer

loans.name: Singida Group

texts.en:
Asma A., is in her late twenties and is single with a 6-month-old daughter.  She has been a food vendor for two years and works from 7.00am to 6.00pm daily.  She is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Asma's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the food stock by buying her supplies by the sack instead of by the kilo.  She has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to further increase the food stock. Her dream is to one day own a beauty salon.

Asma will share this loan with her loan group "Singida" which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Asma is in the middle at the back row wearing a black-and-white blouse.

loans.use: To increase her food stock and buy it in larger quantities.

loans.name: Fawzi

texts.en:
Fawzi is a 42-year-old married man who lives in Chtoura with his wife and five children. He is a mechanic. Since 2001, he has owned a garage where he fixes cars. Fawzi is a hard worker and loved by most of his clients, who are his friends and neighbors. He has 27 years of experience and his good reputation is his strength among his competitors. 

Fawzi is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua to buy new equipment necessary to improve his business and also to pay for his daughter's engagement expenses. In the future, Fawzi plans to open a grocery store to help cover his family’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy business equipment and pay for his daughter's engagement expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Magid

texts.en:
Magid is a 35-year-old single man living in Dahieh. Since 1993, he has owned a grocery store. He is a hard worker who is beloved by all his neighbors and friends, many of whom are his customers. 

Magid is requesting his third loan from Al Majmoua to add summer products such as ice-cream and cold drinks to sell and increase his business capital. He will also use his loan to fully repay a loan on his new car. Magid hopes to expand his business in the future and he is also planning to start his own small family.

loans.use: to add summer products such as ice-cream and cold drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a thirty-two-year-old widow with four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in dried fish for eight years and with the profits she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her hardship is theft  due to  poor storage  facilities and her vision is  to have a big depot and educate all her children. Mary wants the loan to buy fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson is a thirty-four-year-old married man with two children and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his children and his desire is to educate them up to university. He has been runing a retail shop for four years despite hardships of load shedding and debtors and his dream is to become a wholesale trader. Edson needs the loan facility to buy thread to knit sweaters.

loans.use: To buy thread to knit sweaters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a computer for CD burning, a UPS and phone accessories.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-year-old married man living in Tyre with his wife and one child. He works hard to provide his family with the best standard of living and education. For the past six years, Ali has worked in land rehabilitation and drilling. He is a hard worker who is loved and honored by his friends and most of his customers, who are his friends, relatives, and neighbors. Ali has a good reputation and a strong commitment to work. 

Ali is requesting his first loan from Al Majmoua to buy sand and stone which are necessary to improve his business and make it easier and faster. He hopes to expand his business in the future by buying another Caterpillar drilling machine.

loans.use: to buy sand and stone to improve his business

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a widow with four children, all of whom are adults. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past six years, she has operated a car wash and electronics sales business. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Anastasia faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  During the rainy season, the availability of customers is lower compared to the dry summer season. She dreams of opening another electronics shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase sockets and phone chargers. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sockets and phone chargers.

loans.name: Mungunnavch

texts.en:
Mungunnavch K. is 36 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, in a small house in the outer ger (Mongolian tent) district of the city.  When Mungunnavch first began her jewelry business with her husband in 2000, her husband worked as a jeweler at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in Mongolia and Mungunnavch used to find customers. In 2005 they started running a jewelry retail stall at Narantuul. At the beginning stages of their jewelry retail stall, they had 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital. As a result of their hard work, today they have 8,000,000 MNT in working capital and Mungunnavch sells gold rings, necklaces, earrings, and bracelets to their customers. With the profit of their business, they built a new small house and bought a yard to extend. 

Mungunnavch is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT, which she will use to purchase more jewelry. She believes this loan will help support her in the busy shopping season of the year.  She wants to expand her business with Kiva loans and be able to support her children’s education and their future goals.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid is a thirty-three-year-old married woman with seven children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in textiles for ten years starting with a capital of 300,000 shillings and she now has 2,500,000 shillings in working capital. Her hardship is limited capital to meet the increasing demands of her customers and her vision is to have at least an outlet in the city centre.

loans.use: To buy rolls of cloth for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: David Mwana

texts.en:
David Mwana O. O. is 28 years old and married with one child. For the past three years, he has been in the livestock trading business in Narok Town. He earns a monthly income of 9,000 KES. 

David was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his town. He is an industrious man who struggles to achieve his goals. David is applying for his first loan to purchase some goats and sheep to sell for a profit. He intends to use the return from his loan to expand his business and repay his loan. David's dream is to become a famous businessman and educate his children to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase goats and sheep to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics and a  hair dryer for her salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, salt and other general merchandise.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-four-year-old divorced  man with four children and  he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the wholesale business for four years. He started with a "boda boda" (motorcycle transport) business and saved to start a shop. His hardship is loss of goods during transportation from Kampala and his vision is bigger business and a permanent residential house, plus educating the children. Joseph intends to use the credit facility to buy sodas and books for resale.

loans.use: To buy sodas and books for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe E. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Agsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 41 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Fe owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling weaved native mats to local businesses and community members. Ma. Fe has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Ma. Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a married man with three school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

He has operated a utensils sales business for the past three years, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. Mohamed faces a major challenge of transportation of his products as some are fragile. He dreams of incorporating other products like clothes and handbags in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he is requesting he wants to purchase dozens of glasses, plates and basins. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase dozens of glasses, plates and basins.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en:
Khodor is a 43-year-old married man living in Tyre with his wife and one child. Khodor owns a tractor which he uses to fix other people's land in order to plant new seeds or small trees. To support his family, Khodor runs several businesses; in addition to driving his tractor, he bakes Markouk bread and sells it to a few shops and individuals who request continuously from him. He also works at harvesting olives for olive tree owners during their harvest season. He is a good worker. He has 16 years of experience. His clients are friends, neighbors and cooperatives.

Khodor has good reputation for his commitment to work. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the eighth time in order to buy a plot of land. All his previous loans had a great impact on his social and financial situation, and at the same time he was a borrower in good standing. He is intent on improving his living conditions as much as he can.

loans.use: To buy a new plot of land to plow and plant.

The main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle transport services. Emiliano has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Emiliano joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This  will be the third loan taken out by Emiliano from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.name: Makumbusho

texts.en:
Makumbusho is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that has electricity and piped water. Makumbusho’s greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, Makumbusho has operated a motor vehicle public transport business. His passengers are his customers. In addition, Makumbusho also operates a water-selling business which contributes to income.  

Makumbusho decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase seat covers and repair his vehicle seats. In the future, Makumbusho would like to own another motor vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase seat covers for his vehicle

loans.name: Marik Ole

texts.en:
Marik Ole O., 35 years old, is married with three children. He has been in animal trading for the last three years.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client in his area of residence. This is his first loan with which he has planned to purchase some goats and sheep to sell later at a profit. He intends to use the return from the loan to expand the business and part to repay the loan.

He will use the anticipated income to educate his children to a higher level of education. His dreams are to be the best and best-known businessman in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase some goats and sheep for resale.

loans.name: Nayua

texts.en: A. is 35 years old and married with six children. All of her children got to school. A. is currently in the charcoal-selling business. She is requesting a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. In the future, A. hopes to buy a car with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Nadim

texts.en:
Nadim is a 32-year-old married man living in Tyre with his wife and two kids. Just like most of his fellow villagers, Nadim runs several businesses, in addition to transporting water to farmers' lands using his tractor. Nadim owns a bus which he uses during the school season to transport students all over his village and nearby villages. Nadim also sells mineral water, transporting it to his fellow villagers' homes and businesses, since it's not affordable most of the time, as requested by the villagers. He is a smart hard worker. Most of his clients are village citizens and other villagers. 

He is a man with a good reputation for his commitment to his work. Nadim is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the third time, in order to buy cattle to trade with. He wants to improve his living conditions and to secure his customers' loyalty.

loans.use: To buy livestock to trade with.

loans.name: Rosemary Enole

texts.en:
Rosemary Enole I., 39 years old, is a married mother of five children. She is a businesswoman who deals with groceries which she has been doing for the last fifteen years. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client. This is her first loan from KADET and she is planning to buy more cereals stock of Maize and Beans in sacks which she will hawk around the market places for sale during market day. She hopes to use the profits from this loan to reinvest back into her business. 

Her hopes and her dream is to become a great businesswoman. She is a brisk woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy more cereals stock

For the past six years, he has operated a boda-boda (motorcycle) business. His potential customers are passersby and town dwellers. The main challenge Abdalla faces in his business is seasonality. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate. He dreams of expanding and operating a matatu (motor vehicle) business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) he is requesting, he wants to add to his savings and purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth J. C. is a lady of thirty-two years, married and a mother of three lovely children. They live in Koitoror in the outskirts of Eldoret town. She does dairy farming in the same area. She milks the cows and sells the milk to her customers, and she has been in this business for six years now and gets a monthly income of fourteen thousand shillings.

This will be Elizabeth's third loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy one dairy cow, dairy feed, and milking jelly. With the income that she will get she plans to pay school fees for her children and expand her dairy farm. 

In future she plans to own a ranch and continue with the dairy farm.

loans.use: To buy one dairy cow, dairy feed and milking jelly.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

For the past six years, Tsuma has operated a matatu (motor vehicle) public transport business from the market, serving both market dwellers and travelers. With the Kshs 40,000 he is requesting, Tsuma wants to renovate his stall and purchase sacks of cabbages, onions and potatoes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy two steam dryers and a flat iron. Rosemary hopes to one day run a wholesale cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Abasse

texts.en:
Abbasse is a 51-year-old married man, living in Tyre with his wife and five kids. He sells fire extinguishers, security alarms and  safes. He is a hard worker. It's been only six years since he started this business, and now he's well experienced in this domain. Most of his customers are owners of small to big businesses, those who seek perfection in their environment. 

Abbasse has a good reputation for his proficiency at work. He likes his work and he finds it very important and challenging. Abbasse is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to buy new modern safes for his inventory. He hopes to expand his business in the future and insists on giving the best education to his children.

loans.use: To buy modern safes to sell.

loans.name: 040706 Thanh Xuan - Hoang Truong Group

texts.en:
"Thanh N. Thị (70) is a 37 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Thanh is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 040706 Thanh Xuan - Hoang Truong (040706 Thanh Xuan - Hoang Truong).


Thanh is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Thanh operates a family member's business selling confectionery products in the local community.  Thanh has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2003, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thanh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Anh (75) is a 29 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


2.  N. Thị Bình (37) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


3.  N. Thị Tâm (59) is a 30 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


4.  Lê Thị Tháp (68) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thanh N. Thị (70) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Thanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 040706 Thanh Xuan - Hoang Truong (040706 Thanh Xuan - Hoang Truong).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Thanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thanh kiếm được khoảng 2,500,000 VND.  Vào 2003, Thanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Anh (75) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  N. Thị Bình (37) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  N. Thị Tâm (59) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  Lê Thị Tháp (68) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en: Bonface is 37 years old and is married, with two children.  He has been a mechanic for thirteen years.  He has grown his business with the loans from Faulu Kenya.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has also developed a saving culture.  Besides being a mechanic, he also sells spare parts so as to boost his income.  He hopes to expand his business within five years and employ more people.  He wants 40,000 Kes to buy copper wires, parts, and auto bearings.

loans.use: to buy copper wires, rectifies and auto bearings.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with three children, all of whom are adults. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For over ten years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

Tabu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season, it becomes difficult to operate.  Hence few customers come to her food stall. She dreams of opening a hotel in the future. With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of maize flour, rice and sacks of beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of maize flour, rice and sacks of beans.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is married and a father of four.  For a living, he sells charcoal.  He has been in the business since 1996.  Apart from selling charcoal, he is a photographer.  Samuel joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that he would save his money and access loan easily.  So far, he has serviced four loans which he has paid successfully.  He has requested another loan of 50,000 Kes.  With the loan, he will buy charcoal.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a hardworking, obedient and reliable lady.  With her personality, she is able to run her clothes-selling business in a competitive environment.  She has been running the business for almost four years and has employed one person.  She was previously selling vehicle spare parts to earn a livelihood for her family. She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 43 years old and lives in the area of West Point. She’s married and has a junior high education. She has three children between the ages of 16 and 25 years old. Catherine has been selling ladies and gents wear for the past six years. Her worst experience is when there’s low turnout of customers so she ends up making little sales during that time.

Catherine is requesting a loan to purchase more cartons of used clothes. She hopes and prays for God's divine favor upon the lives of her children, so that their dreams will come to reality.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario C. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran Zambo del sur. He is 50 years old. Dario is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Dario raises fish for sale. Dario has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Dario joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dario is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing nets used for fishing. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dario from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana M. is a 30-year-old mom. She is married to Majdi and has two children. Rana and her husband started their own home business three years ago selling used shoes. Through these three years, she has applied for four loans to improve their business. Using these loans, she was able to open a separate store to sell used shoes for different ages as a second branch in another area and kept the main branch at her house. Now Rana has applied for her fifth loan to expand and re-decorate both shops.

Rana is a conservative person who didn't want her photo published on the internet. So, her husband Majdi appears in the photo, since he works at the second branch.

loans.use: To expand and re-decorate her shoe shop

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza C. is from the village of Militar, Tukuran Zambo. Del sur. She is 30 years old. Analiza is married and has school-aged children. Analiza has her own general store which sells daily use products such as sugar, milk, canned goods, shampoo, soap & toothpaste. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

Analiza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase dried fish, rice and corn grits for resale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Analiza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish, rice and corn grits for resale

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  Two of her children are currently in school.  Annet has had a small retail shop for one year.  She also has a second business:  motorcycle transport.  

To help expand her retail shop business, Annet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Annet hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.

loans.name: Kyakuwa Development Group

texts.en: 34 year old John M.  has been a food sales businessman for the past 2 years in Kazinga food market, Mukono. The happily married father of 2 says he began by selling tomatoes and later diversified to bananas, eggplant, fruits, vegetables, cassava, beans, and rice.  In spite of his short experience in this business, friends say that John's ambition, diligence, and determination are stocks in trade and will help give his business longevity.  John started this business with savings from his earlier job at a maize flour-making factory in Mukono Town.  He dreams of owning a retail shop in the near future. From John's own account, this business generates him 100,000 shillingas weekly profit. He says with this loan he is going to purchase more foods such as rice, cabbage, yams and millet to resell

loans.use: to purchase rice, cabbage, yams and millet to resell

loans.name: 0410015- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
"Cảnh N. Thị (139) is a 49 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Cảnh is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 0410015- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường (0410015- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường).


Cảnh is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Cảnh operates a family member's business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Cảnh has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Cảnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Cảnh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Cảnh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

4.  N. Thị Nghĩa (115) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

6.  Lê Thị Hạnh (62) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha M. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  Two of his children are currently in school.  Twaha has had a small retail shop for four years.He also has a second business of a metal work shop.         

To help expand his business, Twaha has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Twaha hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Twaha hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad A. Ghanem, a 23-year-old hard working young man, is married and has a baby girl. Mohammad has been working at a carpeting company since 2003 and has gained a lot of experience in the field, but he wasn’t fulfilling his dreams.Mohammad started to teach his wife how to design carpets so they can work together and have another source of income. They have been doing a great job for a while now by creating new designs that caught the customer’s eyes. To be able to improve and continue their work, Mohammad has applied for this loan to open a speciA. and safer home carpeting workshop.

loans.use: To open a special and safer home carpeting workshop.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael M. is 29 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda.  He is married and has one child.  His child is not currently in school.  Michael has had a small retail shop for four years. He also has a second business of a bar.        

To help expand his business, Michael has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Michael hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Michael hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Adolfina
loans.use: to purchase a pair of piglets and fodder, as well as to make a pig cage

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He has been working as a construction worker since 2007, specializing in completing wall foliage jobs. He has eight years of experience in this field. His work is well-accomplished and prepared in modern ways. He would like to increase his income in order to better support his family financially. With his loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will buy construction tools and supplies. He will also invest in purchasing scaffolding needed in order to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and supplies

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 37-year-old woman living in Tyre with her husband and her two kids. She has worked at selling shoes for men, women and kids since 1998, but she opened her own business in 2000. She is a hard-working woman, who seeks to help her husband in all of their family's expenses. Her 13 years of experience gave her the customers' trust and the will to buy even though if they don't need something at the present moment. She gives them the motive to earn her products, her customer service is spoken about by most of her clients.

In addition to that, her good quality products are affordable to all of her customers and ordinary citizens. Hanan is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the seventh time, in order to buy new summer collections. She is insisting on improving her family's situation through opening another branch in the future.

loans.use: To buy women's and children's summer collections.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert K. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  Two of his children are currently in school.  Robert has had a retail shop for five years. He also has a second business selling clothes.        

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Robert hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Robert hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn N. is 27 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Evelyn has had a small gift shop for four years.         

To help expand her business, Evelyn has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more gifts for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Evelyn hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gifts for resale.

loans.name: 0410018- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
"Vạn P. Thị (48) is a 49 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Vạn is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 0410018- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường (0410018- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường).

Vạn is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To making a living, Vạn operates a family member's fishing business harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Vạn has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,100,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Vạn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Vạn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets.  The loan will be the 7th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Vạn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  P. Thị Vòng (78) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


2.  N. Thị Thọ (43) is a 51 year-old female who is requesting a 5000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


3.  Lê Thị Tăm (71) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


4.  Lê Thị Chọn (49) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


5.  P. Thị Trà (100) is a 61 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


6.  Lê Thị Duyên (28) is a 28 year-old female who is requesting a 7000000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Vạn P. Thị (48) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Vạn là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0410018- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường (0410018- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Vạn thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Vạn kiếm được khoảng 2,100,000 VND.  Vào 2002, Vạn đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Vạn đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị đánh cá bao gồm lưỡi câu & lưới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. Thị Vòng (78) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  N. Thị Thọ (43) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  Lê Thị Tăm (71) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  Lê Thị Chọn (49) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  P. Thị Trà (100) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


6.  Lê Thị Duyên (28) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a young woman from Jabalia refugee camp, Ghada is a mother of one daughter, Ghada's husband Suhail is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns $330 per month. Ghada and her husband have very simple furniture, as their resources do not allow them to buy all the items they need, but since they have a daughter who is growing up, Ghada took out a loan from FATEN to purchase furniture for her daughter and fix the room they have by painting and installing windows in the room.

Ghada's husband Suhail appears in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman as are most of the Gaza Strip inhabitants.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture and fix one of the rooms in the house

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and two young children, both in school.  He has been working as a mechanic for 35 years. In 1981, he opened his own garage and proceeded with his car repair work. He is an expert in this occupation with excellent customer service. He works hard as he is the only income provider of the family.  Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more car spare parts and developed machinery. He’s sure that with the new equipment, he will be able to improve his work.

loans.use: to purchase more car spare parts and machinery

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel B. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda.  He is married and has eight children.  Four of his children are currently in school.  Samuel has had a small retail shop for four years.         

To help expand his business, Samuel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Samuel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Samuel hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Stanlaus

texts.en:
Stanlaus M. is thirty-five years old, married, and has three children between ten and five years old. His business is located at Malinya in Kakamega. Kakamega is a rich agricultural area found in the western region of Kenya. The area is known for large-scale production of sugarcane and thus commonly referred to as the sugarbelt region. He sells such items as rice, flour, oil, detergents, soft drinks and others to the local people.  He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business in the area.  Customers are not loyal, as they are spoiled for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more items to expand his business. The items include rice, flour, cooking fat and detergents. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He also hopes to give his children quality education to the university level.  In the future, he sees himself owning a plot of land on which he will build a house for his family. He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, cooking fat, detergents etc

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man with five school-aged children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  

For the past five years, he has been a farmer planting green vegetables, beans and maize and selling them at a profit. He sells from door to door to his neighbours and market dwellers. Moses faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the hot dry season he is not able to plant vegetables.  Therefore, he cannot meet his customers' demands.   During the rainy season, he is able to plant vegetables for sale.  Moses dreams of expanding the business and becoming a sole seller of vegetables in the market. 

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase seeds to plant vegetables. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He has owned a pick-up since 2007. His work consists of transporting vegetables from suppliers to multiple local agricultural markets. He moves across different areas and villages in order to deliver his products to targeted markets. He reports that his previous Kiva loan helped him fulfill his business needs. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his shuttle and repaint it so that he can transfer his products properly. He will also use the loan to register the pick-up and sign the needed legal papers to avoid breaking laws. He is very positive about the future of his business and is willing to hire a part-time employee to help him do the work.

loans.use: to register his van and perform the needed maintenance on it

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
Kasem is a 42-year-old married man living in Tyre with his wife and three kids. Kasem works in construction and has been specialized in cement work since 1998. He is a hard worker. His 15 years of experience give his contractors and other clients trust, since most of them are from Tyre and nearby villages. 

Kasem has a good reputation for his commitment to work. He works hard to provide his family with the best way of living. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to buy iron pillars necessary for his business to cover higher and wider areas in a safe way. Kasem hopes to expand his business in the future, through opening a small construction company that deals with everything that has to do with this domain.

loans.use: To buy new iron pillars necessary for his business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 50 years old and married, with three children.  For nine years, he has been operating a hardware shop.  Besides this, he practices coffee farming.  Peter was previously employed as a clerk.  He decided to go into business so that he would earn enough income to meet his family’s needs.  

With his previous loan from Faulu Kenya, he was able to boost his business.  He has requested 60,000 Kes, which he intends to use to expand his business space.  Peter dreams of growing his business into wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to expand his business premises

loans.name: Zablon

texts.en:
In the photo is Zablon P. S., a 27-year-old.  He has been selling clothes to earn a living for two years.  Previously, he earned a living from tailoring, which he still does. 

 He has been saving his money with a group in Faulu Kenya.  This has made him grow his shares, and now he is eligible to get a loan from Faulu Kenya.  He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kes.  He will use the money to buy inner wear, socks, zippers, and fabric for making clothes.

loans.use: to buy innerwear, socks, zippers, and fabric for making clothes.

loans.name: Garama

texts.en:
Garama is a married man with three school-going children. They live at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a dairy farming business for the past three years; he sells milk from home and at the market to his neighbours and passersby. Garama faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During hot summer season the availability of milk for sale is minimal. He dreams of becoming a reliable supplier of milk in his area in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) he is requesting he wants to purchase a cow for his dairy business. He decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for his dairy business.

loans.name: Mweni

texts.en: Mweni B. lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children who are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and her daughter). Mweni has a business selling bitenge (African Tunics).  She has been in this business for over 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Mweni sells her products from home. Mweni has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of bitenge and more handbags. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.The main business challenge(s) for Mweni include transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell only at wholesale. Mweni lives in a home that she owns and has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bitenge and handbags

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is 34 years old, married and blessed with three children.  To earn a living, he sells newspapers.  He has been in the business for five years.  He was previously selling books so as to earn a living.  Since he joined a group in Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he is also in a position to get a loan easily because the members of the group guarantee each other's loan.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more newspapers from different editors.

loans.use: To buy more newspapers from different editors.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter L. is twenty-five-years-old, married and has two children aged five years old and two years old. His business is located at Malinya in Kakamega. Kakamega is a rich agricultural area located in the western region of Kenya. The area is known for large-scale production of sugarcane and thus commonly referred as the "sugarbelt". 

Peter sells clothes to the local people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more clothes to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to open outlets elsewhere. He also hopes to give his children quality education to the university level. He describes himself as hard-working and determined.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Baraza

texts.en:
Baraza is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 10,000 he is requesting he wants to start a poultry business, purchase chicks and chicken feed. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. Baraza decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access loans to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: To start a poultry business, purchase chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Phillis

texts.en: In the photo is Phillis M., together with her husband.  The couple has three children.  Phillis sells CDs and DVDs so as to earn a living.  She has been in the business for five years.  She works hard in her business so as to help her husband with household expenses.  She hopes to open other outlets of her business so that she can earn more income.  She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more music CDs and movies.

loans.use: To buy more music CDs and movies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. lives in the Kawaala neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members. Fatuma has a hardware business.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. 

Fatuma sells her products at the market, retail.    Fatuma has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of cement, nails and pangas (machetes). The main business challenges for Fatuma include transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are start selling wholesale only and to buy a plot of land.   

Fatuma lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement, nails, and pangas (machetes).

loans.name: 0410016- Giang Sơn -Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Đức P. Thị (112) is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Hoằng hoá-Thanh Hoá. Đức is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 0410016-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường (0410016-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường). 

Đức is married and has four adult children. Đức has a store which mainly sells confectionary products in the local community. Đức has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from these activities. 

In 2010, Đức joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Đức has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,248,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Đức plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 

1. P. Thị Lan (2) is a 59-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her general store. 

2. T. Thị Thuý (3) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 

3. N. Thị Thu (110) is a 55-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her general store. 

4. P. Thị Hằng (99) is a 54-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 

5. Lê Thị Vân (116) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 

6. Lê Thị Cúc (111) is a 28-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 

7. N. Thị Nga (119) is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business. 

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: 

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. 

Đức P. Thị (112) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng hoá-Thanh Hoá. Đức là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có eight các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 0,410,016-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường (0,410,016-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường). 

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Đức thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn five năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Đức kiếm được khoảng 1,000,000 VND. Vào 2010, Đức đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/anh ấy. Đức đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4,248,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND. 

Khoản vay sẽ là second khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 

one. P. Thị Lan (two) là 59 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 

two. T. Thị Thuý (three) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 

three. N. Thị Thu (110) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 

four. P. Thị Hằng (99) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 

five. Lê Thị Vân (116) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 

six. Lê Thị Cúc (111) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 

seven. N. Thị Nga (119) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7,000,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản. 

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: 

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. 

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch.. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with eight children, all of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a cashew nut sales business; she sells at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanaisha faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the hot dry season the availability of cashew nuts for resale is lower compared to in the rainy winter season where the availability of cashew nuts is higher. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, bananas, cabbages, onions and green vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en:
N. Goreth lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). Goreth   has a poultry farm.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works 6 days out of every week. 

Goreth sells her products from home, wholesale or retail.    She  has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of chicken feed.    The main business challenges for Goreth include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 2000 chickens.  

Goreth lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Zayirbek

texts.en:
Zayirbek T. was born in and lives in the Republic of Tadjikistan. He grew up in a large family with eight children and from early childhood he had to help his parents in the field and in breeding cattle. After serving in the army, Zayirbek returned home and began to work as a driver at his local place. He was 25 years old when he married and he later became the father of three boys. 

In 1999 Zayirbek with his family moved to the central part of Kyrgyzstan, to Oktyabrskoe village. Using the money he had earned, Zayirbek bought a house and got a job as a driver. Using his salary, he was able to buy bull-calves for fattening and in 2008, he decided to devote his time to an animal breeding business. 

Being a very purposeful and positive person, Zayirbek works hard to support his family and today, he has three milk cows, one bull-calf and two sheep at his farm. Zayirbek plans to use this loan of 80,000 Kyrgyz Soms to increase the number of cattle. In the future, Zayirbek is planning to give higher education to his children and build a house for his family 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Galdan

texts.en:
Galdan is 63 years old and lives with his wife in a house in Songino-Hairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All his children are grown up and live by themselves. He manages a fruit and vegetable preserves business in Ulaanbaatar city. 

He started his business in 1998 with the help of his wife. Before his business operation he used to work at the General Police Department of Mongolia as an inspector. Now he produces a variety of products including pickled cucumbers, cucumbers in brine, various vegetable salads, pickled mushrooms, horseradish and beetroot with horseradish and pickled peppers, etc. His products are quite popular amongst his customers. 

Galdan is an honest man who has managed to stabilize his business. He says, "I am happy managing this business because it has allowed me to have consistent earnings that support my life." He is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to purchase vegetables in order to increase his business sales.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan is 42 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a house in Songino-hairhan district, Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. His two older sons, age eight and 14, attend a local secondary school while his two younger daughters go to a kindergarten. 

He manages a transportation service business in Ulaanbaatar city. He started his business in 2001 by transporting garbage to landfill sites. Sometimes he transports imported goods and products to their destination area. Since 2001 he was able to stabilize his business and is planning to continue it in the future. He is a hardworking man who says, "I am doing my best to feed my family. " He is requesting a 2,500,000 Mongolian tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase auto parts for his truck and to do some repair work.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts and pay for repairs

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine N. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her mother).   Justine   has a bar.  She has been in this business for six years, and she works six days out of every week. Justine sells her products from home, wholesale or retail. 

 Justine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.
