The main business challenges for Justine include defaulters, seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar and also to build her own house. 

Justine lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerry cans of local brew.

loans.name: Johnes

texts.en:
Johnes W. is a married man but has no children yet. His business is located at the busy Kongowea market in Mombasa. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attractions not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He sells fruits and vegetables to the local people. 

Johnes has been in this business for two years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many people doing the same kind of business as his in the area and so customers are not loyal as they are spoilt for choice. However he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more kale, onions, tomatoes and other fruits and vegetables to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to grow the business and become the supplier of groceries in Mombasa. In future, he sees himself owning a farm from which he will be growing and selling vegetables. He describes himself as ambitious.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is 51 years old and is a married man with five children. His wife works as a municipal bookkeeper.

Gregorio has been in the business of raising hogs for eight years. He plans to use his loan to purchase pig feed, vitamins and other supplies. Gregorio works hard for his family. One of his priorities is his children's education as he wants them to finish college and find jobs.

In the future, Gregorio hopes for his family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, vitamins and other supplies.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with two children. She is 25 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store for three months. She has been a school food vendor for five years.

Maribel sells items like canned goods, soy sauce and soft drinks at her sari-sari store. She usually earns 2500 PHP per month with her business.

Maribel is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods and noodles. She also plans to buy fertilizers for their farm, which her husband mainly manages. 

In the future, Maribel hopes to have a stable business and for her children to finish college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and additional items to sell like canned goods.

loans.name: Ceasaria

texts.en:
Ceasaria is 58 years old and is a married woman with one child. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Ceasaria has been engaged in farming for 20 years. She grows rice crops to sell to other nearby towns. She also bakes bread that she sells to the people in her neighborhood. Ceasaria has requested a loan to purchase flour for her baking, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to purchase flour for her baking and fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene B. M. is a single lady who has 2 children, ages 5 and 10 years old, whom she hopes to give a good education to the university level. Irene makes food, mainly plain beans and githeri (a mixture of cooked maize and beans) by the roadside. She sells to passersby and repeat buyers in a residential area in Mombasa. Mombasa is in the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, especially the Indian Ocean white beaches. 

Irene has been doing this business for the last 3 years now. She says that her business is profitable, but the major challenge she has is lack of a premises where she could run and grow her food business. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to buy maize and beans to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to open a restaurant in the future. She describes herself as an honest and trustworthy lady.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en:
Varditer D. lives in Yerevan with her husband. Varditer’s two sons are in the army. Her husband is a taxi driver. Varditer sells women’s clothing which is the family’s main source of income. Varditer wants to sell more clothes and develop her business. 

With the requested loan she plans to purchase clothes and increase the trade. With the loan’s help Varditer will get more income and will be able to ensure better living conditions for her sons in the future. This is Varditer’s second Kiva loan.

loans.use: To pay for clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. N. is 40 years old and married. Her husband is a businessman and they have 4 children; aged between 10 and 25 years old. Mary's business is located in Kakamega town. Kakamega is a rich agricultural area found in the western region of Kenya. The area is known for large-scale production of sugarcane and thus commonly referred to as the "sugar belt region". 

Mary runs a clothing sales business and her major customers are the local people. She says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and open outlets elsewhere. She also hopes to give all her children a quality education to the university level. Mary describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a young mother of two daughters and two sons. Sabah wants to purchase beds and daughters' room items as they are growing up and need to have a proper room.

Sabah took out a loan from FATEN to pay for those items as her husband is an employee with a very decent salary and can only afford a small payment every month that FATEN helped him get.

Sabah's husband is photographed instead of her as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for their daughters' bedroom.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.en:
Edilberto is 52 years old, married, and has a 2-year-old child. Edilberto is a seaweed farmer. He has been engaged in this business for 6 years. He usually earns 5,000 PHP per month from this farming. He plans to use his loan to purchase straw and other materials for seaweed farming.

In the future, Edilberto hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase straw and other materials for seaweed farming

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is a 42-year-old woman who lives in the West Point area. She and her partner are living together. They have 5 children between the ages of 5 and 12; all of them attend school. Hanna runs a mini-used clothing and shoe store in her area. Sales are not always good because the inventory in her shop is low. Hanna is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes and shoes for her business.

Hanna's dream is to build a house for her children and send them to quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes for her business

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard O. is 32 years old and married to an accountant. He owns an electronic sales shop and also does computer repairs in Kakamega town. Kakamega is a rich agricultural area found in the western region of Kenya. The area is known for large-scale production of sugarcane and thus commonly referred to as the "sugar belt region". 

He says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 80,000 KES to buy more electronics to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. 

Leonard hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He also hopes to open a bigger electronic sales shop in Kakamega town. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase computer accessories

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en: Raymond is 29 years old and lives in West Point. He’s single and has one child, age 3. Raymond has been selling men shoes for 11 years now and needs to expand his business since his shop is very small. He’s requesting a loan to purchase more shoes for his business. In the future, Raymond plans to build houses and invest in farming.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes for his business

loans.name: Wesseh

texts.en: Wesseh is 36 years old and lives in West Point. He stopped his education at the junior high level and has two children ages 7 and 10. Wesseh is engaged in selling men's shoes and suit coats in the local market, but he doesn't sell many in the rainy season when there are fewer customers. He is requesting a loan to purchase more suit coats and shoes for his business. He plans to build a house for his children and marry a decent woman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more suit coats and shoes to grow his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married man living with his wife and three school-aged children. He is from Lebanon. This man works hard to be able to pay his family expenses and his children's schooling. He has been involved in the construction field for 23 years. 

In 1992, he started to work on a freelance basis, taking on multiple construction projects. Because of his older age, this man hired three full-time employees in order to achieve his business plans. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase scaffolding to help him when structuring outside higher parts of buildings.

 In the future, he is planning to expand his business operation by opening his own office and working with some construction entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase home furniture: fridge and kitchen table and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase hairdressing tools and equipment.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Jabalia refugee camp. Muhammad is a father of one son. Muhammad's house is a very small one that has only one bedroom, a kitchen and a sitting room. Muhammad started building an extension in the backyard of his house.

Muhammad, who appears in the picture here, needs $1,500 from FATEN to cover the rest of the construction expenses so as to have a room that his son would use.

loans.use: to enlarge their house by adding a new room.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline O. is 25 years old. She is single and does not have any children yet. Her business is located in a town called Kakamega, a rich agricultural area in the western region of Kenya. The area is known for large-scale production of sugarcane and thus commonly referred to as the sugarbelt region. 

Caroline runs an M-Pesa (mobile money transfer) shop that serves the local people. She has been in this business for some time and says it is profitable, but the major challenge is having enough money to enable her to carry out many big transactions. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She will use her loan of Kes 20,000 to add to her float to grow the business and serve more people. She hopes to open outlets elsewhere one day.  Caroline describes herself as hardworking, focused and determined.

loans.use: to add to the float of her money transfer shop

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 30-year-old married woman with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the bar and lodge business for four years in which she started with 500,000 shillings and now has 4 million shillings. Annet intends to use the requested loan to buy more beer for selling. Her goal is to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy beer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, salt and flour for sale

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Edith owns a beauty salon business. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Edith sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail. 

Edith has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva's partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids. She also generates additional income through operating a boda-boda (motorcycle for hire).The main business challenges for Edith include defaulters, seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked bar and also to build her own house.   Edith lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids for her beauty salon

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a 31-year-old married man with six children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Gerald has operated a retail shop for three years and, with the income, he has been able to educate his children and buy land. His hardships include bad debtors, high transport costs, limited funds and inflation. Nevertheless, his vision is to own a large-scale retail shop and educate his family. Gerald requested a loan to buy rice, cooking oil and sugar for sale.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil and sugar for sale

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en: Bassam is a 42-year-old ambitious man who is married and has four daughters and two sons. Since he has a big family, Bassam can not depend only on his retirement salary to support his family so he searched for what he could do to have another source of income. After he retired from the Public Security Directorate, he decided to open a shop to sell used furniture, so he rented a place, re-decorated it and started to sell used furniture two years ago. Bassam’s Store has gained a good reputation in his area, and by the word of mouth, his business has been running smoothly since he launched it. Now Bassam wants to expand his business to include selling new furniture too, that’s why he applied for a loan.

loans.use: To expand his business to include selling new furniture

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 47-year-old married man who has three children and rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in a transport and newspaper business for four years. The business has been profitable as he has been able to pay school fees for his children. His hardships include bad debtors and his vision is to diversify into a retail shop and buy a car. Joseph needs the requested loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Salveri

texts.en: Salveri is a 30-year-old married man who has one child and rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for three years. He started with working capital of 800,000 shillings and now has 2,500,000 shillings. Salveri's hardships include breakage of goods during transportation. His goal is to stock up 10 million shillings in three years time and to build a house. Salveri requested a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of cashew nuts for resale.

loans.name: Alinyikira Mbatuusa Group

texts.en:
32-year-old N. Safina is a sturdy, candid and enterprising woman who, friends say, has a streak of hard work in whatever she does. That virtue has been of paramount importance in her 11 years of experience in the teaching profession. Safina, who is happily married with 2 kids, derives her livelihood from teaching at schools in and around Mabada in the Mpigi district of Central Uganda. The commitment she has shown in practicing what she was taught at a training institution is exemplary, notwithstanding the low remuneration that teachers all over Uganda are faced with. 

What has been of much help to Safina is the fact that she also does some farming as a side business. At present, she says she wants to invest more in her farming business as she reckons she will be able to earn from it if she improves her gardens with high grade manure. From her teaching job, she earns 270,000 shillings per month. Safina says with proceeds from the requested loan she is going to purchase high grade manure to improve the fertility of her gardens for farming.

loans.use: to purchase high grade manure to improve the fertility of her gardens for farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Tuzamurane Nº2 / Rsz Group

texts.fr: Aphrodis Ntakirutimana est agriculteur de riz, membre de groupe Tuzamurane 2, et client d’ACB depuis 2011.  Il a 38 ans, il est marie, et il a 7 enfants entre 1 mois et 16 ans.  Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Aphrodis est ne au Rwanda, et il a fini 8 ans d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des matériels pour son activité d’agriculture de riz.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’avoir une bonne récolte, et il voudrait devenir un grand agriculteur dans le secteur de Rusizi.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en: Aphrodis Ntakirutimana is a rice farmer and a member of the group Tuzamurane 2. He has been a client of ACB since 2011. He is 38 years old and married, and he has seven children, aged 1 month to 16 years. Three of this children go to school. Aphrodis was born in Rwanda. He has completed eight years of primary schooling. This loan cycle is his first one with ACB. He is going to use it to buy supplies and equipment for his work in growing rice. His strategy for business growth is to achieve a good harvest. And he would like to become a major grower in the Rusizi district. As for his family, he would like to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Khanga Group

texts.en: Fatma N. is a 46-year-old widow who has six children, three of whom are in school. She makes a living selling breakfast and lunch to factory workers. She has been in the business for nine years, works from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. daily and makes a small but steady profit. This will be Fatma's second loan from Tjijenge Tanzania. She used her first loan to buy supplies and equipment for her business; her dream is to own a modern restaurant and provide lunch to office workers. Fatma leads a loan group called "Khanga" which has 15 members, all of whom hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. In this photo, we see Fatma in the front row, second from right in a dark green dress.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a food-selling business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab A. A. is a 55-year-old mother with six daughters and one son. Her husband Nayef is 64 years old and has his own grocery store. Since they have a big family, Zainab decided to use her skills in embroidery to help support her husband. Zainab has been embroidering for 11 years at her home. She makes the most beautiful dresses, which are also known as a traditional dress for women in Jordan. Through these 11 years, she added embroidery art to another type of clothes called “Abaya”, and got a lot of demand for them. Now Zainab wants to sell ordinary clothes besides the traditional clothes so she can cover most of her customers’ desires. That's why she applied for a loan.

loans.use: To buy ordinary clothes to sell

loans.name: Korofer

texts.en: M. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables. She is 40 years old, married, and has 5 children -- all of whom go to school. M. borrowed a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Mwnajuma has been operating a food vending business for the past six years, selling retail to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also owns rental houses which contributes to her income. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing more rental houses in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 40,000, Mwnajuma wants to purchase coconuts and bundles of dried fish for her food market. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish and coconuts to resell

loans.name: Mt. Kipengere Group

texts.en: Nuru H. is 35 years old, married and has two children. For the last seven years, she has made a living by running a beauty salon. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and makes a small monthly profit. This will be Nuru's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous ones, which she successfully repaid, to buy a hair dryer. She hopes to use this loan to buy clothing to sell to her customers. Nuru is a member of a loan group called Mt. Kipengere which has 18 members, each of whom holds the others accountable for paying back this loan. In this photo, we see Nuru sitting in the second row, third from left.

loans.use: to start selling clothes in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Euphemia

texts.en:
Euphemia is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past two years, she has been operating a clothes vending business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also operates a charcoal selling business, which contributes as her other source of income. 

Euphemia faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business. During holiday seasons she experiences high number of customers while during the months of January to May she experiences a low number of customer turn out. She dreams of operating a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 80,000 loan she is requesting, Euphemia wants to purchase cloth materials, curtains, Kikoi's and Leso's for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials, curtains, kikoi's and leso's to rell

loans.name: Germaine

texts.fr:
MADAME GERMAINE EST INSTITUTRICE DE PROFESSION.PARALLÈLEMENT A SON ACTIVITÉ PROFESSIONNELLE ELLE S'ATTELLE AUSSI DANS L'ACHAT ET LA REVENTE DE TÉLÉPHONE PORTABLE.
ELLE S'APPROVISIONNE PRINCIPALEMENT EN MAURITANIE.ELLE CAPITALISE UNE EXPÉRIENCE DE 4ANS ET A EU A PRENDRE 4 PRÊTS QU'ELLE A SOLDER.ELLE SOLLICITE CE MONTANT POUR AUGMENTER SON FONDS DE ROULEMENT.
texts.en: Ms. THIAKANE is a grade school teacher by profession. Concurrently, she has a business she also works at, the buying and selling of mobile phones. She gets her supplies mainly from Mauritania. She capitalizes on four years of experience and has had four loans, which she has settled. She is requesting this [new loan] to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy mobile telephones from Mauritania for resale

loans.name: Atakola Womens Group, Jinja

texts.en:
Betty I. is the leader of the Atakola group in Jinja. She is 48 years old, is married, and has 2 children aged 21 and 13 years. 

Betty sells second-hand clothes as a mobile seller by moving to different markets in and around Jinja. Her customers are mostly community members and she is able to make 50,000 UGX in weekly profit. Betty works alone in her business hence knows how to manage her resources. She has been in this business for 20 years.  To start the business, she got capital from a restaurant.  She attributes her success to determination. Her plan is to be able to expand her business and have a second business where someone will assist her to sell clothes in a stationed market stall. 

Betty has been able to buy goats from her accumulated profits and hopes to expand this kind of farming. Betty needs a loan to be able to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Kamu Kamu Group

texts.en: 33 year old S. Samuel is affiliated to Kamu Kamu Group-Mpigi. He is a hard working and affable father of 3 who has been transacting his food sales business in Natete food market-Kampala for almost 4 years.  He sells mostly maize flour, beans and Peas.  He began this business immediately after he transferred responsibility for running his  second hand shoe sales business to his young brother.  He still oversees the business, though the brother is the one selling the shoes. Monthly, he says, this business generates him shillings 100,000 as profit. With this loan, Samuel is going to purchase more food such as cassava, potatoes and rice to resell.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, potatoes and rice for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with two school age children. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Her husband is a security officer and he contributes to his family basic needs with his earnings. 

For the past four years, Florence has operated a vegetable stall business, selling green vegetables like kale, tomatoes and potatoes. In addition she also operates a water selling business which contributes to her other source of income. Florence faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding it and establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy photography materials like film and picture frames for his studio.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina, nacida en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos, a los cuales ella los ha criado sola con su ardua labor, ella se dedica a vender ropa  y también tiene un salón de belleza. De hecho ella comenzó vendiendo mercadería ambulante, en las comunidades cercanas a Pueblo Nuevo, esto lo hizo por diez años. A los 35 años de edad, se dedico a vender ropa y cosmético y a cortar cabello todo esto lo hizo a través de un préstamo que le concedieron. Hoy en dia tiene su negocio establecido de venta de ropa, cosméticos y salón de belleza.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa nueva y  cosméticos para abastecer su tienda de nuevos y mejores productos. Con esta inversión espera aumentar su clientela, mejorar las ventas y ampliar su negocio.
Tiene como plan futuro seguir trabajando duro para preparar a sus hijos para la universidad  y componer su casa. Tiene como meta próxima ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefina was born in Pueblo Nuevo, located in the Estelí municipality.  She is 45 years old and the single mother of two children, who she has raised alone through hard work.  She dedicates herself to selling clothing and also has a beauty salon.  She sells clothing door-to-door throughout communities near Pueblo Nuevo, which she has been doing for ten years.  At 35 years of age she started selling clothing and cosmetics, as well as cutting hair.  She managed all this through a loan that she was granted.

Today, she has well-established clothing and cosmetics sales and beauty salon businesses.  She requests the loan to buy new clothing and cosmetics to supply her store with new and improved products.  With this investment, she hopes to augment her customer base, grow sales and expand her business.  Her future plans are to continue working hard to prepare her children for attending university and improve her home.  Her next goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: buy new clothing and cosmetics to supply her store with new and improved products.

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ Y VIDA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lucia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de zapatos, venta de carne, venta de ropa, elaboración de calzados, producción de bateas, comercio de frutas, trenzado de mantas, venta de artefactos de cocina.

La señora Lucia,  indica que es la primera vez que participa en una asociación comunal y en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de bateas de turriles, el que aprendió de su esposo y viene realizando hace seis años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de turriles (materia prima para la elaboración de sus bateas), este material lo comprará del servicio de caminos. Posterior a la fabricación de las bateas las comercializará en la Ceja (zona comercial de la ciudad de El Alto). Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.
texts.en:
The loan association "Luz y Vida" will begin their first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Juan Pablo II [John Paul II Center]. The group is made of up 9 members and is directed by a board headed by Lucia. The association members have various businesses including: shoe sales, meat sales, clothing sales, shoe making, making trays, fruit vending, braiding blankets, and selling kitchen items.

Lucia says that this is the first time she has participated in a community association and in Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a friend. Currently she has a business making trays from barrels, which she learned from her husband and started doing six years ago.

The loan that she will take out now is to buy barrels (necessary material for making her trays). She will buy them from the road service. After making the trays she will sell them in la Ceja (the commercial zone of the city of El Alto). This form of work allows her to generate resources to help her family as much as possible, since she is married and has 3 children.

When they ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the office.

loans.use: to buy material to make barrels.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica forma parte del banco comunal “Pocuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Coronel.
Ella tiene un almacén en el cual vende provisiones, artículos de librería, servicio de teléfonos y venta de frutas. Jessica se dedica a éste rubro desde hace un año, además su horario laboral es de lunes a domingo y su almacén está ubicado en su misma casa.
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en distribuidoras, supermercados mayoristas y a los proveedores de productos.
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería para abastecer su almacén.
Sus metas son abrir un local para vender frutas y verduras, además de abastecer completamente su actual negocio con diferentes productos. Respecto a sus sueños a nivel personal, son que sus hijos disfruten de un buen estado de salud. 
Jessica vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 8 y 26 años de edad. 
Ella está muy agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que con éste podrá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Además participa de los talleres de ventas que se realizan en las reuniones, conocimientos que ha podido aplicar en su negocio. Respecto a las reuniones con los demás socios, Jessica se siente muy a gusto, ya que éstas son muy gratas y se ha generado una mayor comunicación y solidaridad entre los integrantes del banco comunal. 
Coronel es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Bíobío. Posee una economía basada en servicios, explotación forestal, agricultura. Cuenta también con una importante tradición minera en carbón, actividad que ya no se realiza, pero de la cual quedó la mina de carbón “Chiflón Puchoco”, convertida ahora en museo minero.
texts.en:
Jessica is part of the "Pocuro" communal bank in the city of Coronel. She has a store where she sells groceries, stationery items, telephone service, and fruit. Jessica has been working in this business for a year. Her work schedule is from Monday to Sunday and the store is located in her house.

She generally buys her merchandise from distributors, wholesale supermarkets and the product providers. She will use this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.

Her goals are to open a place to sell fruits and vegetables, as well as to fully stock her current business with different products. On a personal level, her dream is that her children will enjoy a good quality of life.

Jessica lives together with her husband and their two children, ages 8 and 26 years old.

She is very grateful for the loan offered through Fondo Esperanza, since with this she will be able to invest in her business and generate better income. She also participates in the sales workshops that take place at their meetings, where she has learned things she has applied to her business. Regarding the meetings with the rest of the group members, Jessica feels very pleased because they are enjoyable and have created better communication and solidarity between the members of the communal bank.

Coronel is a community located near the city of Concepción in southern Chile, in Bíobío region. It has an economy based in services, forestry, and agriculture. It also has an important history of carbon mining, though that activity no longer happens there. However, the "Chiflón Puchoco" carbon mine remains and has now been converted into a mining museum.

loans.use: to stock her store with merchandise

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with one child who graduated from school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is the electricity bill.

For the past eight years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, she sells from home to her neighbors and passersby.  Saumu not only operates a charcoal selling business but also owns real estate, which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 60,000 loan request, she wants to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans that will boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 sacks of charcoal and firewood for sale.

loans.name: Juan Blas

texts.es: Juan Blas tiene 27 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado. Tiene más de 2 años en este negocio, Juan tiene un hijo a su cargo pues siempre se ha preocupado por brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes y ofrecer una buena calidad en sus productos. Inicio por la necesidad de ayudar a su Papa que anteriormente él se dedicaba a este negocio, con el paso del tiempo es que decide otórgaselo a Juan para que lo administrara y pudiera mantener a su familia. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de chivos, vacas, toros, caballos y yeguas.
texts.en: Juan Blas is 27 years old and he buys and sells livestock.  He has been in this business for more than 2 years.  Juan has a child who depends on him so he has always been concerned with providing the best service to his customers and providing high quality products.  He started working in livestock by necessity to help his father, who was previously engaged in this business.  Over time, Juan decided to manage the business so that he could support his family.  This loan is for the purchase of goats, cows, bulls, horses, and mares.

loans.use: to purchase goats, cows, bulls, horses, and mares.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abadahemukirana Group

texts.fr: Fréderic M. est agriculteur de riz dans le secteur de Rusizi, membre du groupe Abadahemukirana, et client d’ACB depuis 2011.  Il a 40 ans, il est marie, et il a 4 enfants entre 6 ans et 7 ans.  Deux de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Fréderic est ne au Rwanda, et il a fini 6 ans d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter des matériels pour son activité d’agriculture de riz.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’avoir une bonne récolte cette saison.  Il voudrait avoir une bonne production, et aussi éduquer ses enfants.NB: il a une personne de plus dans la photo car le groupe a 5 membres, il etait proposé dans le groupe mais il a été exclu par apres.
texts.en:
Fréderic M. is a rice farmer in the Rusizi district and a member of the group Abadahemukirana. He has been a client of ACB since 2011. He is 40 years old and married, and he has four children, aged 6 to 7 years old. Two of his children attend school. Fréderic was born in Rwanda. He has completed six years of primary schooling. 

This loan cycle is his first one with ACB, and he is going to use his loan to buy equipment and supplies for his work in growing rice. His strategy for business growth is to have a good harvest this season. He would like to obtain a good yield and also to educate his children. 

Note: There is an extra person in the photo, since the group has five members. He was to be a group member but was excluded later.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Jonnathan

texts.es:
Jonnathan forma parte del banco comunal “Pocuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Coronel.
El tiene un almacén en el cual vende provisiones, artículos de librería, servicio de teléfonos y venta de frutas. Jonnathan se dedica a éste rubro desde hace un año, ya que anteriormente tenía un negocio de lavado de autos, sin embargo le robaron todas sus maquinarias, debido a los saqueos ocurridos en la ciudad de Concepción. En la actualidad Jonnathan se encuentra trabajando, por lo que su madre y socia queda a cargo del negocio, ya que su almacén está ubicado en su misma casa.
Su mercadería la compra generalmente en la Vega monumental, que es una feria de abarrotes, frutas y verduras. 
Con éste préstamo comprará una máquina congeladora para helados.
Sus metas son tener una frutería y verdulería, ya que dónde vive sólo hay panaderías, además desea obtener una máquina de barquillos, que le permita vender helados en la temporada de verano. 
Su sueño a nivel personal, es poder terminar sus estudios de Administración de empresas con mención en Recursos Humanos. Por esto las motivaciones de proyectarse en su negocio y seguir con éste.
Jonnathan vive junto a sus padres y su hermano de 8 años de edad. 
Él está agradecido y contento del crédito otorgado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que éste le ha dado la oportunidad de concretar sus proyectos y además podrá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ganancias. Además participa de los talleres de ventas que se realizan en las reuniones, conocimientos que ha podido aplicar en su negocio. 
Coronel es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Bíobío. Posee una economía basada en servicios, explotación forestal, agricultura. Cuenta también con una importante tradición minera en carbón, actividad que ya no se realiza, pero de la cual quedó la mina de carbón “Chiflón Puchoco”, convertida ahora en museo minero.
texts.en:
Jonnathan is part of the communal bank "Pocuro", which belongs to the city of Coronel.  He has a store that sells supplies, stationery, telephone services, and fruit.   Jonnathan has been in this business since last year, having previously been in the car wash business.  However, all his machines were stolen in the looting that occurred in the city of Concepción.  Today, Jonnathan is working, so his mother (another member) is in charge of the business because their store is located in the same house.  He usually buys their goods in the Vega Monumental, which is a market that sells groceries, fruits, and vegetables.  

With the requested loan he will buy an ice cream freezer.  His goals are to have a fruit and vegetable shop because where he lives, there are only bakeries.  He also wants a waffle maker so that he can sell ice cream cones in the summer.  His dream on a personal level is to finish his studies in Business Administration with a concentration in Human Resources.  He is motivated to improve his business so that he can continue his studies.

Jonnathan lives with his parents and 8-year-old brother.  He is thankful for the loan granted by Fondo Esperanza as it has given him the opportunity to realize his projects and will also allow him to invest in his business and generate more revenue.  He is also participating in sales workshops that are at meetings and he has applied that knowledge to his business.

Coronel is a municipality located in southern Chile, near the town of Concepción. Bíobío region.  It has an economy based on services, forestry, and agriculture.  It also has a strong tradition of coal mining, which is now extinct, but there still remains a coal mine “Chiflón Puchoco", which is now a mining museum.

loans.use: to buy an ice cream freezer.

loans.name: Terezia

texts.en:
Terezia is a married woman with three children, one attends school while the other two are employed. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also sells shoes which contributes to her other source of income. Terezia faces a major challenge of competition from other shoes operators and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan request she wants to purchase bundles of shoes and clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of shoes and clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ngano Group

texts.en: Zainabu M. is 45 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in secondary school. Since 2003, she has made a living by selling fried and fresh fish. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and makes a small monthly profit. She is applying for her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to buy fish to sell and hopes to use her portion of this loan to start a new business, a stationary shop. She will start small but hopes to own a large stationary shop some day. Zainabu belongs to a 22-person loan group called "Ngano." Each member holds the others accountable for paying back the loan. In this photo, we see Zainabu on the right in the last row, standing behind the man who is wearing a blue jacket.

loans.use: To open a stationary business

loans.name: Mujeres Poaquileñas Group

texts.es:
MUJERES POAQUILEÑAS
La señora María Elena S. P. como presidenta de Banco de Mujeres de Confianza día a día  desde temprano se dedica a trabajar para el sostenimiento de su familia trabajando arduamente en su casa con un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de consumo diario y un molino de nixtamal, también se dedica a la crianza de animales como pollos, cerdos y vacas, los días domingos desde temprano sale de su casa para ir al mercado porque ella tiene una venta de verduras, tiene bajo su responsabilidad a cuatro hijos que están estudiando en la escuela primaria.
Las demás integrantes del Banco se dedican a diferentes actividades como artesanía, crianza de animales, venta de refacciones, venta de verduras venta de ropas típicas, agricultura, todas trabajan y luchan para la superación de su familia y para un buen desarrollo familiar. 
Solicitan este credito para compra de insumos comestibles y asi engrandecer mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Women of Poaquileñas

María Elena S. P. is the president of the Banco de Mujeres de Confianza. Every day she works to support her family by working hard at home with a small grocery store that sells daily products and with her corn mill.  She also raises animals, such as chickens, pigs, and cows. On Sundays, she leaves her house early to go to the market because she has a vegetable stall. She has in her charge four children who are studying in primary school.

The other members of the bank work in different activities, such as crafts, raising animals, selling replacement car parts, selling vegetables, selling traditional clothing, and agriculture. Everyone works so their family can get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy food products so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes qui composent le groupe DANAYA sont toutes des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Elles résident au quartier Dougounina qui relève de la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles se sont connues à travers  des relations de parenté. Face aux difficultés d’acheter correctement les produits, dues au manque de ressources financières, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit  de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de groupe dont les quatre prêts précédents ont été bien soldés.
Avec ce prêt la présidente du groupe, Mariam D. compte acheter, 200 kg de noix de néré pour faire du « Sounbala » très apprécié dans la sauce africaine, 300kg de feuilles de baobab séchée et 150kg de dah. Tous ces condiments seront achetés à BOUGOUNI et ses environs, pour les revendre ensuite au comptant et en détail sur le marché de BOUGOUNI, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Avec ce prêt les femmes envisagent obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000 FCFA par mois dont une partie sera utilisé pour solder le prêt et l’autre partie sera utilisé dans les frais de santé de leurs enfants.
texts.en: The women who make up the group Danaya are all married women who are 38 years old on average, have five children and all live in large traditional conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, co-spouses, children and spouses.  They live in the neighborhood of Dougounina, which is under the jurisdiction of the city of Bougouni, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  They know one another through parental relations.  Faced with difficulties in properly buying products due to a lack of financial resources, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso's loan program.  They are on their fifth group loan, having settled the balance of their previous four loans.  With this loan, the president of the group, Mariam D., expects to buy 200 kg of African locust tree nuts to make "Sounbala," which is very valued in African sauce, as well as 300 kg of dried baobab leaves and 150 kg of bissap.  All the spices will be bought in Bougoni and its surrounding areas, to then be resold together for cash and in bulk at the market of Bougoni to a customer base composed largely of women.  With this loan the women plan to make a monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA per month, of which a part will be used to repay their loan and the rest used to pay for their children's health costs.

loans.use: to purchase spices.

loans.name: Saadan Group

texts.en: Erick S. is 38 years old, married and has one child who is in secondary school. Since 2007, he has made a living by selling fruits and vegetables. He works from 7:30 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and makes a small monthly profit from his business. He is applying for his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Erick successfully repaid his previous loans, which he used to expand his business and buy more items to sell to his customers. He plans to use his portion of this loan to open up a new fruit and vegetable stand in his neighborhood. His dream is to someday own a large supermarket. Erick belongs to a 19-member loan group called "Saadan." Each member holds all the others accountable for repaying this loan. In this photo, we see Erick sitting in the front row, second from left, wearing a blue and white striped shirt.

loans.use: to open a new fruits and vegetables stand.

loans.name: Estela Lili

texts.es:
Estela de 49 años, es una mujer inspiradora en su trabajo que decidió poner su papelería en su sector.

Ella labora diariamente y en todo el día por que su papelería lo tiene en su mismo domicilio, le afecta en su negocio la delincuencia ya que por el sector esta peligroso. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, papelería, plumas, para aumentar sus ingresos. 

Ella anhela agrandar su negocio con mas mercaderia para que sus clientes se hagan fieles al comprar la mercaderia.
texts.en:
Estela, 49, is an inspiirational woman in her work who decided to open a stationery store in her area.

She works all day because she has her stationery store in her home, but there are problems because the area where she lives is dangerous.  She will use the loan to buy notebooks, stationery, and pens to increase her income.

Estela would like to enlarge her business with more merchandise for her customers so that they remain loyal and buy from her.

loans.use: To buy stationery, pens and notebooks

loans.name: Esther Isabel

texts.es: Esther Isabel tiene 53 años, hace 3años que tiene este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a solicitar los diferentes productos que ofrece ella es una persona muy cariñosa y tranquila así sus clientes sienten más confianza al llegar a su pulpería. En la actualidad está trabajando todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, pues siempre muestra mucho entusiasmo para brindar una buena atención. Este primer crédito lo va utilizar para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, detergentes, pan, sopas, enlatados, fósforos entre otros.
texts.en: Esther Isabel is 53 years old and has had this business for 3 years.  Her business is located in her home where most of her customers come to ask for various products that she offers.  She is a very loving and calm person so her customers feel comfortable to come to her store.  She is currently working every day from 7 am to 9 pm and she always shows a lot of enthusiasm to show that she cares.  This is her first loan and she is going to use it to buy candy, soft drinks, grains, detergents, bread, soups, canned goods, matches, and more.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, grains, detergents, bread, soups, canned goods, matches, etc.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: Luz Mary S.  oriunda del Tolima, llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla hace 32 Años  después de haber vivido en Armero, ciudad desaparecida por una avalancha de lodo desastres natural  de gran impacto en Colombia. Una vez radicada en la ciudad de Barranquilla conformó su familia y hoy tiene dos hijos en las edades de 12 y 14 años, con los que sueña ver exitosos y muy profesionales en lo que decidan hacer. Luz Mary como siempre emprendedora se dio a la   búsqueda  de ingresos para  apoyar la gestión de su esposo   de actividad taxista  y sacar adelante a sus dos niños en las edades de 12 y 14 años; así fue como nació su tienda, apoyada por sus vecinas, donde vende ranchos, víveres, licores, pollos, carnes y en general productos de la canasta familiar; su sistema de ventas es de contado y posee una infraestructura ideal para este tipo de negocio, pues  cuenta con estantería, enfriadores  y un surtido muy bien organizado, que genera un impacto de preferencia  entre sus clientes. Su sueño es continuar trabajando fuertemente y simultáneamente atender sus responsabilidades familiares y laborales. El Credikiva es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el  comprará víveres, ranchos, enlatados, refrescos en mayor cuantía, para ganar descuentos por compras en volumen y tener mucha más disponibilidad de un surtido diversificado, con el cual seguir conquistando el corazón de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luz Mary S. is originally from Tolima.  She moved to Barranquilla 32 years ago after leaving Armero, a city that was wiped out by a mudslide, a type of natural distaster that occurs in Colombia.  Once she got set up in Barranquilla, she formed a family and now has two children, ages 12 and 14.  She dreams about them being successful professionals in whatever career they choose for themselves.

Luz Mary, being the enterprising woman that she it, looked for ways to earn money to help her husband, who is a taxi driver, cover the household expenses.  With the support of her neighbors, she established a grocery store where she sells canned goods, groceries, liqueurs, chicken, meat and general daily use products.  She sells on a cash basis and has the ideal infrastructure for this type of business: shelves, refrigeration and a well-organized array of products that keep her customers loyal.

Her goal is to continue working harder and also attend to her family and work responsibilities.  The CrediKiva loan is her first one through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy groceries, canned goods, softdrinks, etc. in larger quantities so she can obtain good volume discounts.  She also wants to keep her range of products varied to appeal to her customers.

loans.use: To buy groceries, canned goods, softdrinks, etc. in large volumes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of second-hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé des femmes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident à Massablacoura l’un des quartier dans la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
A travers les relations de mariage et de commerce, ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce de pagnes, de fruits et de céréales à l’image de Kadiatou D.. 
Avec l’idée d’améliorer son pouvoir d’achat et de faire assez de stock, elle a décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son cinquième  prêt de groupe et tous les précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Madame Kadiatou D. fait le commerce des céréales dans le grand marché de BOUGOUNI. Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 1tonne de petit mil, 600kg de maïs et 700kg haricot. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants de BOUGOUNI pour ensuite les revendre en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans le marché de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt le elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé dans l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is made up of married women. They have an average age of 38, and 5 children. They live in nuclear families with their children and husbands. They live in Masablacoura, one of the districts in the city of Bougouni, in the 3rd administrative region in the Republic of Mali. Linked by married and business ties, these women sell pagnes, fruit, and grains just as Kadiatou D. does. 
In order to increase her purchasing power and obtain more stock, she decided to turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She is on her fifth group loan and all of the previous loans were repaid in full. 
Mrs. Kadiatou D. sells grains in the Bougouni Grand Market. With this loan, she plans on buying 1 ton of millet, 600 kg of corn, and 700 kg of beans. She buys her stock from suppliers in the surrounding villages and then sells them retail, for cash and credit in the Bougouni market to a client base made up of both men and women. 
With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 15,000 FCFA which will be used to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco Marcelo P. Cadena, tiene 45 años de edad, es oriundo de la ciudad de Ibarra, vive en unión libre, no tiene hijos, su nivel de educación es primario. Francisco empezó a trabajar desde que tenía 11 años como ayudante de albañil, con el tiempo ha adquirido experiencia y ahora él mismo hace sus propios diseños de casas y se especializa en la construcción mixta en ladrillo visto y madera, actualmente trabaja con 4 ayudantes. Actualmente vive en un departamento arrendado, pero al momento está construyendo su propia casa en el terreno que le corresponde como herencia, por lo que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material necesario, terminar su casa y en el futuro poder tener hijos y darles las comodidades que él nunca tuvo.
texts.en:
Francisco Marcelo P. Cadena, age 45, is from the city of Ibarra.  He is in a common-law marriage, and he does not have children.  He has an elementary school education.

Francisco started working as a bricklayer’s helper when he was 11 years old.  In time he acquired experience, and now he makes his own designs for houses.  He specializes in building a mix of brick facade and wood.  He currently works with four helpers.

He now lives in a rented apartment.  However, he is currently building his own house on land that he inherited.

He is requesting to loan to be able to buy the needed material to finish his house.  In the future he will be able to give his children the amenities that he never had.

loans.use: to buy construction material to finish his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes and pay for transport.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es:
Sandra se dedica al comercio, con más de cinco años vendiendo cosa de horno, y venta de frutas, para lograr cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ya que su esposo trabaja como jardinero y ambos se apoyan. 
Atreves de los préstamo en Afodenic ha logrado aumentar las ventas, y procesar diario el producto, al trabajar con mas capital. 
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento comprara: maíz, queso. Dulce, así como una paca de ropa usada para trabajar más su capital, y lograr vender más, al ofrecer productos nuevos. Siendo el objetivo de ganar un poco mas para lograr cumplir con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a merchant with more than five years experience selling baked goods and fruit to cover her household expenses. Her husband is a gardener and they both support each other. 

With the loan from Afodenic, she has been able to increase her sales and process her product daily by working with more capital. Today with this new loan, she will buy: cheese, as well as a pack of used clothing to work her capital more and have more sales by offereing new products. Her goal is to earn a little more to be able to meet her commitments.

loans.use: to buy a pack of clothing to diversify her products as well as raw materials for her baked goods.

loans.name: Nomthandazo Group

texts.en:
Nomthandazo (pictured with her hand raised) is a 45-year-old married woman. She and her husband have six children who are between the ages of 8 and 28 years old. Four of their children currently attend school. 

Her husband is unemployed, while she runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. She explains that she has been in this business for two years, and that her main business challenge is dealing with customers who do not want to pay on time if they had purchased on credit. She also receives income from the government's child-support grant.

She requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses (WDB) and Kiva to buy frozen chickens. She says that the extra income she expects the loan will help her generate will be uses to help her take care of her family. In the future, she sees her business growing, and having a proper house for her family. With the help of this loan through WDB and Kiva, she can see a promising future for her business and she is able to take care of her family better than before.

loans.use: To buy frozen chicken

loans.name: Sodwana Group

texts.en:
Nomusa (pictured with her hand raised) is a 45-year-old married woman. She and her husband have 3 children, who are between the ages of 8 and 25. Two of their children currently attend school. 

Her husband is unemployed, and she runs a clothing business in Kwa Z. Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. She explains that she has been in this business for three years. Her main business challenge is dealing with customers who do not want to pay on time after they purchase clothes on credit. She also receives income from the government's child support grant.

Nomusa requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses (WDB) and Kiva to buy clothes for resale. She says that the loan will help her generate profit and earn extra income. She will use the extra income to help take care of her family. In the future, she sees her business growing and becoming a boutique shop. She thanks WDB and Kiva for providing the loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es:
Liliana está satisfecha con su trabajo en el negocio y desde el barrio la Magdalena, envia un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: "Gracias a ustedes por prestarme el dinero ya que he logrado fortalecer mi negocio, espero sigan confiando y me financien el nuevo proyecto." Ella está aplicando a su segundo credikiva y con el comprará materias primas e insumos para la preparación de fritos, pescado para aprovechar la subienda, cajas de tomates y aji para distribuír en las tiendas y obtener nuevos ingresos porque ese capital adicional es bien cierto que le sirve de mucho.

Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Liliana Patricia C. puede ingresar al siguiente enlace:
http://www.kiva.org/lend/184495
texts.en:
Liliana is satisfied with the work she does, and from the neighborhood of Magdalena, she sends out a message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for the loan that will strengthen my business.  I hope you have confidence in me and will finance my new project."  

She is applying for her second CrediKiva and plans to use it to buy raw materials and ingredients to make fried foods, fish, cases of tomatoes and peppers to be distributed to stores.  This will provide her with further income which will be of much help to her.

If you would like to learn more about Lilliana Patricia C., please follow this link:
http://www.kiva.org/lend/184495

loans.use: To buy raw materials and ingredients to make fried foods, fish, cases of tomatoes and peppers for store distribution

loans.name: Maranda West Business Membership Group

texts.en:
Isheunesu M. is the leader of the Maranda West Group. He is 31 years old and married with four children: a five-year-old, four-year-old twins, and a one-year-old. None of the children is attending school. He has a grocery shop and bicycle spare parts shop in Masvingo, Zimbabwe. He has been running these businesses for nine years. He has no other sources of income; his wife specializes in taking care of the family. 

Isheunesu requested this loan through MicroKing for the purpose of increasing his grocery stock.  The extra income will improve the family’s welfare.  He envisions himself running a wholesale business in the near future.

loans.use: to increase his grocery store stock.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; es casada; la socia tiene 32 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos, menores de edad, la socia administra su botica ella tiene una botica desde hace 3 años atrás, ella se dedica de integro a atender y cuidar de que siempre este abastecida de los medicamentos básicos y otros para poder satisfacer al pueblo, la socia desea crecer cada año y que los ingresos generados de la botica le puedan ayudar a dar una mejor calidad e vida a sus menores hijos y de este modo poder cubrir las necesidades de los mismos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de medicamentos para abastecer su botica.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Luz Marina, age 32, is married and has two minor children. She is a member of the communal bank “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; the bank is located in the Urubamba province which is part of the department of Cusco.

For three years, Luz has been running a pharmacy. She is always making sure that the pharmacy is well stocked and has all the basic medicines and other necessities that people might need. Luz would like to grow the business each year so that the income it provides would allow her to give a better quality of life to her children and to ensure that they have everything they need.

Luz seeking a loan to purchase supplies for her pharmacy. She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase pharmacy supplies

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel es hombre muy esforzado, que ha logrado el objetivo en la construcción de su casa, y que junto  a su esposa trabajan para seguir con las mejora.
Su oficio desde hace más de cinco años, es como guarda de seguridad, los día que gana mas es cuando cubre los días feriado, oh releva a otro compañero, el cual se lo pagan doble. 
Su casa ya la lleva casi terminada, gracias a los trece ciclos de préstamos que Afodenic ha dado, en donde todos han sido para la compra de materiales de construcción, mejorando en gran manera su casa.
Hoy con este préstamo comprara: bloques, hierro, cemento, estribo, arena, piedrín para seguir cerrando una pared de alado que esta forrada con zinc, y que desea terminarla de concreto, para un bienestar común de la familia.
texts.en:
Joel is a very hardworking man who has been able to achieve his goal of building his house. With his wife, he works to continue making improvements. His trade for the last five years has been that of a security officer. The days he makes the most are the holidays, or when he substitutes for a co-worker, which is double pay. 

His house is almost finished, thanks to thirteen loan cycles with Afodenic. All of them have been to buy construction materials to really improve his house. Today with the loan, he will buy: blocks, iron, cement, rods, sand, and gravel to finish an adjacent wall that is lined with zinc. He wants to finish it with concrete, for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy constructin materials to finish a concrete wall which is lined in zinc and he wants to make this improvement.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION-ANTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Anta, perteneciente a la provincia D. Anta y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 57 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 8 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. agricultura y crianza D. animales como vacas y ella tiene unas tierras D. cultivo donD. siembra habas,trigo,papa y maíz y luego los venD. en las distintas ferias que se realiza en el distrito D. Anta y los días domingos se dedica a la venta D. comida, la socia por medio D. estos negocios saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere seguir apoyando a su hijos que está estudiando para operar maquina. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar la mensualidad del estudio D. su hijo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción-Anta" community bank which is located in Anta district, in Anta province and department.

Alejandrina is 57 years old, married, and has eight children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business farming and raising animals such as cows.  She has some farmland where she grows beans, wheat, potatoes and corn which she then sells in the different street markets which are held in Anta district.  On Sundays, she sells food.  Through her businesses, she gets her children ahead in life.  Alejandrina would like to continue supporting her children.  One of her sons is studying to operate machinery.  She is requesting this loan to pay his monthly tuition payment.

Alejandrina is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to pay her son's monthly tuition fee

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge S.  de 29 años de edad tiene una tienda en la sala de su casa desde hace dos años; allí vende como productos principales  jugos elaborados con frutas  tropicales, dulces y víveres en general; él trabajó en una tienda durante 10 años y a ese ejercicio le debe la experiencia  que adquirió, con la que ha logrado desarrollar su independencia y con ello su autonomía; así fue que  haciendo su propio emprendimiento  ha logrado el sostenimiento de su familia,  conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijos menores de dos años. Su meta más adelante es independizar su negocio adecuando su primera habitación como el espacio comercial, por eso se esmera por aumentar su capital de trabajo para generar esta posibilidad. Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará dulcería y especialmente abarrotes que son los artículos de mayor rotación y  que en la actualidad le ofrecen precios competitivos por compras en mayores volúmenes y esto es lo que augura el éxito de la inversión, porque trasladará los descuentos obtenidos a sus clientes, especialmente las amas de casa,  quienes  estarán felices de poder ahorrar con los gastos de la canasta familiar cuando le compran a Jorge Luis.
texts.en:
Jorge S. is 29 years old and has a grocery store in his living room, that he has been running for two years.  His main products are tropical fruit juices, sweets and groceries.  He worked in a store for 10 years and gained the experience he needed to become independent and earn a living to take care of his family, comprised of his wife and two small children.  

His goal for the future is to dedicate a specific room to the business co it can be independent, so he works hard to increase his working capital toward that end.  This is his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He plans to use it to buy sweets and especially groceries which have a higher turnover and allow him to buy at more competitive prices due to the higher volumes.  He transfers the discounts to his customers, especially homemakers, who are happy to save money on groceries when they buy at his store.

loans.use: To buy sweets and groceries

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 35 años, es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Julio de 35 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Joselin de 15 y Nicol de 17 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El salón de belleza de Diana es uno de los visitados en su barrio Villa Estela, ella tiene un talento natural para cortarle el cabello a sus clientes, pero su fama principal y el motivo por el cual las buscan sus clientes, es por los novedosos cambios de peinados que realiza y es que tiene un muy buen ojo para sacar la belleza de la gente a relucir. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre cuales son los estilos que están de moda, lleva 5 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el fuerte olor que despiden  los químicos con los que trabaja, aun así espera sacar adelante su salón de belleza y convertirla en la mejor de su barrio. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que siente que tiene una responsabilidad con las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada por el orden que le pone a las reuniones. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos de belleza para realizar un mejor trabajo en sus clientes.
texts.en:
Diana, age 35, is a very humble and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house together with husband Julio, age 35, and her two beloved children -- 15-year-old Joselin and 17-year-old Nicol, to whom Diana would like to bring a better quality of life. 

Diana's beauty salon is one of the most visited in her neighborhood of Villa Estela. She has a natural talent for haircuts, but the main reason that the customers seek out her services is because of her ability to make fresh changes to a client's hairstyle and because she has a good eye that allows her to bring forth a person's beauty and make it shine. 

What Diana likes best about her job is to advise her clients on what hairstyles are currently in fashion; she has been in this line of work for five years and finds that the most challenging aspect of her job is to be able to tolerate the smell that is given off by all the hairstyling products that she uses in her work. Diana would like to keep moving her business forward and to develop it into the best beauty salon in the neighborhood.

This is Diana's third loan with MFP, and she is committed to repaying it in a timely manner because she feels a sense of responsibility before her fellow members of the communal bank, where Diana is respected for the discipline she brings to the meetings. She plans to use the loan of 1500 soles to purchase beauty care products that will allow her to bring a better service to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase beauty care products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more disposable products

loans.name: Loretta

texts.en:
Loretta is 28 years old and lives in Logan Town. She is married and her husband is a businessman. They have three children between the ages of two and seven, two of whom attend school.
Loretta has been operating a general store for the past five years; she sells soap, toothpaste, rice, oil and other products. She says sometimes she experiences losses, but not always.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, and soap for her business. She hopes to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and soap for her business.

loans.name: Sunrise Business Membership Group

texts.en:
Shadreck N. is the leader of Sunrise Business Membership Group. He is 43 years old and married with a three-year-old child. He also takes care of four other dependants. He is an agro-dealer who sells agricultural products; he also operates a grocery store in Masvingo. He has been running this business for five years with two employees. Transport challenges and unstable prices are the major difficulties in his business. 

Shadreck intends to increase his grocery store stock with the loan requested through MicroKing. He believes that the loan will be a major working capital injection in the business that should lead to increased profitability and ultimately help improve the family’s welfare. He has been borrowing from MicroKing for some time and believes that the conditions to access a loan are not tight as compared to other banks.

Note: In the picture, the gentleman in the front row is Shadreck N..

loans.use: to increase his grocery store stock levels.

loans.name: Frecia Raquel

texts.es: Frecia Raquel tiene 29 años,  a su cargo esta su único hijo de nueve años. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, tiene más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella dio inicio por cuenta propia los productos que inicio a vender fueron arroz, azúcar, frijoles y golosinas en general. Con el paso del tiempo fue aumentando su inventario y también la gran variedad de clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra pan, refrescos naturales, jugos, gaseosas y golosinas.  El sueño de Frecia es obtener otra fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Frecia Raquel is 29 years old and has a son who is nine. For over three years, Frecia has been running a convenience store -- she started this business on her own, at first selling rice, sugar, beans, and sweets. With time, she has expanded her range of products and attracted a variety of clients. She is seeking a loan to increase her working capital which she will use to purchase bread, juices, soft drinks, natural refreshments, and sweets. Frecia's dream is to develop an additional source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bread, juices, soft drinks, and sweets

loans.name: Mirna Patricia

texts.es: Mirna Patricia A.. ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera nececidad, ella nos cuenta que lleva ya barios años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y que gracias a Dios le a ido bien porque a lobrado aumentar su ganacia ella nos cuenta que nececita mas capital para trabajar ya que tiene mucha demanda de sus clientes y quiere surtir mas su negocio para satisfacer la nececidad de sus clientes ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera nececidad,como, jabon,azucar,arroz,frijol,aceite,etc. su sueño es agrandar mas su negocio y estar bien economicamente.
texts.en:
Mirna Patricia A. makes her living selling basic necessity products. She has been in this business for several years, and thanks to God the business has been going well, and she was able to increase her earnings. 

Mirna needs additional working capital because she has a lot of demand from her clients and would like to better supply her business to ensure she can satisfy their needs. Mirna is seeking a loan to purchase inventory items such as rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, soap and so on. Her dream is to grow her business and to do well economically.

loans.use: to purchase grocery store supplies

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
FLORENTINA J. Y.
Doña Florentina J. Y., ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos, regalos etc. Es su segundo crédito kiva en fape y nos comenta que gracias a dios su negocio a marchado porque se encuentra en un lugar céntrico y que atraves de sus amistades sus clientes la buscan, ella nos comenta que también da crédito a sus clientes seleccionado hoy es segunda vez que trabaja con crédito, anteriormente no lo había hecho pero ase el comentario que esta oportunidad que se le dio, le sirvió para poder invertir mas su negocio y el deseo que tiene es seguir creciendo en el negocio y surtir mas de lo que tiene la clave de su éxito ha sido la amabilidad que tiene para atender a sus clientes y la buena administración que ella tiene con el dinero del negociO.
Solicita el credito para la compra de cosmeticos en bariedad.
texts.en:
Florentina J. Y. sells clothes, cosmetics, gifts, etc.  This is her second Kiva loan through Fape and she tells us that, thanks to God, her business has done well because it is in a central location.  Her customers seek her out after learning about her through their friends.  She tells us that she provides products to selected customers on credit.  This is the second time that she has had a loan.  She hadn't taken out loans before but she tells us that the opportunity that she was given helped her to invest more in her business.  She would like to continue growing in her business and stock it some more.
