She sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, and detergents, etc.  She also has a computer with Internet in order to provide service to the people who need it.  In addition to this, she sells Yanbal and Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories) and phone cards.

She tells us that she sells everything, and that she is always innovative and up to date on what her customers need.  This way she provides them with better service, and she keeps her customers.

She has had her store for three years, and little by little she has been adapting it.  She does this for her own good and for the community where she lives.

She will use this loan to stock her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, Avon and Yanbal products, and telephone cards.

She has been in her communal bank for two cycles.  She likes the help she receives from the bank.

Her goals are to finish her studies for her professional career as a public accountant and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, sausages, Avon and Yanbal products, and telephone cards.

loans.name: Madres Ladereñas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “MADRES LADEREÑAS”  lo conforman  08  socias, una D. ellas es Bella María D. 44 años  el negocio que ella tiene es una bodega Bazar donD. ofrece toda clase D. productos a su clientela, ya tiene con su negocio 20 años y es una D. las bodegas mas frecuentadas del barrio donD. vive, ella recuerda sus inicios cuando en un lugar reducido y con muy pocas cosas por ofrecer  empezó  con su  pequeña bodega a pesar D. la competencia y  algunos desafíos logro seguir adelante hasta convertirse en una bodega granD. y surtida, esto le permitió  ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y apoyar a su esposo en la construcción D. su casa, su préstamo le servirá para  comprar productos D. belleza como perfumería y cosméticos acaba D. comprar una vitrina y quiere llenarla D. estos productos, esto le permite tener variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes, a la vez que le genera mas ganancias, Bella María  es la secretaria del grupo “MADRES LADEREÑAS” 

   * La Sra Bella Maria eta sentada en la mesa con blusa verD..
texts.en:
The group called “MADRES LADEREÑAS is maD. up of eight members.  One of them is 44 year old Bella María who has a store where she offers all types of products to her customers.  She’s had this business for 20 years and it’s one of the most frequented stores in her neighborhood.  She remembers when she started with just a few items and began despite the competition and challenges, but continued to move ahead until she was able to build a large and well stocked and assorted store.  This allowed her to help her children with their studies and help her husband build their house.  She will use the money from this loan to buy beauty products and cosmetics.  She recently bought a display case and wants to fill it with these items.  This will allow her to have a variety of items to offer her customers, and increase her income.  Bella María serves as the “MADRES LADEREÑAS” group secretary.

*  Bella María is seated at the table and is wearing a green blouse.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her store

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, natural de la ciudad de Palmapampa de 38 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Darío de 36 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Marcelina junto a su esposo Darío en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingresos, es la venta de cacao, café y barbasco, las cuales vende en la ciudad de San Francisco. Marcelina en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros y de esa manera avanza con mayor celeridad en las extracciones de sus frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo está dando sus frutos,  lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga de insectos que atacan sus frutos. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y sin causar problemas a su banco comunal. Es por ello que con el crédito solicitado comprará insecticidas para combatir la plaga de insectos.
texts.en:
Marcelina, age 38, is from the city of Palmapampa.  She is a very happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 36 year old husband, Darío, and their four beloved children.  She wishes to give them a better quality of life.

The arduous work on her farm that Marcelina does together with her husband, Dario, has made their crops very well cared for.  On sale days their crops are rapidly purchased.  Her main source of income is the sale of cacao, coffee, and mullein.  She sells these crops in the city of San Francisco.  

At harvest time Marcelina hires field workers to speed up the gathering of her crops.  She has been engaged in this business activity for 17 years.  She feels that the most difficult part is taking care of the crops so that they are not subject to insect infestations.

In time, she wants to get new land to expand her crops.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She has always been very punctual with her payments, and she has not caused problems in her communal bank.  

She will use the requested loan to buy insecticide to combat insect infestation.

loans.use: to buy insecticides.

loans.name: Eddy Enrique

texts.es: Eddy Enrique se dedica se dedica a venta y elaboración de materiales de construcción.  Inicio con fondos propios, pues siempre se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre muy servicial y que se siente muy contento al obtener este medio de vida. Esta no es la primera vez que ha solicitado créditos pues han sido de gran provecho para su negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de arena, piedrín, bloques, ladrillos, cerámica, cemento, hierro entre otros productos.
texts.en: Eddy Enrique makes his living by selling and manufacturing construction materials. He started this business with his own funds and is very happy to earn his income this way given that he has always been an attentive and helpful individual. This is not the first time that he has requested a loan -- they have been of great help to his business. He plans to use the current loan to purchase sand, bricks, cement, gravel, and other construction materials.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Gladys Esther

texts.es:
Gladis  S. se dedica a la venta de refrescos y bebidas y también ofrece servicios de telefonía en su casa del barrio el Bosque de la ciudad de Barranquilla, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 27 a 33 años de edad con los que sueña con verlos prósperos y exitosos. 
El negocio de Gladys se inició hace 4 años, como una alternativa para generar nuevos ingresos al hogar que hasta ese momento estaban solamente a cargo de su esposo, e inició con poco capital y ha logrado aumentarlo ligeramente.
En la actualidad Gladys  vende bebidas frías, hielo y ofrece servicios de recargas a celulares, porque en su sector tiene mucha demanda, pero ella  con sus esfuerzos y disciplina,  lo ha hecho sostenible y planea hacerlo crecer y diversificarlo  cada día más,  para ello está construyendo un futuro capital adicional con el cual financiar la demanda que esta decisión traería.  Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual iniciará la ´puesta en marcha de su sueño, pues con  el  fortalecerá su servicio de telecomunicaciones comprando recargas a celulares, las cuales le suministran muy buena utilidad al venderlas, e incrementará sus ingresos.  Su plan más adelante  consiste en construir un local en una de las habitaciones de su residencia, para adecuarlo con un negocio de café internet, fortaleciendo sus actuales actividades. Gladys es un buen miembro de familia que sueña que sus nietos logren una educación de calidad tanto a nivel de valores,  como académicamente para continuar sintiéndose muy feliz de tener esta gran familia 
 .
texts.en:
Gladys S. dedicates herself to selling refreshments and beverages, and also offers cellphone services in her house located in the El Bosque neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla.  She is married and has 3 children ages 27 to 33, who she dreams of seeing prosperous and successful.

Gladys started her business 4 years ago as an alternative means of earning new income for the home, which up until that time had been the sole responsibility of her husband.  She started with a small amount of capital, and has managed to grow little by little.

Currently, Gladys sells cold beverages, ice, and offers cell phone-charging services because they are in great demand in her area.  Through her efforts and discipline, she has made it sustainable, and plans to grow and diversify more every day.  For this, she is building future additional capital with which to finance the demands that this decision may bring.  

This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will continue the journey towards her dream.  With it, she will strengthen her telecommunications enterprise, buying cell phone chargers that bring a good profit when she sells them, thereby increasing her income.  Her future plan is to build a locale in her home to install an Internet café, enhancing her current activities.  

Gladys dreams of her grandchildren getting quality educations so they feel good about being part of such a great family.

loans.use: buy cellphone chargers which, when sold, bring her good income.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es: Maura, de 55 años, es una mujer sincera y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Teodosio de 61 años y sus 09 queridos hijos, a quienes desea heredar sus tierras posteriormente. Trabajando arduamente Maura ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para dirigirse a su chacra y brindar el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos de cacao, café y hojas coca, los cuales posteriormente lleva a vender a los centros de acopio situados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y jornaleros para así extraer con mayor rapidez los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 22 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que laborar en épocas de lluvia. Los planes que tiene en mente es trabajar con los ingenieros Agrónomos para así manejar sus cultivos de manera tecnificada. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará en el progreso de su trabajo, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con el crédito solicitado comprará semillas de café y cacao para aumentar sus sembrios y así obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maura, 55 years of age, is a sincere and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home along with her husband, Teodosio, 61, and her 9 dear children who she wants eventually to inherit her lands.

Working hard, Maura has managed to grow her crops.  She gets up very early every morning to go to her farm and take care of her plants, such as cacao and coffee.  She later sells her products in the markets of the city of San Francisco, as it is here she obtains the best prices for her goods.

During harvest time, she has the help of her children and migrant workers so she can collect the fruit faster.  What she enjoys most about her work is the freedom of working her land.  She has been farming for 22 years, and considers the most difficult aspect of her work to be the rainy season.  The plans she has include working with agricultural engineers to manage her crops more scientifically.  

This is her eighth credit with MFP, and she knows that this loan will help her to continue her work.  This is why she is committed to making all her payments on time.  She is known as a very responsible member within her cooperative bank, a reason why she is well liked.  She will use the loan she is requesting to buy coffee and cacao seeds to expand her plantings and generate more income.

loans.use: buy coffee and cacao seeds.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es socia del Banco Comunal Yana Ñahui, es viuda, tiene 56 años y 11 hijos.
El crédito que solicita lo destinara a la compra de abarrotes en general, verduras y tipos de carnes para la preparación de alimentos, debido a que Cristina tiene un restaurante en San Juan Bautista. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de quesos y decidió abrir un restaurante, trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos en sus tiempos libres prepara desayuno y almuerzo. 
Le gusta FINCA Perú por la facilidad de los créditos y puede ahorrar. Con sus ahorros pudo construir su casa y educar a sus hijos.
Abrirá un restaurante en distrito de Carmen Alto, donde atenderá sólo en la noches preparará caldos y comida china. Su sueño es seguir creciendo y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Cristina is a member of Ñahui Yana Community Bank.  She is a 56 year old widow with 11 children.  

The requested loan would be used to buy groceries, vegetables and meats for food preparation, as Cristina has a restaurant in San Juan Bautista. Previously, she worked selling cheese and decided to open a restaurant, working with the help of her children, in her spare time, she began serving breakfast and lunch.

She likes the loan services of FINCA Peru for the easy loan process and that it provides her with the ability to save.
With her savings she could build a house and educate her children.

She would also open a restaurant in Carmen Alto district and only serve soups and chinese food in the evenings.  
Her dream is to continue growing and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy various meats and vegetables

loans.name: Flor Maria

texts.es: Flor tiene 44  años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa familiar en la ciudad de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Gana la vida vendiendo dulces y chifles, un tentempié popular de América del Sur hecho de plátanos fritos. Cuenta con un puesto ambulante en el centro de Lambayeque desde hace 10 años. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de dulces y chifles para vender. Por ello, ha acudido a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) para solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Con los ingresos de su negocio, Flor puede ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia. Su mayor anhelo para su negocio es algún día tener una tienda para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Flor, 44, is married and has two children.  She lives in the family home in the city of Lambayeque in the north of Perú.  She earns her living selling candy and “chifles” a popular South American snack made from fried bananas.  She has had a sales cart in downtown Lambayeque for 10 years.

She wants to expand the business buying more candy and chifles to sell.  To do so, she’s called upon Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to request a 1000 new sol loan.

Flor can use income from her business to help her husband with the economic support of the family.  Her greatest wish for her business is to have a store some day in which to sell her products.

loans.use: to buy more candy and fried banana chips to sell.

loans.name: Lilliam Esmeralda

texts.es: Lilliam Esmeralda se dedica a una pulpería, tiene 3 años en este negocio pues con mucho empeño y dedicación ha logrado obtener este medio de vida. Inicio con pocos productos ya que ciertos clientes le realizan diferentes pedidos, pero con el paso del tiempo obtuvo la experiencia necesaria para seguir creciendo con su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, pan, refrescos entre otros.  Ella sueña con mantener su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en: Lilliam Esmeralda has a convenience store; she has been running this business for three years and with a lot of effort was able to make it into an activity that allows her to earn a living. She started off with just a few products based on the orders from the initial clients, but, as time went by, she was able to gain the necessary experience that allowed her to grow her business. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase staple grains, sweets, bread, detergent, and soft drinks among other items. Her dream is to have a store with a good selection of products.

loans.use: to purchase convenience store inventory

loans.name: Tatiana Maricela

texts.es:
La Señora. Tatiana L. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, cuanta con grandes iglesias que resaltan la belleza de esta ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio de todo tipo, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.

La Señora. Tatiana tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijas de 6 y 1 año de edad, su primera hija se encuentra en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un negocio propio, el se dedica a al venta de lubricantes para vehículos. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Tatiana se dedica a la venta de ropa, trabaja ambulantemente ya que no cuenta con un local propio, este trabajo lo realiza hace 9 años, labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo ya que también cuida de su familia.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  blusas, camisetas, pantalones, ropa de niños, etc. para surtir su mercadería.

Su meta es crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Tatiana L., age 24, is a member of the communal bank Mujeres de Trabajo (Working Women); she lives in the city of Azogues -- a city known for its architectural beauty, its great churches, and its people who are very kind and charismatic.

Tatiana is married and has two daughters, aged six and one years old. Her elder daughter is studying at a city school. Tatiana's husband has his own business -- he sells motor oil and other lubricants for vehicles. They rent a house as they do not yet have one of their own.

Tatiana makes her living by selling clothing; she sells door-to-door since she does not have her own location. She has been in this business for nine years, working from Monday to Friday. She does not have a fixed schedule and spends part of the time taking care of her family. This is Tatiana's first loan from the communal bank which she was invited to join by a friend. She will use the funds to purchase an inventory of clothing for resale. Tatiana's goal is to grow and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of clothing for sale

loans.name: Xochil Mabel

texts.es:
Xochil, es una joven de 27 años de edad, originaria del departamento de Estelí, ella es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, ella estudia segundo año de la carrera de Psicología y se dedica a vender nacatamales a los trabajadores de la empresas tabacaleras, a comedores en la terminal de buses y todas aquellas personas que le encarguen su producto. Ella comenzó este negocio a los 23 años de edad, su hermana la ha estado apoyando desde el principio, antes de dedicarse a la venta de nacatamales ella vendía cosméticos en la calle, también trabajo como vendedora en una tienda, también alquila cuartos  y de esta manera ha mantenido a su familia siendo ella madre y padre para su hijo.   
Solicita el préstamo para comprar leña y maíz. Con esta inversión piensa incrementar sus ventas, tener mas materia prima para producir más y mejorar sus ganancias. 
Dentro de sus planes futuros esta expandir su negocio y vender zapatos usados. Su meta próxima es reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Xochil is a 27 year old young woman, originally from the Estelí department.  She is the single mother of four children and is in her second year of studying psychology.  [Xochil] sells nacatamales to the tobacco company workers, people at the bus stations, and anyone who places orders with her.

She began this business at age 23 and her sister has been helping her since the beginning.  Before selling nacatamales, she used to sell cosmetics in the street and in a store.  She also earns money by renting out rooms and in these ways supports her family, being both mother and father to her children.

She is asking for this loan to buy firewood and dried corn.  This investment will allow her to have more supplies so she can produce more and better earnings.

Her future plans include expanding her business and selling second hand shoes.  Her next goal is to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Jose Eradio

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 65 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y dos hijos en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

José se dedica  a la crianza de animales menores, específicamente ganado ovino y caprino, en algunos corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. El los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

El desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona bastante empeñosa y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 65, is a father living with his wife and two children in Olmos District, a farming area with significant commercial activity located in Lambayeque Province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

José raises small farm animals, specifically sheep and goats, in some corrals located near his home.  He feeds them grains and natural grasses and when they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants that tend to visit the area where he lives.

He wants to acquire more animals and nutritionally balanced feed to expand his business and earn higher income.  Because of this he’s thought it convenient to request a 1200 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him reach this goal.

José is quite a dedicated, hard working person.  His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more animals to raise and to buy nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Maria Yelba

texts.es:
Doña María, es agricultora, tiene 58 años de edad, es originaria de la comunidad El Coyolito, localizado en La Concordia un pequeño pueblo del departamento Jinotega, es madre soltera, tiene solo un hijo de 23 años de edad , su hijo ha sido su mayor apoyo, ella no pudo estudiar debido a que sus padres no tenían las condiciones económicas para pagarles sus estudios solo llego a cursas hasta sexto grado de primaria, aprendió de muy joven a trabajar la tierra, sabe lo que es trabajar bajo un sol todo el dia, sin horario, pero con ganas de sacar adelante su cultivos. Su mama le dejo un pedazo de terreno, el cual trabajo ella misma sembrando maíz, frijoles, además con el tiempo fue adquiriendo conocimientos para trabajar en la ganadería, pues este es su otro medio de subsistencia.
Solicita el préstamo para fortalecer la siembra de granos básicos como frijoles y maíz, compra de insumos para cultivar la tierra y pago de mano de obra. Confiando en Dios espera obtener una buena cosecha y sacar una buena producción.   
 Tiene como planes futuros sembrar hortalizas y ayudar a su hija para que termine de estudiar la carrera de contabilidad pues esta cursando su último año. Tiene como meta próxima aumentar el área de siembra.
texts.en:
Maria, age 58, is a farmer; she comes from the community of El Coyolito, located in La Concordia -- a small town in the Jinotega department. Maria is a single mother; her son is 23 years old and has has been her greatest help. 

Maria was not able to complete her studies because her parents did not have the economic resources to pay for them. For that reason, she was only able to study until 6th grade and learned farming at a young age. Maria knows what it means to work all day under the sun, without a schedule but with a desire to see her crops grow strong. Her mother left her a small plot of land, and that is where Maria now grows corn and beans. As time passed, she also learned how to work with livestock, and this became another source of subsistence.

Maria is asking for a loan  to increase her sowing of staple grains such as corn and beans, to purchase supplies for crop cultivation, and to pay labor costs. Trusting in God, Maria hopes to have a good harvest and a strong production of grains. In terms of her future plans, Maria hopes to sow vegetables and to help her daughter finish her studies for a degree in accounting, where she is now in her last year. As her immediate goal, Maria would like to increase the size of her sown field.

loans.use: to sow staple grains such as corn and beans, to purchase supplies for crop cultivation, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: Máximo,  natural del distrito de Palmapampa de 28 años, es un hombre trabajador y se esmera por sobresalir adelante, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Giovanna de 23 años y su querida hija Jhony de 03 años, es el Principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que se dedica Máximo, es el cultivo de cacao, café y plantas de barbasco, poseyendo en total 04 hectáreas de propiedad, las extensas tierras que posee lo han convertido en uno de los principales productores de la zona. Sus productos una vez cosechados los almacena hasta tener una  buena cantidad para luego llevar a vender hasta los centros de acopio ubicado en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde ya tiene compradores fijos esperándolo sabiendo que sus productos son de primera calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar y lo hace con mucho empeño, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga de insectos que perjudican sus plantas. En el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre esta al tanto de  las reuniones entre socios. Con el crédito solicitado comprará trampas y abrazaderas para combatir la plaga de insectos.
texts.en:
Máximo is a native of the Palmapampa dstrict.  He is 28 years old and is a hardworking man who works to get ahead.  He lives in a home of his own along with his wife, 23 year old Giovanna, and his lovely 3 year old daughter Jhony, who is the main motivation for all of his efforts.

Máximo raises cacao, coffee, and wild yams on 4 hectares of land on his property.  Because of his land he has become one of the best producers in the zone.  His products are harvested and stored until he has a good quantity, then he takes them to sell in the distribution center in San Francisco, where he has steady buyers who know that his crops are of top quality.  What he enjoys most about his work is the harvest, and he does it with great commitment.  He has been doing this for ten years and what he considers to be the most difficult task is caring for the crops and protecting them from insects.  In the future he wants to buy new land in order to increase his production.

This will be his second loan through MFP and he is committed to repaying on time.  He is a very happy member of his communal bank who always attends the meetings.  He will use the money from this loan to buy insect traps and clamps.

loans.use: to buy insect traps

loans.name: Cecilia Verónica

texts.es:
La Señorita. Verónica C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, cuenta con grandes iglesias que resaltan la belleza de esta ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio de todo tipo, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.

La Señorita. Verónica tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres y ayuda en la economía de su hogar. La casa en la que habitan es propia.
 
Nuestra socia trabaja en la atención de una tienda de abarrotes, esta actividad la desempeña hace algún tiempo. También se dedica  a estudiar Ciencias Educativas en la universidad y está en primer año.

Es socia del banco comunal hace un año y medio y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en los gastos de sus estudios.
 
Su meta es llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Verónica C., age 21, is a member of the communal bank Mujeres de Trabajo (Working Women); she lives in the city of Azogues -- a city known for its architectural beauty, its great churches, and its people who are very kind and charismatic. Veronica is single; she lives with her parents and helps them with the household expenses. They live in their own house. 

Veronica works in a grocery store; she has been in this job for some time. She is also studying at the university in an Education Science program; she is currently in her first year.Veronica has been a member of the communal bank for a year and plans to use the new loan to pay for her studies. Her goal is to become an accomplished professional.

loans.use: to pay for education expenses

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
Durante mucho tiempo Sofía se dedico a la venta D. hamburguesas debido a su embarazo  debido al esfuerzo que requería su trabajo  dejo D. hacerlo,  por algún tiempo  no trabajo para dedicarse a su hijo  pero después D. un año busco la manera D. volver a empezar  y fue su nuera quien  la motivo a dedicarse a la venta D. ropa  un negocio muy rentable le enseño los lugares donD. comprar ropa a menor costo y D. buena calidad ,es así que poco a poco empezó ganando clientela primero entre sus amistades y conocidos , ahora le va muy bien  en su negocio  y esto  le permite tener solvencia económica para ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, el préstamo que le otorga EDAPROSPO le servirá para comprar ropa D. invierno como chompas, buzos y casacas.  Su meta mas próxima es tener su propia boutique D. ropa ya tiene el lugar adecuado en su misma casa  y una buena ubicación  por ser una avenida muy transitada, ella es miembro del grupo “ AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE”  todas son vecinas D. Ventanilla – Callao.

  * Sofia esta con polo amarillo.
texts.en:
For a long time Sofía sold hamburgers.  When she became pregnant she left this work because of the effort it required.  For a time she did not work in order to devote herself to her son but after a year she looked for a way to start again and her daughter-in-law encouraged her to go into clothing sales, a very profitable business.  She showed her the places to buy good quality clothes at lower prices.  Gradually she started to acquire clientele first among her friends and acquaintances.  Today she does quite well in the business and this allows her to have financial solvency to help her children with their education.

The loan EDAPROSPO is granting her will be used to buy winter clothes like sweaters, sweatshirts and jackets.  Her next goal is to have her own clothes boutique; she already has space set up for this in her home and it’s a good location because it’s located on a very busy avenue.  

She is a member of the AMIGAS POR SIEMPRE (Friends Forever) group and all of them are neighbors from Ventanilla, Callao.

*Sofía is wearing the yellow shirt.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
La señora Micaela tiene ya dos años con su negocio de venta de ropa y zapatos usados.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en mercancía como es juguetes, accesorios de belleza para dama, y ropa de temporada que le esta haciendo falta y sus clientes el están solicitando que tenga esta mercancía a la venta. 
Ella pagaría su crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que su esposo se encargara de los gastos familiares con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo. 
Desea tener más variedad y estilos de ropa para satisfacer a sus clientes y así aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Micaela has been in her business selling used clothing and shoes for two years.  She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in merchandise such as toys, ladies' beauty accessories and seasonal clothes which she needs.  Her customers are asking her to sell this merchandise.

Micaela will repay her loan with the profits that she makes from her business since her husband will take care of their family expenses with the salary that he earns from his job.  Micaela would like to have a greater variety and more styles of clothes available so that she can satisfy her customers and, thereby, increase her profits.

loans.use: to invest in her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Snith

texts.es:
Snith M. de 31 años es una joven muy alegre y cordial que tiene una droguería en la cual vende medicamentos y productos de tocador;  sus principales productos son los medicamentos genéricos con los que inició hace 8 años  cuando decidió comprárselo a un arrendatario del local de su madre cuando este no quiso continuar;  sus clientes son vecinos del sector y  transeúntes. Snith además de ser una mujer de negocios goza del reconocimiento de sus clientes, vecinos y amigos quienes suministran buenas referencias personales y familiares y este es el reconocimiento que ha ganado en virtud  de sus valores. El credikiva es su  es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo , con el cual comprará  productos de aseo personal y en general artículos que rotan muy fácilmente en la droguería.
Snith está muy contenta con su negocio, porque con él  genera los principales  ingresos familiares,  y es la  fuente de empleo con la que cuenta para alcanzar el sueño de  ver a sus  2 hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad, con mejores oportunidades educativas y laborales, pues son ellos quienes la motivan a salir adelante en la búsqueda de brindarles todas las oportunidades de las que ella sea capaz. Su mayor desafío en la actualidad es conseguir su casa propia y para ello está preparándose para acceder al programa Sueños y Oportunidades liderado por la Fundación Maro Santo Domingo  con el cual se postula para  lograr su propósito, pero mientras cultiva sus sueños  se esmera   en su negocio que hoy le genera una utilidad no menor de un 30% .
texts.en:
Snith M. is 31 years old.  She is a very cheerful and friendly young woman who owns a drugstore where she sells medicines and personal care products.  Her main products are generic medicines which are what she started out selling eight years ago when she decided to buy the business from the then tenant when he decided he didn't want to continue in it.  Her customers are neighbors and passersby.

In addition to being a businesswoman, Snith enjoys the recognition of her customers, neighbors and friends who provide good personal and family references.  This is recognition that she has earned.

This Kiva loan is Snith's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy personal care products and other products that she sells a lot of in her drugstore.  Snith is very happy with her business because it is her family's main source of income and it is the work through which she is reaching her dream of seeing her two children, aged 11 and 5, enjoy better educational and work opportunities since they are what motivate her to get ahead in her search to provide them with all the opportunities she can.

Snith's biggest challenge right now is obtaining her own home and, for this reason, she is preparing to access the 'Dreams and Opportunities' program led by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo through which she will apply to achieve her goal.  While she is developing her dreams, she takes care of her business which currently makes her profits of no less than 30%.

loans.use: to buy personal care products and other products that she sells a lot of in her drugstore

loans.name: Las Hormigas De Tolcayuca Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Hormigas de Tolcayuca" porque para las integrantes del grupo las “hormigas” simbolizan trabajo. Las integrantes se consideran ser muejeres emprendedoras, trabajadoras y responsables entre ellas y con sus familias. El grupo se encuentra en el Estado de Hidalgo, en México. Esta conformado por nueve integrantes cada una siendo mujeres emprendedoras con un negocio ya establecido. La señora Agustina Viviana R. es la tesorera del grupo. Ella tiene 27 años de edad, estudio hasta la primaria. La señora se dedica a la venta de ropa, especificamente de lencería por catalogo, de marcas reconocidas. Lleva aproximadamente dos años con dicha actividad y por tal razón es conocida por sus clientes como una persona responsable y atenta con los demás. Decidió elegir está actividad por la facilidad de ventas con sus clientes y porque le permite tener tiempo disponible para atender las actividades del hogar y además el obtener ingresos extras que le permitan apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y darles una mejor calidad de vida. La señora Agustina tiene tres hijos; uno de 9 años, otro de 8 años y otro tan solo 8 meses respectivamente quienes dos de ellos actualmente estudian. El crédito que solicito la señora Agustina lo utilizará para la compra de mercancía y catalogos de la temprada Primavera-Verano.
texts.en:
This group is called "Las Hormigas de Tolcayuca" (The Ants of Tolcayuca) because, for the members of this group, ants symbolize work.  The group's members consider themselves to be enterprising, hard-working and responsible women both amongst themselves and with their families.  The group is located in the State of Hidalgo, in Mexico.  It has nine members, each of whom is an enterprising woman with an already established business.

Agustina Viviana R. is the group's treasurer.  She is 27 years old and has an elementary school level of education.  She sells brand-name clothes, specifically lingerie, through a catalog.  She has been in this business for approximately two years and is therefore well known by her customers as a responsible person who is attentive to other people.  She decided to start this business as it is easy to sell to her customers and because it allows her to have time free to attend to her household duties and also make extra income which allows her to support her children in their studies and provide them with a better quality of life.  Agustina has three children aged 9, 8 and 8 months.  Two of her children are currently in school.

Agustina will use her loan to buy merchandise and catalogs for the Spring-Summer season.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, catalogs and clothes (lingerie)

loans.name: Mayra Lucia

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mayra C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Trabajo, vive en la ciudad de Azogues, ciudad que tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, cuanta con grandes iglesias que resaltan la belleza de esta ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio de todo tipo, son personas muy amables y carismáticas.

La Señorita. Mayra tiene 24 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y ayuda en la economía de la casa. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Nuestra socia es Ingeniera en Sistemas y trabaja controlando un Cyber Internet, labora de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.
 
Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en el pago de una parte de su maestría de Ingeniera en Sistemas.

Su meta es culminar con éxitos su maestría.
texts.en: Mayra C. is a member of the communal lender Mujeres de Trabajo, in the scenic city of Azogues, which has a beautiful architecture with several large churches.  Local entrepreneurs are very charismatic and do a brisk business.  Mayra is 24, single, lives with her parents in a rented house and contributes to household expenses.  Mayra is a systems engineer and works managing an internet cafe, from Monday to Saturday (8 a.m. to 5 p.m).  This is her second loan, and she seeks credit to offset expenses related to her Master's degree program in systems engineering.  Her goal is to finish her degree with success.

loans.use: to cover expenses for a Master's program

loans.name: Emma Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Emma Leonor Pérez P. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 56 años. Ella tiene ocho hijos los cuales saco adelante y gracias a Dios son hombre y mujeres de bien.
Pérez inicio vendiendo tortilla en su humilde hogar y con las ganancias decidió invertir en la venta de ropa, DVD, planchas…etc. de todo un poco lo cual distribuye en los departamentos. 
Actividad económica que realiza desde hace 4 años y en la que invertirá el crédito, ya que tiene muchos encargos para este mes de mayo.
texts.en: Señora Emma Leonor Pérez P. is 56 years old and a hard-working, courageous and enterprising woman.  She raised eight children and thanks to God they are good men and women.  She started selling tortillas in her modest home and with the earnings she decided to invest in the sale of clothing, DVDs, irons...etc., a little of everything that she distributes in the departments.  She has been doing this for 4 years and she will invest the loan in this business as she has many orders for the month of May.

loans.use: to purchase items like DVDs, radio-cassette recorders and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es:
Claudia Téllez R. es una joven emprendedora  de 21 años de edad, que tiene el negocio de vender gafas, relojes y accesorios, entre otras mercancías, desde hace 5 años;  su negocio nació de la necesidad de obtener ingresos para autosotenerse  y descargar  de los gastos personales  a su madre,  pues desde que su padre falleció   correa con todos los gastos de la familia.
 Claudia como  estudiante de diseño de modas sueña con tener una marca propia y bien posicionada y confía en que esta experiencia emprendedora de vender mercancías, la lleve a terminar sus estudios  para lanzarse al mercado con una gran empresa, por eso se prepara comercialmente y aplica  su vocación de servicio, con la cual  muy seguramente   lograra su gran desafío. Mientras esto ocurre ella quiere aumentar su capital de trabajo, para generar mayores ingresos y mayores oportunidades de negocio, por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para aplicar a su primer financiamiento, con el cual comprará  ropa accesorios, calzado pues se acerca el día de las madres y ella debe estar provisionada de toda esta mercancía para atraer a la clientela , muchas de las cuales ya han hecho sus pedidos y Claudia debe responder  para seguir fidelizándolas y despertando su atención interés y decisión de comprarle por mucho tiempo más.
texts.en:
Claudia Téllez R. is an enterprising young woman of 21.  She has owned a business selling sunglasses, watches, accessories and other merchandise for five years.  She started her business because she needed to make income to support herself and unburden her expenses from her mother.  Since her father died her mother had been covering all of their family expenses.

As a fashion design student, Claudia dreams of owning her own brand that is well positioned in the market and she is confident that this entrepreneurial experience selling merchandise will help her to finish her studies and launch herself on the market with a large company.  For this reason, she is preparing herself commercially and applying her dedication to service through which she will certainly meet her great challenge.  Meanwhile, she would like to increase her working capital so that she can make more income and create more business opportunities.  For this reason, she has approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for her first loan which she will use to buy clothes, accessories and footwear as Mother's Day is approaching and she would like her business to be well stocked with merchandise in order to attract customers, many of whom have already placed orders with her.  Claudia must fill these orders so that she can continue to gain customer loyalty and continue to awaken her customers' attention, interest and decision to buy from her for a long time to come.

loans.use: to buy clothes, accessories and footwear as Mother's Day is approaching

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Las Caminantes Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Caminantes está conformado por Nohemí Gutiérrez, Jenifer O.  y Jesica Martínez, tres féminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Gutiérrez de 50 años quien inicio vendiendo frescos, comida y gaseosas con las ganancias puso una pequeña venta.
Ella con el crédito comprara granos básicos, papelería, productos alimenticios…etc.
La señora O. de 39 años tiene una tortillería desde hace tres años y Yesica M. de 19 años desde hace 2 años realiza y vende bisutería (aretes, collares, pulseras…etc.)
texts.en:
The “Caminantes” [“Walkers”] group is comprised of Nohemi G., Jennifer O. and Jesica Martínez, three female workers and entrepreneurs. Mrs. G., 50, is the group coordinator who began selling fresh food and drinks and put together this small business.
With the loan she would buy staple food grains, food and paper products etcetera for resale.

Ms. O. is 39 years old has had a tortilla (flatbread) factory for the last 3 years.  Jesica M., 19 years old, has been making and selling costume jewelry (earrings, necklaces and bracelets...etc.) for the last 2 years.

loans.use: To buy staple food grains, food and paper products etcetera for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Nelida

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 4 hijos. Cuenta con casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Éten a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica a la confección de  gorros y venta de artículos varios, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años y por la antigüedad conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona que le ayuda y la respalda en las actividades que emprende. Con los ingresos que obtiene logra cubrir sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Rosa desea adquirir más mercadería para así aumentar su stock y poder venderlo, de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente adquirir un préstamo de 900 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona ya que el titular cuenta con clientela ya establecida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37, single, and has 4 children. She has her own home, located in the Eten district, half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She makes hats and sells various articles. She has been doing this for 15 years, and knows the job very well. She has an established customer base in the region, which supports her in her activities. With her income, she is able to cover her personal costs and those of her family.

Rosa wants to acquire more merchandise in order to increase her stock to sell. This way she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family. For this reason she has decided to take out a loan of 900 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. There is no one better than her in her line of work in the area, and she already has an established customer base.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Guillermina

texts.es:
María tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en casa propia. Vive en  el Caserío Fanupe Barrio Nuevo, el cual se ubica a 12 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope. Ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio. Clienta cría chanchos, pavos, cuyes, patos, etc, los cuales alimenta  con pastos naturales, polvillo, maíz, purina, etc. Quincenalmente los comercializa en el Mercado Moshoqueque o Mercado Modelo de Lambayeque.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para sus gastos personales y los de su familia

María actualmente desea adquirir más alimento balanceado para su ganado Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old, a single mother and lives in her own home. She lives in the village of Barrio Nuevo Fanupe, which is located 12 minutes from the city of Mórrope.  Mórrope is located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

María raises and sells animals, which she breeds in pens located outside of her home. She raises pigs, turkeys, guinea pigs, ducks, etc, which she feeds natural grains, feed, corn, purina, etc. Every two weeks she sells the animals at the Market Moshoqueque or Market Modelo de Lambayeque. The income that she earns from this activity is used for personal and family expenses.

María now wishes to buy more nutritious food for her livestock and is therefore requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 nuevos soles, which will allow her to achieve her goal.

loans.use: To buy nutritious feed.

loans.name: Leon De Judas Group

texts.es:
El grupo León de Judas lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son Cristhian María R., Mariana Poso y Rosa T.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora R. de 26 años quien desde hace más de un año vende ropa de paca. 
Ella tiene  dos hijos pequeños por los cuales trabaja arduamente con el propósito de salir adelante. El crédito lo ocupará para comprar pacas de ropa.
Las otras dos integrantes son la señora P. de 47 años comerciante de productos Avon, marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catalogo  y la señora Toruño de 28 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado y cosméticos.
texts.en:
The group "León de Judas" is made up of three hard working, toiling and enterprising women.  These women are Cristhian María R., Mariana P. and Rosa T..

The group's coordinator is R., 26, who has sold packaged clothing for more than one year.  She has two young children for which she works hard, with the goal of coming out ahead.  She will use the loan to buy packages of clothing.  

P., 47, sells Avon products, a brand that is well known through her catalog sales.

T., 28, sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.use: buy packages of clothing.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz es una madre D. familia D. 46 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su familia en la provincia D. Chepén, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque.

Luz cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por un familiar. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes D. la zona diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, adicionalmente tiene una mototaxi (unidad móvil con una cabina que sirve para transportar personas). 

La creciente demanda que la bodega D. Luz ha venido experimentando ha hecho que ella piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1700 nuevos soles.

Luz es una mujer bastante trabajadora y D. muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Luz is 46 years old and lives with his family in the Chepén province, a commercial zone located an hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayaque department.

Luz has a small store in her home, which is staffed by her family.  There they sell different consumable products and groceries to their neighbors and customers.  The business has been received well.  Additionally, she has a moto-taxi (a modified motorcycle with a passenger compartment added).

The growth that the store has experienced has maD. her think that she has to expand it by acquiring more products, so she has seen fit to request a loan of 1,700 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

Luz is a hardworking woman of good character.  The people who know her have great respect for her.

loans.use: to expand her store

loans.name: Norma Elina

texts.es:
Norma Bustillos  es una mujer casada  que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 9 y 17 años y se dedica en la ciudad de Cartagena al comercio; ella  tiene un pequeño negocio donde vende útiles escolares y mercancía variada de acuerdo a lo que le pidan sus clientes en cada temporada comercial.  El sistema que utiliza Norma para su venta es de contado y también ofrece crédito a sus más seleccionados clientes con  los que tiene un tratamiento preferencial, porque ella   registra en un cuaderno los que estos solicitan y no lo tiene en existencia  para comprarlo y ofrecérselos posteriormente  esta estrategia que agrada y  atrae porque siempre los que la visitan   su negocio se sienten atendidos  y resaltan la importancia que a ellos les da Norma B..
Su credikiva es el  segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará ropa interior, accesorios femeninos, pues se prepara para surtir su negocio a propósito del día de las madres,  pues sabe la gran acogida que tiene  este día  entre sus clientes, porque  todas las mujeres del hogar son agasajadas con regalos y para Norma esto significa más ingresos.
Cuando inició su negocio solo ofrecida productos mediante guías especializadas y poco a poco fue ahorrando y comprando vitrinas y estanterías hasta convertirlo en lo que hoy es,  y con el  proyecta su crecimiento para generar ingresos que le permitan cumplir sus sueños personal, familiares y empresariales.
Este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y organización con la cual  ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales, así como tener un capital de trabajo para surtir su negocio  y diversificarlo, por eso ella puede vender ahora todo lo que sus clientes le solicitan con la seguridad de continuar obteniendo una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor de un 26%.
texts.en:
Norma Bustillos is a married woman who has 2 children between the ages of 9 and 17. She is a merchant in the city of Cartagena. She has a small business selling school supplies and various other merchandise, depending on what her clients demand and depending on the season. Norma completes her sales in cash and she also offers credit options to her preferred clients, those whom enjoy preferential treatment. She registers their requests in a notebook if she doesn't have it in stock for sale. She later offers them the products and this strategy is attractive to her clients because every time they visit her store they feel like they've been served. They feel the importance Norma B. places on them.

This is her second Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and with it she will purchase undergarments, and ladies' accessories. She is getting her business ready for Mother's Day, knowing that she is highly sought out by her clients. Every women in the family is showered with gifts and this results in higher earnings for Norma.

When she started her business she only offered specialized products and gradually she saved money and she purchased display cases and stands, converting it into what it is today. And she expects her business to grow and to generate more income, allowing her to achieve her personal dreams, those of for her family, and for her business. This is her second loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo and it is through this organization that she has managed to improve her living conditions. she also has a working capital to supply her business and to diversify it. This is the reason why she is able to offer her clients whatever they request. She has the assurance that she will continue to obtain sales profits of no less than 26%.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments and ladies' accessories for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand her shop.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha del socorro García es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora de 35 años. Ella inicio hace ocho años con el alquiler de teléfonos con las ganancias emprendió otros negocios como la venta de cosméticos y granos básicos pero vio que generaba mayor ingreso el comercio de productos telefónicos como cargadores, chit, recargas, carcasa…etc. 
Ella invertirá el crédito en cargadores y carcasas, y su meta principal es adecuar el local, tener más surtido de mercadería y llagar a vender celulares.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha del Socorro G. is a hardworking and enterprising woman of 35 years of age. She started her business eight years ago with telephone booths. With her earnings she started up other businesses such as cosmetics sales and sales of basic grains. But she saw that the greatest earning business is the sale of telephone products such as chargers, chips, prepaid cards, cases, etc.

She will invest her loan on chargers and cases. Her principal goal is to supply her store, to have a greater variety of merchandise, and to eventually sell cellular telephones.

loans.use: to purchase cellular phone cases and prepaid cards.

loans.name: Benigno Fredy

texts.es:
Benigno tiene 25 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en casa de sus padres,  en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, específicamente de ovejas y aves de corral. Ella cría a sus animales en algunos ambientes situados en su domicilio, cuando ya ha desarrollado lo suficiente los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona. Esta actividad le permite ayudar en la economía de su familia.

Actualmente desea adquirir alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ovinos y así poderlos vender a un mejor precio en el mercado, esto para lograr seguir creciendo en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Benigno is a 25 year old bachelor.  He lives in his parents’ house in the Tambogrande district, an agricultural area found in the Piura province and region of the same name.  It is more than four hours from Chiclayo city, capital of the Lambayeque region.

For five years, Benigno has raised and sold small farm animals, specifically sheep and poultry.  He raises the animals in corrals located in his home.  When they have developed enough, he offers them for sale to traders in the area.  This activity allows him to help his family financially.

Now he wants to acquire a balanced diet to fatten up his sheep, so that he can sell them for a better price at the market.  This way, he can keep growing his business and improving his quality of life.  This is why he found it fitting to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency].

loans.use: purchase a balanced diet [for his sheep].

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to recondition her store.

loans.name: Jimi

texts.es:
El señor Jimi Emmmanuel V. es un joven trabajador, emprendedor y con visión de 25 años, propietario de un puesto de venta de repuestos de motos. El inicio este negocio hace un año y medio con el fin de sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles todo lo posible a sus dos hijos pequeños. 
El invertirá el crédito en comprar repuestos de motos para aumentar su negocio.
texts.en: Mr. Jimi Emmanuel Venegas is a hard-working young man. He is an entrepreneur, and with the experience of his 25 years, he is the owner of a motorcycle parts store. He started this business a year and a half ago with the goal of helping his family get ahead and provide everything possible to his two small children. He will use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to expand his business.

loans.use: to invest in spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Karla Janett

texts.es:
La señora Karla Janett B. F. es una fémina trabajadora y emprendedora de 37 años la cual inicio su negocio hace dos años cuando adquirió una refrigeradora y empezó a realizar frescos, helados, chocobananos con las ganancias fue surtiendo su negocio y los prestamos le ayudaron mucho para tener una venta sólida.
Ella con el prestamos invertirá en productos en especial los granos básicos (arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles), carne, queso…etc.
texts.en:
Karla Janette B. F. is a hardworking and enterprising 37-year old woman who started her business two years ago. When she acquired a refrigerator she started to make juice drinks, icecreams, and frozen chocolate bananas. With her profits she gradually supplied her business. The loans helped her to achieve solid sales.

She will invest her loan in the purchase of products, especially basic grains (rice, sugar, cooking oil, beans), means, and cheese, etc.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, meats, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy  Torregroza, es un hombre persistente y  decidido que desde el año 2008 alquiló una casa en Villas de San Pablo, macro proyecto de vivienda sostenible en la ciudad de Barranquilla liderado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Fredy con tal de estar cerca de su lote, adquirido mediante financiamiento que le otorgó esta organización y  en la actualidad lo postula para acceder al subsidio del estado para conseguir una vivienda digna para el y su familia.. 
 
Como gran trabajador  desde hace 14 años, se dedica a comercializar de todo un poco de acuerdo a las oportunidades y a la temporada que le proporcione generar ingresos, así puede un día estar  vendiendo ropa, calzado, celulares y otros discos compactos, alimentos etc, con tal de ganar dinero para el sostenimiento de su familia. Sus clientes son principalmente empleados de algunas empresas de la ciudad  a las que propone sus productos y poco a poco se gana la venta y los convierte en sus asiduos compradores. Él vende a crédito y le pagan diariamente, semanalmente o quincenalmente de acuerdo con la caracterización de cada cliente. Fredy es un  buen miembro de familia con sus ingresos ha sacado adelante a su hogar conformado   por su esposa, sus tres hijos de 10, 7 y 2 años y  su madre que también reside con el y está  a su cargo. Con su credikiva    comprará   mercancías que habitualmente comercializa como ropa y calzado  pero esta vez en mayor cantidad,  porque espera que su rentabilidad supere el 50% sobre ventas.
texts.en:
Fredy Torregroza is a persistent and decisive man. In 2008 he rented a house in Villas de San Pablo, a macro project of sustainable housing in the city of Barranquilla, led by Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With the thought of keeping close to his plot of land, he acquired a loan from this organization, with which he is currently in the process of accessing a subsidy from the state to access a dignified home for himself and for his family.

He has been a dedicated worker since the age of 14 and he sells a little bit of everything, depending on opportunities and the season, in order to generate an income. That is to say that one day he will sell clothing, shoes, and cellular phones and another day he will sell compact discs, foods, etc. in order to earn a living for his family. His clients are primarily employees of companies in the city to whom he advertises his products and he gradually makes his sales and converts them into steady clients. He completes his sales in credit, taking payments daily, weekly, or biweekly according to each client's specifications. Fredy is a good member of the family with the income that he has earned for the household. It is composed of his wife, their three children, aged 10, 7, and 2 years old, and his mother who is in his care. With his Kiva loan he will purchase the type of merchandise he normally sells, such as clothing and shoes, but this time in larger quantities. He expects his sales profits to exceed 50%.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as clothing and shoes in larger volumes.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Maria del Socorro es la propietaria del negocio Artesanías Maria, ubicado en el corredor artesanal del estadio Romelio Martínez, antiguo escenario de futbol profesional colombiano; allí comercializa sombreros, bolsos, mochilas, camisetas pulseras y artículos de decoración,  típicos de la región Caribe.  Sus proveedores son turistas que desean llevar suvenires como recuerdos del país y especialmente de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Las mejores temporadas comerciales para el negocio de Maria son los fines de año, la semana santa y los muy reconocidos carnavales,   por parte de los turistas,  que hasta esta ciudad llegan en busca de sana diversión y derroche de alegría del pueblo caribeño. En los 6 años de funcionamiento de su negocio, Maria ha logrado fidelizar una buena clientela y ya es muy reconocida por viajeros que usualmente la visitan.
Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará artesanías autóctonas y detalles para adornar los interiores de las viviendas aprovechando que sus clientes se preparan para para entregar sus regalos en el día de las madres para halagar a las mujeres de sus familias.
texts.en:
Maria del Socorro is the owner of a business named "Artesanias Maria", located in the artisan district of the Romelio Martinez stadium, previously the home of the professional Columbian soccer team. She makes sombreros, handbags, school bags, t-shirts, bracelets, and traditional Caribbean decorations. Her clients are primarily tourists who wish to take souvenirs as momentos of the country and especially of the city of Barranquilla. The best times of year for Maria’s business are the end of the year, Holy Week and the very popular carnivals. The tourists come to all the way to the city in search of healthy diversions and to enjoy the festive Caribbean culture. In the 6 years of operation, Maria has been able to earn a loyal client base and she is well-known by travelers who usually visit her.

This is her first-time Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). She will purchase native crafts and indoor home decorations, especially to take advantage of clients who are getting ready for Mother's Day and to honor the women in their families.

loans.use: traditional crafts and indoor decorations for the home.

loans.name: Enhtur

texts.en:
Enhtur is 36 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He manages a leather-goods manufacturing business with the help of his wife. 

He started his business in 2008 based on experience he gained at Montulga, a manufacturer of leather goods. Since then he has been able to employ two more workers who are specialized in the production of leather souvenirs and gifts intended for foreign tourists. Enhtur himself is responsible for taking orders and introducing his goods to his customers, and his wife is responsible for designing and making goods. 

His wife graduated from the University of Culture and Art with Bachelor of Design. Enhtur is a hardworking man who possesses good managerial skills. He says, "By renewing my equipments and techniques, I want to produce more qualified and fine goods which eventually occupy 10% of the market demand."

He is requesting a 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase new equipment and some materials in order to produce an increased amount of products.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and some materials.

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg is 38 years old and lives with her son in the Songino-hairhan district and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in her older sister's backyard. Her son, age 13, attends a local secondary school. She manages a women's wear trading business in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business in 2002 and gained much experience. Before her business operation, she used to work as a dressmaker at a private clothing manufacturer for three years. Her business was quite successful which allowed her to build a strong customer base. She is planning to continue her business in the future. She is an honest woman who says, "I want to expand my business in order to be able to pay my son's education fee." She is requesting a 500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase more women's clothes and to increase her business sales.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes.

loans.name: Agichuluun

texts.en:
Agichuluun is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Gobi-Altai province, Mongolia. His wife is a student who recently gave a birth and is looking after their son. 

Agichuluun manages a lama service and a grocery trading business in his town. He began his lama service in 2008, after graduation from a religious institution. At his school he learned about Buddhism, with the traditional Tibetan rituals of curing and exorcism which is intended for individual release from suffering and the cycles of rebirth. Now he has become one of the popular monks in his town. 

Last year, Agichuluun began continuing his parent's business of grocery trading. He is an open-minded and serious man who says, "dreams will come true if one's thought is pure." He is requesting a 2,700,000 MNT loan to purchase grocery items for his business and a car in order to start a taxi service business as well.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 52 years old, married, and has 6 adult children. Lilian is engaged managing a general (sat-sari) store. She offers different products such as canned goods, biscuits, soft drinks, detergent soap and condiments. With these activities, Lilian usually earns 3000 PHP a month.

Lilian joined ASKI to gain financial assistance to improve her business. She already paid back a previous loan amounting to 5000 PHP and now is requesting a new loan of the same amount. She will use the loan to buy inventory of products like canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits and soap. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy stock of products like canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits and soap.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 35 years old. Sheila is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Sheila operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Sheila has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Sheila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sheila is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell like shampoo and soap. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Sheila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell, like shampoo and soap.

loans.name: 041021- Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
"Tâm Lê Thị (60) is a 58 year-old female living in the town of Hoằng hoá - Thanh hoá.  Tâm is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 041021- Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường (041021- Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường).


Tâm is married and has 4 adult children. To making a living, Tâm operates a fishing business, harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Tâm has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2002, Tâm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tâm has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  This will be the 8th loan taken out by Tâm from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tâm plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Lê Thị Hợp (113) is a 25 year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


2.  P. Thị Thơm (64) is a 27 year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


3.  Lê Thị Huệ (42) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


4.  N. Thị Đương (30) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tâm Lê Thị (60) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoằng hoá - Thanh hoá.  Tâm là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 041021- Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường (041021- Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở biển trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tâm thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tâm kiếm được khoảng 2,000,000 VND.  Vào 2002, Tâm đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tâm đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5,000,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7,000,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 8th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Lê Thị Hợp (113) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  P. Thị Thơm (64) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  Lê Thị Huệ (42) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  N. Thị Đương (30) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7000000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ Hỗ trợ Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business	.

loans.name: 041017 - Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Cầu P. Thị (59) is 51 years old and lives in the town of Hoằng hoá - Thanh hoá.  She leads a nine-person loan group affiliated with the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.The official name of this group is Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường ( Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường).

Cầu is married, has four grown children and makes a living by catching and selling fish. She has been in this business for 30 years and makes about 2,000,000 VND a month from her work. In 2002, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. Cầu has successfully repaid seven loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women and will use her portion of this one to buy fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.
