She plans to use the additional revenue she earns to continue expanding her business.

About the other borrowers in this group:
1.  P. thị Lý (66) is a 50 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to raise livestock.
2.  Lê Thị Kiểm (98) is a 49 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
3.  T. Thị Thanh (31) is a 29 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
4.  P. Thị Tư (58) is a 56 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to raise livestock.
5.  Lê Thị Hược (33) is a 53 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.
6.  N. Thị Hoà (47) is a 39 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to run her general store.
7.  Lê Thị Vình (70) is a 58 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to raise livestock.
8.  P. Thị Yên (57) is a 32 year-old woman who is requesting a 7,000,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

loans.name: 04.10.19- Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Cúc is 43 years old and lives in the town of Hoằng hoá-Thanh hoá.  Cúc is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 04.10.19- Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường (041019-Giang Sơn-Hoằng Trường.

Cúc is married and has three school-aged children.  To making a living, Cúc operates a family member's business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling wild-caught fish in the local community.  Cúc has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2006, Cúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Cúc has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND, which was used to invest in expanding her business.  She is requesting a new loan of 7,000,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be Cúc's seventhth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Cúc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Thanh is 33 years old and is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 VND to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

2. Mai is 36 years old and s requesting a loan of 7,000,000 VND to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

3.  Tròn is 57 years old and is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 VND to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

4.  Hường is 47 years old and is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 VND to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

5.   Cành is 26 years old and is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 VND to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

6.   Lâm is 32 years old and is requesting a loan 7,000,000 VND to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

loans.use: to purchase net to catch fishes

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 20 years old and a single mother to a 4-month-old baby.  She is engaged in farming. Her parents gave her a parcel of land that she now tills. She grows rice crops to sell at the market. She is also a buyer and re-seller of shrimp.

Joan has requested a loan that she plans to use for buying more shrimp to sell, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Joan hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and shrimps to resell.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.en: Serapio is 75 years old. He is a married man from Trinidad, Bohol. He is engaged in farming. Serapio primarily grows rice crops to sell. He earns 5000 PHP per month from this farming. Serapio wants to improve his earnings. He requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes for his business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 45 years old and is engaged in fishing. She has been selling fish for 25 years. Her husband is a fisherman and he is the one catching fish. 

Josefa sells all of her husband's catch at the market. She is asking for a loan to purchase nets, hooks and other fishing materials. This will help Josefa’s husband to have a larger catch.

loans.use: to purchase nets, hooks and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol sells fish for a living. She is married to a fisherman. Her husband catches the fish and she sells them. Mirasol is happy to have this business because it provides food, clothes and education for her children. Mirasol works hard to improve her business and to earn better. She wants to save for her family’s future.

Mirasol plans to use her loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. In the future, Mirasol hopes to have an additional business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 42 years old. She is a married woman. She lives in Trinidad, Bohol with her family. Her husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Cecilia owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells items like soft drinks and chips. She plans to use her loan to buy more items like noodles, canned goods and shampoo.

In the future, Cecilia hopes to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy more items like noodles, canned goods and shampoo.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Sixty-year-old Erlinda earns a living through farming. She has been growing rice for 40 years. Erlinda has learned to love working at the farm. She is happy to have this business as it provides for her family’s needs.

Erlinda’s loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Erlinda hopes to earn better and be able to help send her grandkids to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Sophen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophen P. (pictured here) is 41 years old and her husband, Mr. Pros Prieng is 49 years old. They live along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have six children--three sons and three daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is a construction worker, two are garment factory workers and other two are in school.   

Mrs. Sophen P. and her husband run a private water utility service. They build a water storage tower and have connected it to houses in the neighbors-heed. In addition, Mr. Pros Prieng is also a fisherman. 

Sophen is asking for his first loan of $500 to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: to repair the house where she lives.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 27 years old and is a married woman with three young children. She is a fish seller. Her husband is a fisherman. Irene sells his catch to the market. She also makes and sells dried fish. Irene earns about 2,400 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this business. She works hard to earn better and save for her cihldren’s future.

Irene’s loan will be used to purchase fishing materials such as hooks and nets.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as hooks and nets.

loans.name: Vicheka

texts.en:
Mrs. Vicheka K. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Pon, live on an Island on Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2005 and have one daughter. 

Vicheka and her husband are weavers. They sell their finished products to a middleman in the village who then in turns to sell in Phnom Penh. In addition the couple also raises pigs at home. 

Vicheka hopes to expand her business raising pigs, so she is applying for a loan of $1,000 US to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ma. Lelebeth

texts.en:
Ma. Lelebeth is a farmer who lives in Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing rice for five years. Ma. Lelebeth sells her harvest to nearby towns. She works hard to provide for her family. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Ma. Lelebeth is 36 years old and is a married woman. She has two children, aged 6 and 10. She hopes for her children to someday finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Symy

texts.en:
Mrs. Symy N. is 33 years old and her husband, Mr. Channo Chai, is 28 years old. They have been married since 2003 and have two young sons. They live along National Road Number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Mrs. Symy N. sells fruit. She buys it from fellow villagers and sells it in a Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a construction worker. 
Symy is requesting her first loan of $800 US to buy a new motorbike to transport her fruit to the market, and also to expand the house where she lives.

Symy and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and expand the house where she lives

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a dried fish dealer. She has been in this kind of business for two years. Esterlita buys fresh fish from fisherman at her town. She dries the fish then sells them to the market. Esterlita has requested a loan and plans to use it to buy more fish to resell.

Esterlita is 50 years old, married and has one child. In the future, Esterlita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: En

texts.en:
Mrs. En H. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Bunthin Roeung, live along National Road Number 6, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have four daughters. Two are in school and the other two are still young. 

Mrs. En H. stays at home. The main source of income is from her husband’s salary. He is a driver, he drives for a brick kiln.

En wants to launch a food vending  business by selling boiled duck eggs, roasted beef, and roasted chicken wings, so she is asking for a loan of $100.

loans.use: to launch a food vending business

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Mrs. Kem C. (pictured above) lives in a village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. She is a widow and has three sons and one daughter. 

She grows different kinds of vegetables on her farmland.

Kem has asked for a Kiva loan once to purchase a motorcycle for her children to ride to work in Phnom Penh. She now wants to buy one more motorbike for family use, so she is asking for another loan of $500 to use for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Buraima

texts.en:
Buraima S. is 57 years old and widowed. She is the mother of two grown sons who live on their own. Now she is the caretaker of her twelve-year-old grandson who is the main helper for her. 

Buraima has been engaged in the cattle breeding business since 1990, which she started in order to find additional means of income. She worked hard and managed to maintain the farm with monthly income in the sum of 8,000 Kyrgyzstani soms (KGS). With the revenues from selling milk products, she was able to plant seeds of tomatoes, cabbage and pepper, which today yield good profits also. 

Now Buraima is applying for a loan of 50,000 soms to buy a milk cow, which will allow her raise her sales of milk. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by further enlarging her cattle herd. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the needs of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 36-year-old married lady. She runs her tailoring business in Kiambu market located in the outskirts of Nairobi town. This market is very busy and receives customers regularly. This is her primary business which she has been doing for years. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by an existing member and this is her third loan from KADET, after succesfully repaying her previous loans well and on time. She has not borrowed from other financial institutions apart from KADET. 

Ann hopes that with this loan she will be able to buy clothing material and a sewing machine so that she can be in a position to grow the business substantially.

loans.use: to buy cloth and a sewing machine for making dresses

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Mrs. Chek T. is a 54-year-old woman who earns a living feeding pigs in a cage behind her house. She currently lives with her three single children who still study in public school and depend on her income. She has run this business since 1998. 

In addition to her pig-raising trade, Mrs. Chek T. and her husband always make Khmer noodles and sell them in bulk to middlemen who then take the noodles to retail at the busy market. Recently, Chek T. used all of the raw materials from her stock and she wants to resupply by asking for a loan to buy rice to stock up in order to produce more Khmer noodles.

loans.use: to buy rice to produce Khmer noodles for continued sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with one boy who attends school. They live at a rental house; it has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, rent bills, food and clothing. 

For the past two years, she has operated a boda boda (motorbike transport) business. She also sells charcoal, which contributes to her other source of income. Josephine faces a major challenge of competition from other motorbike operators in her area of operation. She dreams of purchasing two more motorbikes in the future. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings she is requesting, she wants to purchase 60 sacks of charcoal for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 60 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela is 39 years old, married to an engineer, and has eight children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling bread. Manuela has taken a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Mrs. Ran M. (pictured here) is 39 years old and her husband, Thol Oeurng, is 42 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have two children: one son and one daughter, who are both in school. The family lives in a village off National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ran is a construction worker, while her husband is a Tuk Tuk driver. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her children to get to school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to get to school.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 40 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal. Lina has taken a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 33, married, and a father of one. He and his family live in Gitaru in Kikuyu which is in the outskirts of Nairobi. This is where he has been running his two business; tailoring and an agency for Equity Bank. 

He operates the agency business while his wife takes care of the tailoring business. He has been in this business for a period of five years now, and earns a good income. With this loan, he plans to buy float for the Equity agency business. 

He has never borrowed from other financial institutions and this is his third loan with KADET. He has paid off his previous loans well and on time. He plans to establish a big chain of business in the next five years and also be in a position to invest more in his child's education.

loans.use: to buy float for Equity Banking business.

loans.name: Chanphorn

texts.en: Chanphorn P. is 29 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school.  They live in a village off of National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. Chanphorn and her husband are farmers. They grow water spinach, eggplants, gourds, and mangoes on their farmland in the village. Chanphorn is requesting her first loan of $500, which she will use to purchase additional mango trees for planting.

loans.use: To purchase additional mango trees for planting.

loans.name: Pasdakrad

texts.en: Pasdakrad K. is 29 years old, married, and has one child.  They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Pasdakrad has been operating a business renting out a space of his house. His wife sells rice and food in front of garment factory. He is requestng his first loan of $1,000 to build more rooms to rent.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is 36 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes. Anita has taken a loan to stock more tomatoes to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy veterinary equipment and medicine

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en: Sarun S. is 42 years old, widowed, and has one son who is a lathe operator. The family lives in a village along National Road number five approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sarun sells fruits, which she acquires from her fellow villagers and sells them in Phnom Penh market. She is requesting her first loan of $800, which she will use to purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive to work

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a single woman from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is 33 years old and has had a sari-sari store business for a year. Elvira sells items such as canned goods, coffee and chips to people in her community. She also raises chickens on her small poultry farm. Elvira hopes to acquire more chickens and expand her poultry business.
Elvira is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase chickens, feed and vitamins, and items to sell in her store such as canned goods.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, feed and vitamins, and items to sell such as canned goods

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny K. is 59 years old, married, and has three children, two are married and live outside the family home. She and her husband are weavers.  The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Ny is requesting a loan of $700, which she will use to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and to fill up the land around her house.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and to fill up the land around her house

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa M. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 45 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Marissa owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marissa has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Marissa joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional groceries to sell. Marissa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional groceries to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph T. is 50 years old, married, and has four children. He operates a milk bar and runs a dairy farming business in Mucatha town in Kiambu, which is in the outskirts of Nairobi. He has been doing this for the last two years. Kiambu is relatively busy in terms of business and has a high population as well, which is favorable for any business. He learned about KADET LTD through a friend who was already a member. This is Joesph's first loan with KADET and has not borrowed from any other financiers before.  He is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more milk so that he can get better returns. He hopes  to open another milk bar in a different location.

loans.use: To increase milk stock

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas C. is a humble woman who is shown in the photograph in front of her wooden house. She is blessed with a child who is enrolling in school. 

Meas C. is a Khmer noodle maker, earning approximately $2.50 per day. Her husband works with her to make the noodles. They sell their noodles to other retailers in her area. Aside from this, she also built a small pigpen where she raises pigs for additional income. Meas C. is requesting a loan to purchase rice to stock up for producing Khmer noodles to sell

loans.use: to purchase rice for Khmer noodle production

loans.name: Momo

texts.en:
Momo is a married woman with three boys, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity bills and clothing.
For the past six years, Momo has operated a clothing business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passers-by. Momo faces the major challenge of competition from other clothes sellers in the market and also high transport costs. She dreams of owning a retail shop business in the future. With her loan of 20,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of clothing materials and pay for transport. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothing materials and pay for transport.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan C. (pictured above) is 45 years old and her husband, Mr. Chin C., is 49 years old. They live in a village along National Road number five approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children--three sons and two daughters. One is a garment factory worker, another one is a lathe operator and the other three attend school.  

Lan is a rice farmer. She also runs a business as a food vendor when she is not at the farm. Her husband is a motor remoque driver. (A remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer at the back). Unhappily, the trailer is old and does not work well. It’s upset his business, so he wants to purchase new ones.

That’s why Lan is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to replace the trailer for her husband.

loans.use: to replace the motorcycle trailer for her husband.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 39 years old, married, and has five children, all of whom go to school. She is currently in the business of selling food items at the market. Janet has taken a loan to stock more food items to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more food items to sell.

loans.name: Ruth Nuwajuna's Group

texts.en: Very hardworking, N. Ruth has been operating an agro-produce sales business from Omukagyera, Ibanda for over ten years. The happily married mother has worked tirelessly to make ends meet. She is able to generate 150,000 Ugandan Shillings weekly. She grows various crops that she sells to her customers both at home and the market. Ruth needs a loan to buy fertilizer and improve the production of beans and maize, which she grows most. As this is the rainy season, her hopes are in high gear. Her future plan is to develop her business and ensure that she has a stable family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her banana plantation and improve the production of beans and maize.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline O. is forty years old, married and has two children aged three years old and one year old. Her business is located at Jomvu estate in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean white beaches.

Roseline sells fruits and vegetables which include ripe bananas, kale, onions and others to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are spoilt for choice.  However she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

She is using her loan of 40,000 KES to buy fruits and vegetables to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. Roseline hopes to be a supplier of fruits and vegetables in the future. She also sees herself diversifying her business by starting up a general store in Jomvu. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is currently in a business of selling beans and maize flour. She is 28 years old and married with 2 children who both go to school.

Stella borrowed a loan to stock more beans and maize flour to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more beans and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Stellaphine

texts.en:
Stellaphine M., 39, is married to Steven Kitui, a 40-year-old businessman, and they have four children: Irene, 14 years old in class seven, Evans, 9 years old in class four, Mercy, 3, and Meshack, who is a year old. They live in Lukenya where Stellaphine has run a quarry business for 10 years, earning a monthly profit of Kshs.5,000.

Introduced to Kadet Ltd by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office, Stellaphine is requesting her first loan for 50,000 to purchase another quarry. If the loan boosts her income, she will buy a piece of land upon which to build a house to live in with her family.

Stellaphine describes herself as hardworking and dreams of becoming a prominent business lady.

loans.use: to purchase another quarry

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem P. (pictured here), 61, is a widow with five sons and one daughter. Two are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker and the other two attend school. Unfortunately, another one died. They are living in a suburb of Phnom Penh, approximately 25 kilometers away.  

Sem sells meat and vegetables. She buys them from Phnom Penh market and sells them in her local market. She hopes to expand her business and get extra income to better support her family. So, Sem is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase additional meat and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables and meat for resale.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng S., 55, is a rice farmer living in Kompong Cham province. She has spent most of her life in the rice planting business. She always uses her own farmland to grow her rice crop in both dry and rainy seasons. Most of her planting activity always gets good results and she is able to make an average daily profit of US $1.50. Her husband works with her on the farm and he also buys animals from the villagers, fattens them for a while and then sells them for a profit. Because the animal sales business is the family's main source of income, Seng S. has requested a loan as capital for her husband to buy an extra cow to sell.

loans.use: to buy an extra cow to sell.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a married woman with two school-going children. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing. 

For the past four years, she has operated a coconut-selling business and she sells at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also operates a food stall business which contributes her other source of income. Maimuna faces a major challenge of competition from other coconut sellers in the market. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts and repair her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts and repair her food stall.

loans.name: Narghush

texts.en:
Narghush S. was born in 1959 in Lusahovit village in the area of Ijevan. She got married and moved to Ijevan city when she was 18 years old. Now Narghush has 4 children: three daughters and a son. Two of her daughters are already married and live separately. Unfortunately a year ago Narghush's husband (who was Nor Horizon's client for a long time) died and now Narghush and her children continue their family’s business without him. 

Narghush and her family are running a bakery where they bake white and brown bread, whole meal bread and lavash (a flat bread). Narghush sells the bakery's produce on-site and she distributes bread at two food shops as well. Thanks to her business income, Narghush can solve her family's needs. 
Narghush is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to repair her bakery and to buy a new stove for lavash baking.

loans.use: to repair her bakery and buy new stove for lavash baking

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is in the business of selling green vegetables. She is 35 years old and married with 8 children who all go to school.

Mary borrowed a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 38 years old, married and has five children.  Her oldest child is 32 and the youngest is 17. 

Jessica's husband works as a farmer and fisherman, and she owns and manages a sari-sari (convenience) store.  She sells items like noodles, canned goods and vinegar.  Jessica also bakes bread and sells it at her store.  She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar and inventory for the store.

Jessica hopes the additional income from the business will help her improve their house.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar and inventory for her store

loans.name: Melelo

texts.en:
Melelo M., 48 years old, is a livestock trader in Bissil. She is married to Moses N., 55, and together they have five children: Hillary, 26 and working; Lucy, 18 and in form two; Lillian, 11 and in class six; Segel, 9 and in class four; and Likshon, 5 and in nursery school. 

Melelo was introduced to KADET LTD by another customer who is already registered with KADET. Melelo's business of six years gives her a monthly income of KES 19,500. This loan of KES 50,000 is her first loan from KADET and she plans to use it to buy cows and goats for trading. If the loan boosts her business, Melelo will establish a dairy farm. Melelo's dream is to have a big dairy farm and to sell milk to Kitengela and Kajiado customers. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy cows and goats to sell.

loans.name: Iengly

texts.en:
Mr. Iengly H., 27 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Sreymom Veng (pictured together), 22, live in a village along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2007 and have two young sons, ages 3 years and 4 months old.

Iengly and his wife have been running a business growing bean sprouts for almost one month. He is asking for his first loan of $500 to purchase seeds and materials for planting.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and materials for planting bean sprouts.

loans.name: Ndolo

texts.en:
Ndolo S. is forty years old and married.  His wife is a businesswoman and they have five children, from one to fourteen.  They hope to give their children a good education and send them to a university.

Ndolo's business is located at the busy open air Gikomba market in Nairobi.  He sells clothes to the local people, and he has been in this business for twenty years.  He works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well.  He recently hired an employee and he says the business is profitable.  

His major challenge is financial constraints, so he is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more clothes.  This will help him grow the business and meet the demands of his customers. In the future, he hopes to open stalls for selling clothes and build some rental units.  He describes himself as determined, aggressive and committed to his work.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell in his store.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca, a 35-year-old widow with three children, all in school, has a business selling green vegetables. Rebecca is requesting a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell and hopes to build a concrete house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more car radios.

loans.name: Dayirbek

texts.ru:
Дайырбек Хакимов  родился в селе Чельпек (Иссык-Кульская область),  в котором сейчас и проживает. Дайырбеку 49 лет. Он родился  и вырос в многодетной и среднеобеспеченной семье c одиннадцатью детьми, и после окончания школы не смог продолжить обучение в университете из-за тяжелого материального положения.  Дайырбек поступил в техникум  на специальность ветеринар  и параллельно помогал родителям по хозяйству. В 1982-1985 гг. отслужил в армии, служба в которой  помогла закалить его характер. По приходу из армии, Дайырбек начал работать в родном селе ветеринаром  и до сих пор сельские жители обращаются к нему за помощью. В 1996 году, в поисках дополнительного  источника  существования для своей семьи, он решил заняться сельским хозяйством, которое давало большую прибыль, так как к тому времени Дайырбек женился и у него родилась дочь. Дайырбек начал бизнес с 20,000 сом (KGS), купив одну корову и одного бычка для откорма и на сегодняшний день, в его хозяйстве имеется одна дойная корова, одна лошадь и десять овец.  
На данный момент Дайырбеку необходимы денежные средства  в сумме  60, 000 сом  (KGS) для увеличения поголовья скота и расширения бизнеса, так как растут расходы на обучение.  Уже сегодня нужно начать копить деньги на обучение детям в хорошем университете, чтобы они смогли получить достойное образование. 
  Но на этом Дайырбек останавливаться не хочет и в его планах на будущее - покупка кошары с земельной долей и увеличение поголовье скота.
Трудолюбивый  и целеустремленный, ответственный и пунктуальный человек,  оптимист по жизни мечтает создать все условия для счастливой жизни своим детям и дать им уверенность  в завтрашнем дне. 
ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" предоставляет кредиты по линии Кива для социально-уязвимых слоев населения. ЗАО МФК "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" является одной из лидирующих Микрофинансовых организаций Кыргызстана. "Бай-Тушум и Партнеры" – это надежный финансовый партнер, осуществляющий вклад в развитие экономики Кыргызской Республики путем предоставления доступных микрофинансовых услуг в сельской местности и городах, способствующих созданию рабочих мест и отвечающий интересам своих клиентов и инвесторов.
texts.en:
Dayirbek K. was born in the village of Chelpek (in the Issyk-Kul province) where he lives now. Dayirbek is 49 years old. He was born and grew up in a big middle class family with eleven children, but after graduating from high school he could not continue his education in the university due to a difficult financial situation. Dayirbek has enrolled in a technical school with a major in veterinary and at the same time was helping his parents in business. In 1982-1985 he served in the army which helped strengthen his character. After returning from the army Dayirbek began to work in his home village as a veterinarian and to this day the village residents come to him for help. In 1996 in search of an additional source of income for his family he decided to start a business in farming which gave big profits as at that time Dayirbek got married and his daughter was born. Dayirbek started his business with 20,000 KGS and bought just one cow and one calf for feeding, and at this time he has one milk cow, one horse and ten sheep.

Right now Dayirbek needs financial help in the amount of 60,000 KGS to increase the head count of cattle and expansion of business because education expenses are growing. He has to start saving money now for his children's education in a good university so they can get a decent education. But Dayirbek does not want to stop there and his other plans for the future include purchase of a fold with plot of land and increase of cattle head count.

He is hard working and single-minded, responsible and punctual person with an optimistic outlook on life and dreams for creating conditions for a happy life for his children and give them confidence in the days ahead.

ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An T. (pictured in the photo with her daughter), 63, is a widowed mother with five sons and four daughters. Four of the children are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker and three assist their mother in the business. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.  

Although An is old, she is still strong enough to work. An grows jasmine flowers. She also buys additional jasmine flowers and bananas from fellow villagers and lets her daughter sell them in the Phnom Penh market. An is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase more small jasmine trees to plant and bananas to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more small jasmine trees to plant and bananas to resell.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicila, a 21-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is in school, currently operates a business selling bread. Cicila has requested a loan to stock more bread to sell and hopes to pay her children's school fees in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 4 calves.

loans.name: Bunny

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunny K., 39 years old, and her husband, Mr. Vanna Kong, 38 years old, (pictured together) have been married since 1991 and have four children: two sons and two daughters, all of whom are in school. The family lives in a village on National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Bunny sells kitchenware in the local market. Her husband is a carpenter. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to expand her business by purchasing additional kitchenware for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional kitchenware for resale.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen S. is a motorcycle taxi driver living in a village in Siem Reap province. He always uses his own motorcycle to earn a daily income. Chen S.’s wife sells fresh fish in the local market in order to share family responsibilities with Chen S.. The couple usually earns around US $5 a day. Chen S. has six children: one is married and the others are single. Chen S. will use his loan to repair his old house. The rest will be used to get a new motorbike.

loans.use: to repair his old house and to get a new motorbike.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda, a 38-year-old married mother of six children, operates a business selling seaweed. Her husband is a seaweed farmer, so she sells his harvest and  also buys from other farmers. In this business for two years, Hilda earns about 4000 PHP per month. She is now requesting a loan of 6000 to buy more seaweed to resell.  In the future, she wants her business to be stable.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed to resell.

loans.name: Onon

texts.en:
Onon G. is 35-year-old widow who lives with her daughter in an apartment in the Yaarmag Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband died a year ago and she was left alone with her daughter who attends local secondary school. 

She manages a clothing-making business in Ulaanbaatar city. She started her business based on her designer qualifications and skills. She graduated from the Institute of Art with a bachelor's degree in design in 1998. Her business has been quite successful, which has allowed her to employ four more workers. She is planning to continue her business in the future. 

Besides managing her business operation, she works as a bursar at a private company. She is a hardworking woman who says, "I love my job and I want to continue it."

She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a sewing machine and some materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and some materials

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyneang K., 33, is a widow with two daughters, who attend school. Her elderly mother also lives with her. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sreyneang sells porridge and Khmer noodles, or Num Banh Chok, which is considered the national dish of Cambodia and can be served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumber. In addition, she also weaves silk in her free time. Sreyneang is asking for her first loan of $250 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials.

loans.name: Koemly

texts.en:
Mr. Koemly C., 41 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Pot You, 40 years old, live approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and two daughters. One works along with his father and the others are still young. 

Koemly is a construction worker. His wife stays at home and does housework. Koemly's son wants to launch a new business fixing flat tires and motorbikes and cleaning cars. Koemly is requesting a loan of $1,000 to help with his son’s business by purchasing an air compressor and car washing materials.

loans.use: To purchase an air compressor and car washing materials for his son's business.

loans.name: Gavharkhon

texts.ru: Бобоева Гавхархон проживает в городе Худжанд. Возраст, 61 год. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Её муж работает охранником, а сын предприниматель. Сама она имеет высшее образование, экономист. По профессии не работает. Она более 15 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном она продает мужскую одежду. Кредит просит для покупки летних футболок.
texts.en: Gavhakrhon B. lives in the city of Khojend. She is 61 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband works as a security guard and their son is a businessman. She has a higher education as an economist. She does not work in her specialty.  She has been working in the market for more than fifteen years.  She sells primarily men's wear. She is asking for a loan to buy summer tee shirts.

loans.use: to buy summer tee shirts

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Mrs. Sambath Y. is a widow with one son and three daughters. One of her children attends school and the others have full-time employment. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.    

Sambath is a garment factory worker. She is asking for her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Phlek

texts.en: Phlek K. raises cows in the stall under her house located in the Dongkor commune of Phnom Penh. She has been raising cows since 2009, earning an approximate daily profit of $3.33 to cover daily expenses. Phlek K. is blessed with two children who are enrolled in public school, and her husband is a police officer. Phlek K. also sells a few grocery items in front of her house for extra income. She will be using her loan of US $800 to add to her current savings in order to purchase a new motorcycle for the whole family's traveling needs.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for the whole family's traveling needs.

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena P. is engaged in fishing. Her husband is a fisherman and the one who manages their fishing boat. Ma. Lorena sells his catch to the market. Lorena said they have been in this business for 14 years. She is asking for a loan to repair their pumpboat and purchase fishing nets and hooks. 

Ma. Lorena works hard to support her family. She has five children, two girls and three boys. Her oldest child is 13.

Ma. Lorena hopes to earn better. She hopes to buy another fishing boat to expand their business.

loans.use: to repair the pumpboat and purchase fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur B. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Her husband manages a bag-trading business at a local market. Her older son is a student while the younger one is a pupil. 

Gantumur manages a clothing-making business at her rented workshop. She started her business in 2000 and has managed to stabilize it. Before her business operation, she worked as a nurse and as a tailor for several years. Now she is well known and well respected among her customers. 

Her working capital has reached 1,000,000 MNT with daily earning of 30,000 MNT. She is a diligent woman who says, "My husband and I work hard in order to feed my children. So we lack time to spend with our children." 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials used in making clothes in order to sell them during the time of student graduation paries.

loans.use: To purchase materials used in making clothes.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr: Jean Claude M. est commerçant des téléphones mobiles, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Il a 37 ans, il est marie, et il a 4 enfants entre 1 an et 12 ans.  Trois de ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il est ne au Rwanda, et il a fini 3 ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit et son quatrième cycle avec ACB, et il a une bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 paires de téléphones avec 2 cartes SIM ; 5 paires marquent TIGO, 5 paires marquent MTN, et des autres choses pour son business.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de solliciter beaucoup de crédits en vue d’augmenter la capacité du projet, et l’utilisation des meilleurs matériels dans son business.  Il voudrait devenir un grand business-man.  Pour sa famille, il voudrait assurer leur bien-être, et bâtir d’autres maisons d’habitation a louer.
texts.en:
Jean Claude M. sells mobile phones. He became a client of ACB in 2009. He is 37 years old and married with four children aged 1 to 12 years old, three of whom attend school. Jean Claude was born in Rwanda, and he completed three years of high school. 

This is his fourth loan cycle with ACB, and he correctly repaid all previous loans. He will use his loan to buy 10 pairs of phones with two SIM cards, namely 5 pairs of TIGO and 5 pairs of MTN, as well as other items. 

His business growth strategy is to obtain plenty of financing in order to bolster his working capital, and to use the best merchandise in the business. He wishes to become a great businessman, to ensure his family’s well-being, and to build dwelling houses to rent.

loans.use: to buy 10 pairs of mobile phones with SIM cards (5 MTN and 5 TIGO), and other items to sell

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie is 45 years old. She has seven children who are between 9 and 24 years old. They are all in school. Her husband is a farmer. 

Sophie sells sorghum and she has been selling sorghum for the past four years. This business has enabled her to feed her family and meet her needs. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more sorghum for sale. She plans to save all her profits and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan C. is currently in the business of selling charcoal. She is 30 years old, married and has three children. Two of them go to school. 

Susan borrowed a loan to stock more charcoal to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future with extra profits from her loan.

loans.use: to stock more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Kasenyanku Community Group

texts.en:
Mary N., 49, has sold fruits and vegetables for the past 32 years in the Mpigi trading center. She was at first a farmer. At length she wanted to open new business horizons for herself. It was around that time that she decided to diversify into her current business. She also has a side business in fish selling. 

The happily married mother of seven says her business generates 180,000 UGX weekly as profit. She says with this loan, she is going to purchase more fresh fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia R. is a married woman with three children. She is 42 years old and runs a sari-sari (variety store) business.

Alicia sells items like shampoo, soap and canned goods. She usually earns about 3,000 PHP per month with her business.

Alicia is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as sugar and canned sardines. 

In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her store. She also hopes to see her children graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like sugar and canned sardines.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 24 years old. She has two children who are ages 3 and 7 years. One child is in school. 

Alphonsine owns a milling machine and she has been running it for two years. This milling machine has enabled her to build a small family house. 

She also owns a shop in which she sells different items that are commonly needed at home. 

She is requesting a loan to buy another milling machine, which she expects will earn her more money.

loans.use: to buy a milling machine

loans.name: Mher

texts.en:
Mher G. was born in 1978 in the Koti village area of Ijevan, and he still lives in his native village. Mher is married and has two sons (3 and 5 years old).
 
Mher, his wife and his mother are engaged in animal breeding, land cultivation, gardening and beekeeping. They raise cows, calves and chickens; grow wheat, oat, grapes, fruits and vegetables on their farm. With income from farming Mher supports his family and he was able to buy needed furniture for his house.

This is Mher’s seventh loan from Nor Horizon, and he has never delayed his repayments. Now he is seeking an 820,000 AMD loan to buy a cow, four piglets and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy a cow, four piglets and fodder for his farm animals.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita A. is in the business of selling green vegetables. She is 20 years old, married and has two children, one of whom goes to school. 

Rita borrowed a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell. She hopes to build a concrete house in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.en:
Dionisio is 40 years old and married with an eight-year-old child. He is in the business of selling ready-to-wear clothes and he also sells slippers and sandals. In addition, Dionisio started a fried chicken business a year ago and earns 4,500 PHP a month selling fried chicken. Dionisio said the reason he started another business is to better provide for his family, especially his child’s education. He also wants to save for his family’s future.

Dionisio is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to sell and to buy chicken meat and oil for his fried chicken business. In the future, he hopes to be able to build a better house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell and to buy chicken meat and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is 31 years old and married with five children. She runs a sari-sari (general) store and sells items such as canned goods, detergent, soap and shampoo to people in her community. Jenefer buys and sells fresh fish as well. She also dries fish to sell. 

Jenefer is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as soap, shampoo, and fish.

loans.use: to buy items such as soap, shampoo, and fish to sell

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.en:
Marie Therese is 23 years old and has an 11-month-old child who is too young to go to school. She owns a shop where she sells different items such as sandals, juice, shoe polish and spare parts. Marie has been running her shop for the past three years and her business has enabled her to feed her family and build a small house. 

Marie is requesting a loan to buy items for her shop such as shoe polish, different juices, etc. She hopes to increase her profits and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy items such as shoe polish and juice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets of iron

loans.name: Marlo Jay

texts.en:
Marlo Jay is 19 years old and single. He is a fisherman who helps support his family. Marlo Jay earns 4,000 PHP a month from his business. He works hard to help provide for his family and to save for his education. Marlo Jay wants to go back to school and finish college.

Marlo Jay is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets and hooks. In the future, he hopes that his family’s living conditions will be better.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and hooks
